title: Wonderful Hotel
text: Great hotel, amenities and people. Love it here. Have stayed here more than once and will continue to come back. Great location, centrally located. Safe neighborhood. They always make it easy. Except for this review wanting a minimum of 200 characters.

title: A week in March in Manhattan.
text:
We stayed for a week in this excellent hotel.
We took a Queen size double room for the two of us and our 7 year old granddaughter. The room was very well maintained and the beds comfortable.
Services:
The reception staff are professional and very pleasant.
The continental breakfast is generous and served at the table.
The most undeniable, the indoor swimming pool and its Hamann (great after long walks).
The location of the hotel is exceptional, all of Manhattan is accessible on foot! Otherwise you have the metro 50 meters away.
In short, we highly recommend this establishment.

title: Best is the city so far.
text: Lesly, Lesly, Lesly…as the room was beautiful, the indoor pool and Turkish bath was amazing. Nothing rivals the service given by the front desk hostels Lesly. Very accommodating and hassle free. And make sure you get the balcony rooms if available. Will be booking again.

title: NYC2024 The Marmara Hotel, Park Ave
text:
All round great servicve. Very professional and polite staff. Very Hapy to help. Great amenities.♥️ Room, Gym, Pool.
Loved the pillows, great sleep and shower was awesome. 
Location was perfect for roaming NYC, 
Only thing I’d change, heat up the pool🫣🤣

title: Great service and pool
text: Loved the service. Mayerly was very helpful and got me into a room early so I could take an important business call. The gym, pool and stream room were a great perk too and the robes. I have been here before and I’ll be back again. Enjoyed to coffee as lobby and of course the central location is prefect. Thank you!

title: Outstanding!
text: Lesly accommodated us for our stay. It was an amazing experience. Room was phenomenal and the service was beyond my expectations. I definitely would love to run into customer service experiences such as with Lesly. I will love to come back!

title: To do and redo
text:
Top bedding, a large bedroom equipped with a beautiful kitchen where everything has been planned for family meals.
Coffee and tea available. Also a breakfast buffet in the hall.
Clean, and attentive staff, all available and pleasant. Very well located, a metro station right next door.
A wonderful memory of this hotel, we will come back for sure.
Plus a swimming pool, a little cold for me, but very pleasant, as well as a hammam also available.

All staff were very attentive and genuinely nice! Room had a fantastic street view of the city. Hammam and pool were amazing experiences 10/10 would stay again. Mayerly especially at the front desk was a delight and helped us navigate our NYC trip.

title: Thank you for helping us create a wonderful memory!
text: I had such a lovely stay! The front staff was amazing, specially Lesly, she made sure everything with check in went smoothly, she made sure the surprise for my boyfriend was amazing. I informed the hotel that I would be having a delivery arriving at the hotel before my check in & Lesly handled everything & even took it to my room. Anything I needed to make this day special for us, Lesly helped with everything to make this surprise happen, she went above and beyond! I will definitely be coming back. The room was beautiful too! Spacious, great view! Bed was excellent, room service as well. Honestly I have no complaints! This will be a go to hotel destination for me.

title: Peacefull last day in the big city.
text: Nice vibe, friendly staff, building just a little bit older. Nice coffee in rooms, I loved the IPad with the music choises. Great breakfast, Nice pool with friendly staff also, we booked this hotel for our last day (flight canceled) en we were glad we came here to find some rest.

title: Overall nice stay!
text: My husband and I stayed one night here. It is definitely small (lobby area) but elegant/modern. The food is also delicious and the staff are helpful & kind. Swanky vibes for sure! Pleaseeeee heat the pool better tho, it was very chilly. Also the shower in the room very odd - theres half glass - so its open. Weird! But the room super cozy with comfortable bed! Everything pricey but thats too be expected. Hillstone restaurant in walking distance which was fantastic! Starbucks right next to the hotel. Id recommend for a short stay. My husband and I want to come back to check out the rooftop bar!

title: Great stay
text:
Our stay at the Marmara Hotel turned out to be a truly memorable experience, far exceeding our expectations. Right from the start, we were met with warmth and hospitality that made us feel right at home. A special shoutout to Mayorlie, whose attentiveness and dedication to ensuring our comfort were nothing short of remarkable. Her efforts added a personal touch to our stay that set this hotel apart from others we've visited.

The hotel's location in the heart of New York is one of its most compelling features. Nestled centrally, it provided us with unparalleled access to the city's vibrant life. Whether we were interested in exploring the cultural landmarks, indulging in the culinary delights, or simply soaking in the bustling atmosphere of New York, the Marmara Hotel served as the perfect base. Its proximity to major attractions meant that we were never far from our next adventure, allowing us to make the most of our time in the city.

Moreover, the hotel itself boasts an elegant design that blends modern aesthetics with comfort. The rooms are spacious, well-appointed, and bright, providing a serene retreat from the hustle and bustle.

In addition to the physical attributes of the hotel, the service quality truly sets the Marmara Hotel apart. The staff went above and beyond to accommodate our needs, offering recommendations, assistance, and a level of care that was genuinely heartwarming. This level of service, combined with the hotel's prime location and luxurious amenities, made our stay an unforgettable experience.

In conclusion, our time at the Marmara Hotel was thoroughly enjoyable. Thanks to Mayorlie and the entire staff for everything. Their dedication to excellence and the central location of the hotel in New York contributed significantly to our delightful stay. We left with beautiful memories and a keen desire to return.

title: The great hotel of new york
text: The Marmara hotel is the best hotel I ever stayed at. The staff are so nice and come to your every need. The rooms are so cozy and the beds are so comfortable. The hamam is amazing. I felt like I was in Turkey. The pool is so great and so clean.  The view is amazing. Its so close to the Empire State Building. We took a lot of selfies. I really enjoyed the stay. Thank you Marmara. I will be back!

title: Chic and Upscale Atmosphere
text: The staff was 5 Star!  They were amazingly kind and accommodating during our stay.  Such a chic and upscale atmosphere for a highly competitive room price. The gym and lap pool are fantastic. We’ve stayed in other hotels and Airbnbs in NYC when we visit family, but Marmara is like no other. We’ll return here every time after this!  I can’t say enough good about this place!

title: Amazing engagement proposal
text: Absolutely amazing. Unforgettable experience‼️‼️ the luxury and ambiance is everything. The room was very clean and the staff was very nice. Spending Valentine’s Day there with my loved one. My man decorated the room and did a splendid proposal. Issa fiancée

title: Wonderful spot for a couple getaway
text: The staff was very professional and attentive, Leslie was outstanding! The hotel is beautiful and very well taken care of.  We really enjoyed the heated pool and the Turkish Hammam room (steam room). Woke up the next day to complementary coffee and snacks in the lobby.

title: Space, hospitality, attentiveness, comfortable lodgings
text: Lots of space, easy to walk everywhere, I had an apartment with kitchen and happy that Trader Joe and Whole Foods was right down the street, service very accommodating , helpful staff, Lesly was exceptional always open to help, suggest and listen to our needs

title: Unexpected Gem!
text: I chose this hotel because it was close to where we needed to be the following day, there were good restaurants nearby, and there was a garage just a few steps away (it was miserably cold and rainy on the day we drove in). Not only was the hotel itself absolutely delightful but we received a room upgrade to a larger, even better room than the one I had booked and the service was not just impeccable, but incredibly friendly from check-in to check-out. (Bonus - a working Peloton bike in the fitness center!). Mayerly was working Reception when I checked out and was perfectly lovely. Well done, Marmara Park Avenue. This will not be our last stay here.

title: Great experience
text:
Really friendly staff and nice gym, pool and Turkish bath. Incredible for such a central location in the middle of NYC. Staff helped with any questions we had and the room was spacious and clean.

Too bad the rooftopbar was closed, but makes sense looking at the season

title: Best experience of a very seasoned New York frequenter who was a New Yorker himself once
text: I have been visiting NY at least 2-3 times a year for the last 20 plus years, and this has been by far my best experience. No exaggeration. Extremely cozy and sophisticated in a non-condescending way. No more looking around for me any more.

title: Not a great experience. Ambiguous policies
text:
Unfortunately having to leave a bad review for this hotel. I had booked this through work via a booking system and it was fully paid. When I arrived they refused to accept my work E-credit card for security (provided by the booking company partner we use) and wanted full amount plus security to hold on my personal card or suggested I pay cash (absolutely not…. What a strange request to ask of someone?)
This wasn’t something I was prepared to do as I travel 30% of my time and every hotel has always accepted the booking card for security payment so I booked an Uber and went to the virgin hotel instead.

None of this information was visible on their website or policies when I went to view this and none of this information had been shared with myself or the booking provider in advance. 

I wouldn’t stay here again and have suggested to our booking company to remove this hotel from their hotels that they are partnered with.

title: worst experience
text: The water in the indoor pool was so cold that the water we touched in the ocean in the morning seemed warmer, and this was at the end of December. The hotel is shabby and tattered, it is clear that there has been no renovation there for a long time. The staff does not respond to requests and demands; they generally do not care that the guest is dissatisfied. Don't waste your money on this hotel, it's not worth half the money they price it at.

title: Best Manhattan Hotel for Events
text: The staff was above and beyond for us! We stayed for our wedding weekend and they did everything in their power to make it spectacular for us - and it was! Will absolutely stay again and recommend to friends!

title: Extremely average
text: Extremely overpriced for what you get. One of the elevators didn't work the entire time we were there. Very tiny bathroom and tiny sink (no counter space for personal items). Ceiling tile collapsed into the bathroom while we were there and had to fix that. A lot of street noise (sirens, motors). Pro's: close to green line for subway, housekeeping and doorman were helpful/good. Food was overpriced and not good. Pretty much an overpriced, average NY property. I was hoping to be wow'ed and never was.

title: Beautiful, modern and private boutique 5 star hotel in New York at 32nd off Park Avenue
text:
Thank you to Mayerly and Lezly at the Marmara and the entire team for making my stay a memorable and pleasant one in New York in November.

I came on business for 10 days to New York and was away from the hotel most of the day but I always enjoyed my mornings and late nights there and the bar area in the lobby is also a great place to work in peace and quiet and have privacy and a beautiful modern workspace.

I really enjoyed the Marmara off Park Avenue which has a nice boutique feel to the hotel with spacious rooms that for me featured a kitchen and office area and the main lobby is very modern and chic in terms of interior design.

The hotel room was large and minimalist in design but comfortable with lovely built in wardrobes and I was on the 14th floor.

The staff at the hotel were always very accommodating and polite as are the door staff.

I would really recommend this hotel to anyone looking to s

title: Ambiance Overload
text:
During our recent stay at the Maramara Park Ave Hotel, we encountered a stay that was as intriguing as it was unique. The hotel's distinct ambiance, characterized by moody, dimly lit hallways and rooms, imparted a particular atmosphere that, while captivating for some, might not entirely align with everyone's tastes. One noteworthy issue we faced was a light out over the closet, which created a visibility challenge. Though we reported it, the solution came in the form of lamps rather than a light bulb replacement. 

The room's temperature controls presented their own quirk, seemingly adhering to a consistent temperature of around 69 degrees, regardless of our adjustments for heating or cooling. Nonetheless, the hotel's location close to the subway was undeniably convenient, although it's vital to mention that the nearby food pantry attracted a lot of displaced individuals, leading to their occasional presence around the building. Additionally, on the day we checked out, one of the elevators was unfortunately out of service, causing a bit of a bottleneck.

In terms of rating, the Maramara Park Ave Hotel seems to sit comfortably within the realm of a 3-star experience, not quite reaching the pinnacle of a full 5-star establishment. 

Despite these nuances, the hotel's rooms were a breath of fresh air—spacious, comfortable, and perfect for unwinding. The darker ambiance might not suit everyone, but for those who appreciate a cozier setting and prioritize a conveniently located stay, it offers a unique charm.

One distinctive touch we encountered was the pervasive scent of bergamot throughout the hotel. While some might find it pleasant, I personally found it a touch overpowering, especially as it extended to the soaps and lotions provided.

Overall, the Maramara Park Ave Hotel offers an experience tailored to those who appreciate its specific atmosphere, convenient location, and unique scent. It's an excellent choice for those seeking something a bit different, but perhaps not the best fit for those desiring a more traditional or versatile accommodation experience.

title: Excellent Service & Beautiful, Stylish NYC Hotel
text:
I happened upon this hotel, through the recommendation of a friend (he made several suggestions in trying to help me identify a hotel for my stay in NYC). I really wanted to have a fridge & microwave in my room and this is not an easy thing to find in NYC unless one pays top dollar. I was hesitant at first, because it isn't located in an area I was looking. It's on the east side, Murray Hill.
Literally from the first phone call I made to the moment I checked out, every single one of the people who work at this establishment were professional, kind, helpful & so, so friendly. I cannot say enough about the level of their professionalism & service; both those who are the face of the hotel in reception, etc. and those in the reservations office. Before checking in, I was given a little tour, on request. I was given literally every single thing I asked for during my stay (extra coffee for the Nespresso machine in the room, for eg!). Nothing was too much of an ask! And they managed to maintain this level of service throughout my stay, which was 12 nights in total, with a short break in between. I even requested the same room on my three-night return and they obliged.
The hotel itself is stylish and has a "boutique" feel. There's gentle, calming music in the lobby. The restaurant is in the lobby too, but slightly "hidden" around a corner, so there isn't a busy feel to it. There is lounge-type seating on one side of the lobby and tables/ chairs for the restaurant, on the other. So one has a plethora of choices of where to chill, should one not want to be in the room or on the streets. Their roof top bar has gorgeous views & excellent service. My room had a balcony and was so much larger than anything else I've seen anywhere, far less in NYC. Much to my surprise for a NYC hotel, it was also really quiet.
Lastly, the hotel has a wellness centre in it's basement. Besides massage services (at a cost, obviously), there is a gym, a hammam and slightly heated, SALT WATER(!!!) pool that is just glorious.
I was so glad that I got over my desire to be in a different neighbourhood of the city, because I loved this hotel so very much and will definitely return. I got used to that side of town pretty quickly. It also helps that the number 6 train (that runs all along the east side of the city) is a half a block from the hotel's front door! And there are buses on every avenue on either side of the hotel. As one who loves Indian food, "Little India" is three blocks away, where one has an endless number of restaurant choices at the most reasonable costs. Of course, there are other cuisines and restaurants in the area too, all within a few blocks

title: Excellent staff and service
text: Mayerly at the front desk was very helpful and friendly. She was knowledgeable and helped me upgrade my room to a suit. I will surely choose this hotel again. I would say that my stay was very satisfactory and the hotel had excellent amenities.

title: Turkish bath, rooftop bar & indoor pool?! YES, PLZ
text: It’s difficult finding such a tranquil spot in the middle of the; Empire State Bldg, Rockefeller Bldg  & Grand Central Station! The amenities are incredible & Staff goes beyond exceptional costumer service, especially Mayerly. I’ll highly recommend this hotel to anybody wanting tranquility in chaotic Manhattan.

title: Great experience
text: Mayerly was wonderfull and helpfull through my stay. It was a pleasure seeing her smiling face every morning. The entire staff was great. Gokhan the operations manager was hands on and with a great hospitality skills

title: Mayerly was exceptional
text: Service at the front desk was first class. Although I arrived at 7am, Mayerly found a way so I could refresh myself whilst I waited for the room to be ready. She was really nice & helpful on every step of the process. JM

title: Marmara Park Ave scores a 10/10!
text:
My stay at the Marmara Park Avenue has been absolutely amazing. From the comfortable and spacious rooms, to the luxurious amenities, and outstanding service, everything is perfect! I highly recommend staying here, you'll be glad you did. 

A special thank you to Herdi at the front desk for going above and beyond to make my stay here so remarkable!

title: MarMara
text: Mayerly is amazing and a great attribute for the MarMara hotel. She is always friendly and welcoming. She remembers my name and helps support my travel needs and changes as a commuter.  The hotel staff is very attentive.

title: Wonderful stay in NYC
text: I had a wonderful time here! The room was great, very quiet, bed was so comfortable, the food was delicious, overall the stay felt very luxurious. Mayerly at the front desk was very pleasant and helpful! Will stay here again

title: Modern and comfortable
text: Staff is excellent. Room service is very good. Rooms are spacious and beds very comfortable. Mayerly is exceptional, courteous, very helpful and high energy. She made my stay even more pleasant. Look fwd to be back

title: Service Excellence
text: Always love the service & staff at Marmara. Want to acknowledge Mayerly at the front desk, who has always been very helpful, during my stays. I also love the new rooftop lounge and the upgraded gym/pool.

title: Amazing Mayerly !
text: Mayerly provided outstanding service from checkin to checkout. Extremely solution oriented. Will happily be back. It is the ideal location for business in New York. Walking distance from everything. :)

title: Fees!
text: Beware of this hotel. They charge you $150 for early check-in even if you walk in early and they have a room available. That is - you're not asking for a guaranteed room, just happen to be in town a little earlier in the day. So if you're looking for some nice customer service on that front, go elsewhere.

title: Avoid this is a 3 start hotel at best
text:
This was very disappointing and not at all like a 5 star hotel.  The check-in took 30 minutes of waiting as the one member of staff dealt with the group ahead of us and apparently no one else could help.  The room had a shower that flooded the whole bathroom floor - wet-room and some!  The light was broken so you could not read the aircon -- several calls to ask to mend the lights and towels for the flooding all went unanswered.  Every attempt to talk to staff in the lobby they were too busy to help.  
In terms of amenities, the pool surround was dirty and pool over chlorinated.  The pool showers have nowhere to put the shower gel and also flooded the floor.  The towels and robes were old and scratchy.  There is also no food or drink after 12 and door men are a hit an miss affair if you want help with luggage, etc.
You can forgive a lot if people try to make amends (stuff happens), like giving us the drink we ordered while waiting to check in, etc..  However, the staff, with the exception of the bar guys in the lobby and one doorman, were rude and surly.  A lot of the time the staff seemed to just be on their phones or away from their desks (and no one covers for them).  Checking out we said we were disappointed and the lady just shrugged her shoulder - message  "Like I care"!

title: Super!
text: It was an absolute pleasure to stay at the Marmara Park Avenue for 4 months. The staff is super helpful, kind and always available to support you. I would like to specially mention Leslie and Floyd who were constantly making sure I feel comfortable and happy with my stay.

title: Excelente hotel, hermoso, moderno y la atención extraordinaria
text: Precioso hotel, la decoración muy linda, los servicios excelentes. En la recepción nos atendió Mayerly, muy amable y servicial. El desayuno muy rico, las habitaciones son preciosas, tienen un pequeño espacio de cocina con cafetera y para hacer té.

title: Exceptional value for very high quality and super spacious accommodation
text: I have just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Manmara Parkm with my husband and three kids (12, 9, 9).  Lots of lovely things to say here.  1.  The hotel has a fabulous location for exploring the city - you can pretty much get anywhere pretty fast and there is a subway station only moments away.  2. The size and quality of accommodation is unlike anything I've had in New York before for the money - we were a family of 5 in a two bedroom suite and we had SO MUCH SPACE - it was AMAZING VALUE.  We had two full size bedrooms (the second bedroom could also accommodate an full-size extra bed for our third child), two bathrooms (the master en-suite being enormous), a lounge and full kitchen plus washing machine and separate dryer for those who need to turn some clothes around).  We were blown away by the space and comfort this provided. 3. The bed and sheets are super comfy - loved them 4. There is a pool, gym and turkish bath for a bit of jet lag recovery / exercise (including a Peloton Bike) 5. There is a restaurant and rooftop bar - I have to admit to not taking advantage of these as we were out and about, but they are here if you want. 6. The staff are fabulous - super friendly and helpful.  In particular, I would like to give a big shout out to Lesley and Angie who helped us with a late check out on our final day when our flight home got cancelled and we needed time to sort out a plan - THANK YOU plus, Mayerly, who checked us in and was super kind to our son who was travel sick and vomited on the lobby floor as he entered the hotel after the car journey from the airport.  You were an angel and we won't forget your kindness.  THANKS MANMARA PARK - you rocked.

title: Very Disappointed
text: Service has deteriorated very badly since May 2023, no bell hop to help with check in. Asked for car service to fetch from airport. Hotel confirmed in writing. No car pick up. Tried to call the hotel No one at the desk tried 7/8 times. Eventually my son had to go & ask personally what was going on. Eventually after travelling 24 hours I caught a cab. Had to carry my bags upto my room. Was promised complimentary breakfast found the restaurant had not been informed.  Room not properly cleaned. Dirty glasses not picked up. No English breakfast tea..in general very disappointing.  Not a cheap hotel. Not worth the money anymore.

title: Linda expencia
text:
Muy amable la atencion grato ambiente, muy familiar, recomendado 100%.
Gracias especiales a Mayerly, Lesly y Benny
La ubicación es privilegiada, muy central, y con accesos a todo tipo de movililizaciones,

title: Excelente servicio y amabilidad!! 100% recomendado.
text:
Muy buena experiencia!! 100% recomendado.
Muy amables todo el personal, en especial Mayerly, Lesly y Benny!!
Nos quedamos sólo una noche, pero el excelente servicio y los detalles hacen una gran diferencia al momento de elegir hotel.

title: Consisting outstanding, especially the Staff!
text:
I have been coming, repeatedly, to The Marmara since shortly after it opened. I wouldn't think of staying anywhere else in NYC. The Hotel is beautiful, spotlessly clean and, most of all, has an outstanding Staff, who create a delightful, welcoming atmosphere.
   I would especially like to point out Kevin and Mayerly: 
   I can't say enough about Kevin. He is remarkably thoughtful, incredibly pleasant and highly efficient! He is a gem, and a great asset to the Hotel.
  Mayerly gives a wonderful "face" to the Hotel at the Front Desk. Whether you are just checking in, making the first greeting in the morning, or passing by during the day, she brightens your day.
   The Bar and Restaurants (Lobby and Rooftop) are "hidden gems," with wonderful staffs as well.

title: Good service!
text: Good experience overall, with special thanks to Mayerly and Beni! They have been very helpful at the front desk. Water/snacks/printer is also readily available. They even had a pool in the fitness center.

title: New York Trip 2023
text:
Great hotel and location
Greeted so well from the moment we arrived
Benny greeted us and took out bags to our room
Mayerly checked us in and made us very welcome right from the start
Hotel is very nice just wish we had more time there

title: Our home away from home
text: Our home away from home.  The entire staff is amazing especially Mayerly.  She’s always  so professional and courteous.  We just love staying there.  The rooms are always clean, there’s a pool, restaurant and a rooftop bar!!!  Truly an amazing experience every time.

title: Humam!
text: I stayed at the hotel for three weeks. I was attracted by the location of the hotel and the hamam, the pool. And I didn't make a wrong choice. I am happy with the sale! A hamam in the middle of a noisy, hot city, salvation and happiness! Massage after a working day, great! Master masseurs are excellent. The girls in the restaurant were very friendly, and Beni, who meets me every day at the entrance, was extremely caring. The only thing that confused me was that they didn't always bring water to the room, but the rest compensated for this nuance. There is every chance to stay here again in the future!

title: Fantastic marmara park
text: Service outstanding, high quality hotel. Price fair. Swimming pool and steam high quality, gym open 24. Hours seven days. Rooftop in front of Empire State Building. It was an amazing eleven days in the great big apple.. unforgettable time spent

title: Ok not great
text: For a luxury hotel the attention to detail just isn’t there. They forgot to refresh the water bottles after room service, there was some trash left over, I even had a lady bug In the room. The phone didn’t work. And much more. No plugs near the bed to charge devices.

title: New York Trip
text:
Thanks a lot Mayerly. Thanks to you, we had a nice experience and stay at Marmara. The entire staff was very friendly and everything went well. The pool was also nice. We met a nice lifeguard who has Samoan origins. Very friendly and very nice talking to. 
Merci beaucoup à toute l’équipe de Marmara.

title: Not good
text: Wanted to like this hotel, but was woken up by the craziest noise at 5am that lasted a full hour and no one in the hotel knew what it was or how to fix it. Additionally, there was construction ON OUR BALCONY and people were walking around while we were trying to shower and get changed. Better hotels in the city for sure!

title: Great customer service
text: Your associate Mayerly is fantastic. I would not have booked 6 nights in your hotel if she didn’t provide great service when I was booking my room. She was courteous, thorough, patient and creative when going through the booking. Her level of care for her guests is top notch!  She represents you extremely well and is a great asset to your staff. Also the entire door man crew was outstanding as well!  All of them were great and especially Beni

title: Like coming home and dog lovers too!
text: It was an absolutely beautiful hotel and a fantastic location in New York City. What made her say so lovely is how personable the staff was. Especially Benny and Simone. It felt like coming home every day. Always a smile always opening the door. Always saying hello to our puppies. Highly recommend.

title: 10/10 will absolutely return!
text: Truly one of NYC’s best hotels! Everyone I met there was wonderful and so professional. The hotel was clean and felt very safe. Will definitely be returning here again! Mayerly helped check me in and she made everything so seamless and easy!

title: Amazing
text: My stay was excellent, the room was comfortable and felt like home, and the staff, especially Mayerly, were some of the best hotel staff I've ever had the pleasure of meeting. I plan on visiting New York again soon just for the Marmara Park Avenue.

title: Good Hotel with Great Staff and Location
text: Well run hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Has spa, pool and gym on lower level with quiet and comfortable rooms with good Wi-Fi. Stayed for several days while in NYC on business and is very well placed in Manhattan for both downtown and/or uptown meetings.

title: Great Place with Great People!
text: The hotel is beautiful.  Our room was amazing, spacious and quiet. We had everything we needed.  The staff is what made the difference for us.  Thank you to Cassandra, Leslie, Simone and Angie for your help with a key that we needed to move our son into his apartment.  You were all so gracious in helping strangers and reassuring us that everything would work out fine before we even arrived to the hotel!  With our son now living in New York City, you will be our home away from home when we visit him.  Thank you for your help and being so patient with my many phone calls.  We very much appreciate it and you were right, everything worked out fine!!  We look forward to our next visit.

title: Marmara hotel
text:
Overall excellent service. Highly recommended!

Parking was right next to the property, there is ample restaurants and shopping options close by.

Both Lesley and Mayerly were of excellent help! They should be promoted.

title: Todo perfecto
text:
Todo estuvo muy bien. La atención fue muy buena, en especial la de mayerly.
La habitación es grande y con todo lo que necesitamos para nuestra estadía. 
Volvería a elegir el hotel sin dudas.
La ubicación es excelente, cerca de todo. Si bien no pagamos el desayuno nos ofrecían algunas cosas como cortesía antes de partir. Muy útil mas con niños

title: Terrific July 4th weekend stay at the Marmara!
text:
My family and I very much enjoyed our recent stay at the Marmara this past Fourth of July weekend, and the staff was exceptional. I specifically wanted to commend the following people for their terrific service:
 
Lesly - front desk, exceptionally friendly and welcoming to my 3 kids
Anel - lobby bar, charming, well-spoken young man
Jennifer - lobby bar, detail-oriented and helpful
Enis - lobby bar, at a young age, he is very professional and courteous
Burucu - rooftop bar, very bubbly personality and warm service 
Ashley - lobby bar, she helped me with my Spanish
Carlos and Juan - great service at the pool
 
We hope to see you again soon!

title: A nice oasis in the city.
text:
Enjoyed my stay at the Marmara Park Avenue! Great Location 
Clean Modern and Comfortable. Staff is friendly helpful and attentive.
Roof Top Bar and a Swimming Pool! In-room Dining and plenty of other food choices in the neighborhood.
I'll be back!

title: This hotel treats you like family. Mr Beni is exceptional.
text: There are many things about this hotel that are very important to my family and I. To a person, the staff, the management, the property is very good. One person in particular Mr Beni one of the doormen is fantastic. On a daily basis he is helpful in every way. My wife and I are having a baby in the city and he is one of the reasons our stay here feels like home. If you are at the MarMara ask for Mr. Beni, he will make your family feel like home.

title: No place I’d rather stay in New York City!
text:
The proximity to a project of ours had us pick The Marmara Park Avenue and we are so happy we did ! 
Casandra (front office manager) welcomed us as if we were regulars -  and the excellent service just kept on going.
From the beautiful lobby to a perfect rooftop bar, this place is the best in the NoMad area!

title: Excellent stay!
text: Our stay at Marmara Park Ave was excellent. We had a 2-bedroom suite room, which has a kitchenette - so it was perfect for travelling with a family of 3. This is hard to find in Nyc! Location is central, staff was amazing - great service by Leslie and Beni. Pool was great for the kids and the pool / steam room was amazing for adults.  We will stay again for sure. I don’t think this type of place exists anywhere else in the city. It’s a hidden gem!

title: A solid 4 stars out of 5
text:
My husband and I stayed over a weekend recently and thought that while the hotel is very good, its not the best. For what they charge, their rooms are kind of small. They have a restaurant and rooftop bar, but prices there are too high. 

On the plus side, the accomodations are clean with a good midtown location. They are also responsive to any issues. When we checked in, we did not like the room as it was on a low floor. Tyler found us a better one with a view immediately, which we were grateful for.

title: Great experience
text: Great hotel! I had a wonderful experience. Lesly was very welcoming and helpful. My original room was nice but did not provide a desk. Lesly was very accommodating and a true problem solver as she helped me and upgrade my room to one that had a desk.

title: Lovely family hotel, with great food, friendly staff and holiday amenities!
text:
After having experienced the popular NYC hotels in the buzzing city, with very small spaces and limited amenities, it was truly refreshing to move to the Marmara hotel!

The rooms are spacious, with bathtub, pool, gymnasium, hotel spa and really amazing food! Although the hotel in situated in Manhattan, it’s away from the buzz of the city so you can relax and enjoy quiet time, whilst still being minutes away from all the major city attractions.

The hotel staff really top the experience! They are super friendly and help with hailing taxi cabs whenever you need to go out, and really making sure your stay is an amazing experience. 

Thank you Lesley, Ben and the rest of the team for going above and beyond to making our stay in NYC a memorable one!

title: A fantastic trip
text: My experience here was incredible. Angie and Lesly were truly amazing and very helpful. The room was very spacious and clean. I love how close it was to everything as well. I highly recommend staying here!

title: Most Enjoyable and relaxed vacation in Manhattan
text:
Ecxcellent and prompt service. Nice convenient facilities. Most courteous staff
Special mention to be made of front desk staff, especially, Mayerly, Cassandra & Lesly, they made our stay so comfortable making us want to come back again and again. The location and ambience also reminds me of a nice suburban boutique hotels in London.

title: The Marmara is the Best
text: I have been very fortunate to call Marmara Park Avenue my second home this year.  I work in NYC but come a few weeks a month for work.  I cannot imagine a better choice for a longer term stay that is not one's own apartment.  From the amazing Mayerly who greets me every morning with a smile, to Keven and Aubry in reservations to Hameed at the front door, I am fortunate to have found the Marmara as place of calm and consistency for my hectic professional life.   Thank you to all and i look forward to seeing you when i am back in September!

title: unsatisfactory
text: shower bottom floor tiles are dirty due to not being cleaned properly the doors do not close easily the tables at the dining table are not cleaned at all because before we even sat down there was a hair on it. don’t even want to think about how other things aren’t even cleaned if housekeeping at a five star can’t even do the most simplest of things.

title: Great experience!
text: We have stayed at this hotel a few times before - love this hotel! Everyone is so incredibly accommodating - Lesly, Simone and Angie are the BEST!!! The rooftop bar is a hidden gem and our room was great!

title: True Stars
text: I just finished a 2 and 1/2 month short term residency at the Marmara.  I rented a 1 bedroom apartment.  It suited my needs and other than an occasional ambulance, it was very quiet.  The hotel staff was always at the ready when my family would come and stay in other rooms for visits.  The bathroom could use some extra shelves for toiletries but the real stars of this hotel is the personnel.  From top to bottom, every person I encountered was more than pleasant and went out of their way to accommodate any need I had.  Extra towels; in abundance, no problem.  Utensils for the kitchen: lickety split.  Someone violated the smoking policy: Cassandra ensured I received a very sophisticated air filter immediately and fell over herself to apologize. I needed help with the business center and the front desk and bell personnel all jumped in to help.  Mayerly, Angie, Simone, Junior, Hameed, Viva, Ryan, Kevin, Floyd and Ben were always ready with a smile, an offer to help or just a nice chat as I passed my days conducting business or entertaining family in the bar area.  It is convenient to anything you need/want in NYC without the crowds of mid-town.  I have stayed there prior to this stay and will stay again.  I know I will be welcomed back by a terrific staff and the tomato soup and short rib ravioli  from room service are top ten!!  Thank you to the staff for an amazing "home away home" experience.

title: Do not book this hotel,
text:
Firstly you will be charged another $63 doting top of what you have already paid for the use of Wi-Fi, pool, dressing gowns etc even if you don’t use them 
Then we had pre paid for breakfast and was told we hadn’t 
Even though I had confirmation to confirm this. 
Our wonderful travel agent had to get involved who directly called and emailed the hotel to state we had paid 
The breakfast was appalling for what but we got, waited 90 minutes to be served one cold boiled egg and no cutlery and the rest of my family got nothing 
The hotel lied to my travel agent sending an email stating we had all been given an upgrade and the breakfast was fine, it got so bad that the CEO from the my travel agency called the hotel whilst I was there and demanded answers to why he was being lied to by email from Cassandra the hotel manager 
Eventually we were waived the $63 per night and refunded our breakfast money 
But when your only there 4 days you don’t need this

title: Nice but not distinctive
text: Interesting alternative to the big name brands in Manhattan.  In Park Avenue south but still a good location, room was very large for a Manhattan hotel.  Food was pretty average, not bad but nothing to write home about.  Has a cute little rooftop bar, not somewhere I would travel to go to but a nice place to have a drink when your staying there.  Was good value for money, not a 5* luxury hotel IMO but not far off and half the price of some others.

title: Excellent staff at Marmara
text: Spent over 2 months at Maramara while my partner was getting cancer treatment. Kudos to the incredible staff who went above and beyond to cater to all of our needs including getting us an air filter, keeping ink in the printer, taking care of mail and packages and providing all the kitchen accessories so we could cook our own meals. Special shout out to front desk agents Mayerly, Angie, Heidi and Tyler as well as Bellman Hameed, Kevin, Floyd and Beni. Front desk directors Jo and Cassandra were incredible especially when Cassandra saved us from having to move rooms in the middle of our stay. Can't say enough about the people at Maramara who do their very best to provide customers service with a smile.

title: I'll stay again next time I visit NYC
text:
This hotel was very good. We choose this place because of the location near to the center of the city. We were able to walk to times square from here. Hotel is very clean, has food service, and employees are all nice. 

Doormen and reception are all friendly. Most staff are bilingual, like cassandra at the desk who speaks spanish. I'm Brazilian and can understand spanish too. There is even guy named Taylor there who helped us out in portuguese.

title: Excellent service, location & suite - will definitely stay again for business or family trip
text: Perfect location. Murray Hill neighborhood is quieter and very pleasant but minutes away from all amenities and only 15 minute walk to hustle and bustle of  Broadway/TImes Square. Very close to Flatiron district which has lovely park and Eataly and nice shops.  Attentive service for business and personal needs.  I stayed in a sweet 1BRsuite with lots of room and it was so nice to have washer & dryer for long stay. Only minor complaints that kitchen could be better stocked with utensils for cooking and more dishes, but it was manageable, and my personal pet peeve  - a pedestal sink in the bathroom - although it had a shelf underneath, there is not a lot of room for toiletries which I prefer to have on a counter.  Amenities at hotel - I did not use pool etc. but our business group used the board room on occasion which was extremely convenient. They serve complimentary coffee in the morning which was excellent.  Nice sitting area in lobby to meet with business group before heading out for day.

title: Great experience nice hotel
text: Very nice hotel with very nice amenities. Stayed here for a couple days due to a quick business trip and was welcomed warmly by staff. Great rooms and loved the pool and hamam. Very relaxing experience. Will definitely be back here when I am back in the city.

title: Great Stay!
text: Great hotel!  I was in a suite, I was very pleased with the room size, amenities, quality of bed and furnishings.  The service was great.  All in all a great stay.   It is in a great neighborhood.  I was happy!

title: After a bad first impression, hotel was great
text: Was here recently while in NY visiting relatives. Clean hotel and centrally located. The experience did not start off great. The first room given to me was too small and did not look like photos online. Tyler  went above and beyond and found me a far better room right away (free upgraded). I'd stay again but recommend you do not hesitate to ask for another room if you don;t like what you're given.

title: Stylish Turkish-style hotel with very friendly staff
text:
Very stylish hotel with lovely staff who looked after us really well. Especially Mayerley who was really great with the kids. 

Generally hotels in NYC are poor value but this was a rare exception. The pool was very helpful when you have kids and the room had a big fridge, cutlery etc so we could have lots of snacks, cereals etc for jet lagged kids. 

Beautiful roof top bar and Turkish bath as well. Would definitely recommend and come back

title: Great Location, Super Staff
text:
Travelled with child (infant) and toddler (2-year-old). Felt secure and taken care of from the lobby to the room.
Hotel accommadated requests in a prompt and courteous way. Never felt unwelcome even with a cranky child - (a bonus). The rooms were stocked with ample amenities and truly felt all needs were cared for.
Would definitely return!

Location- awesome.

title: An Unforgettable Retreat: The Marmara Park Avenue Delivers a Perfect Escape"
text: I recently had the pleasure of staying at The Marmara Park Avenue, and it was an absolute delight. From the moment I arrived, the warm hospitality, luxurious accommodations, and stunning surroundings created a truly memorable experience. The impeccable service, breathtaking views, and top-notch amenities made my stay a perfect escape from reality. I can't wait to return to this oasis of tranquility and indulge in its unparalleled charm once again.

title: The most pleasant experience we have had in NYC
text: We loved our stay at the Marmara.  We were in NYC for an NYU graduation.  It was the perfect location to enjoy the city.   You can walk to so many places, cabs are plentiful, tge subway entrance is on the corner.   The room was beyond our expectations.  The staff was wonderful too.  It was our most pleasant stay in NYC ever!   Thankful that Richard found it.   We will definitely use it on future trips.

title: The Marmara Park Avenue is our home away from home
text: Every time I stay at the Marmara I feel like I have arrived at home.  The staff are wonderful and the rooms are so comfortable and accommodating.  From the beds, to the bathrooms, to the kitchen and even the washer and dryer, everything makes my feel like I am staying at my home away from home. Aubrey knows exactly what he is doing when it comes to hospitality and we look forward to our return every time.

title: Fantastic Experience!
text: My stay is always awesome! I love the full kitchen area, it’s my favorite as a nursing mama. The robe and slippers are so comfy. Also, Tyrell was awesome as I was checking out. He was such a pleasure!

title: Exceptional hospitality!
text: Best hospitality in NYC!! Amazing staff, especially Mayerly in the front desk. She was very helpful and provided me with great accommodations. Beds are super comfortable and the location is great!!!!!!!!

title: Beautiful hotel and great location
text:
Check in was super easy, friendly staff. Lobby was clean and the bar had some great drinks. 
Rooms and spacious and clean. The room service was very good. The location was very convenient. Overall, had a great experience.

title: The best hotel!!
text: One of the best hotels I’ve been to! The beds are so comfortable.  The staff was super friendly and attentive to all my needs. The spa was relaxing and so peaceful.  The view from the rooftop bar was breathtaking. I can’t wait to go back again.

title: Beautiful hotel with a welcoming vibe
text: This is a beautiful hotel located in a very convenient part of Manhattan. I fly back to NYC once a month and this is one of my favorite places to stay. The rooms are a decent size and they are always very clean. I believe they have a pool, which I've yet to visit but it's certainly a nice perk! The staff at the hotel are all very polite and accommodating. I find this hotel to be the best bang for your buck and I recommend it to all of my friends and family.

title: Below average and terrible front desk staff
text: This hotel is rated as a five star hotel, but it is average at most. We unfortunately stayed here for one week and immediately regretted checking in. The hotel is falsely advertised as having carpeted rooms and amenities that don’t exist - the room is bare bones with a very uncomfortable bed, no carpet, no ipad, clock music player, or movie channel (just basic cheap cable). Even worse than the rooms is the front dust stuff especially the woman at check in- she doesn’t belong in the hospitality business and we actually caught her speaking about us as we walked in and out. We couldn’t wait to get out of there. There are so many better hotels nearby - SKIP!!!

title: A good but not great hotel
text:
Good hotel but could be better. 

Pros - big rooms, pool and gym, restaurant on premises. Staff very helpful - Majerly, Tyler, Cassandra all very helpful and enthusiastic.

Cons - The place could be cleaner. Wear and tear is noticeable in the lobby, hallways and rooms like paint chipped and cracks on doors

the hotel is above average for sure and we enjoyed our stay but improvements can be made

title: Great stay for business!
text: Masterly was very polite and kind when I had to wait for my room. I love the pool and ham man. Will be back for future business travel, thank you. I appreciate the bar and staff, but I would love if in the future I could check in slightly earlier, to accommodate my meeting schedule.

title: Maramara delivered
text:
Great stay, spacious room. I recommend staying here for both families and for business travel. Good amenities to make your stay comfortable. 

The patio is a great touch and you could enjoy the bustling traffic and NYC skyline during warmer days.

title: Thanks!
text: Very helpful and friendly staff! They were ready and willing to accommodate any needs. The rooms were nice and balcony with Empire State Building view was great! The salt water swimming pool and spa area were lovely and the food was amazing!

title: Poor. Charged twice and not refunded. Rude manager
text:
We recently stayed at your hotel for 2 nights from Sunday night in room 1209. Whilst the room had been paid for already, at check-in your colleague made a mistake and charged me again for another $698. Mistakes happen. He confirmed that the manager would call my room within a couple of hours to confirm the refund has been made and that they will instead block $150 for incidentals. 

The manager, Cassandra never called. At night, I spoke to another colleague who then confirmed again that a mistake had been made and that the manager would call me on Monday morning. I had left my mobile number and email, but no calls.  There was also no message left on the room phone. When I insisted on speaking to Cassandra, a 3rd colleague connected me with her. She suggested that she had called my room (no voicemail, no message) and still no refund. She said she would email in the morning to confirm that a refund will be made. This email was never sent.  When I expressed my dissatisfaction at no communication from her, and no action, she rudely asked me to check out and that she would refund my whole stay. I left the hotel shortly thereafter (instead of staying for the full 2 nights). Still no refund.   How is this rudeness tolerated and lack of customer service permitted by your hotel? I have no issues with your colleagues Tyrell, Angie, Tylor. However, your manager, Cassandra clearly does not take courteous guest relations seriously.

I am writing this review several weeks after my trip, and I can confirm that I have only received a partial refund of the over-charge.  Whilst you have claimed that Cassandra insists that she tried to call me, there is no evidence of this at all.  Perhaps you can clarify how she tried to contact me?  When can I expect to receive a refund for my stay?  This is the only acceptable redress given the way we were spoken to by your manager, and the lack of concern from your staff.   I should not have to follow up continually to correct a mistake your team has made.  To this day, no one has called me or emailed me directly from Marmara Park Avenue to apologise or explain what is being done.

title: My Home away from Home!
text:
Ive been staying at The Marmara since March 13th and im going to be here till june… this is one of the best places I've stayed in NY. I like it because it smells good, feels good, its just the right size for me! The staff across the board are intelligent, thoughtful, and all around beautiful human beings. When i return home at night I feel like I'm walking in to my home away from home! Plus I have a balcony! 
 At the front desk there is a man named Herdi, he's great, got a sense of humor and knows all about the town! Cassandra backs him up and they are the slat and pepper of the lobby! 
Im recommending it to anyone whos reading this!

title: Amazing anniversary at Marmara
text: We had a great anniversary week and we would like to thank Jo for being so kind and sending us a beautiful amenity to our room and upgrading us to a suite.  Jo truly went above and beyond and was very sweet and thoughtful  for making our stay even more special.  We will definitely be back to stay at Marmara!  The hotel was very clean, housekeeping was great and the hotel was stunning and beautiful.

title: Amazing Team & First Class Experience
text:
A first class experience!  I recently started a new job and am often in the city.  Kevin and Linda were incredible to work with and really understand how to create a great experience.  

From my first interaction with Cassandra and the warm welcome from Tyrell I knew it was going to be a good fit for me while in town on business. 

The rooms are spacious, clean and well appointed.  The gym and pool area are nice to have to recharge.  Positive energy from the whole team including Mayrell, Jo, Carlos and Angie.  

It is in a great location with a wonderful team and you can tell the care that was put into designing a great guest experience.  Definitely not a chain hotel. I would recommend.

title: Comfort in a trying time
text: Came to stay the night before my brother’s surgery. Disappointed in the room as the door was dirty and the shower faucet was not functioning properly. Otherwise the service was very good. Jo at the front counter was super professional, helpful and empathetic to why we were there. She went above and beyond and had a heartfelt note with fruit and truffles. This lightened my brothers mood and gave him more hope and support. Jo left such a beautiful impression on my family and is an amazing light. Thank you Jo!!

title: Great experience
text:
My friends and I recently organized a short escape to the vibrant city of New York, and we chose the Marmara Hotel as our accommodation. The hotel boasts an excellent location, nestled right in the heart of the city, offering convenient access to various attractions. Initially, we had reserved a room with a single bed; however, the courteous receptionist graciously upgraded our booking to a room with two beds, ensuring our utmost comfort.

To our delight, the room also featured a fully equipped kitchen, providing us the opportunity to prepare our meals if we wished. Moreover, the room was incredibly spacious, surpassing our expectations for a typical New York City hotel. Throughout our stay, the Marmara staff consistently demonstrated their attentiveness and willingness to assist us with any requests or inquiries.

We had a fantastic experience at the Marmara Hotel, and we wholeheartedly recommend it to others visiting New York City. We will undoubtedly return for future stays!

title: Loved it!
text: Wonderful experience overall, beautiful hotel, rooms were clean and comfortable. Customer service was top tier. Mayerly was very attentive during our stay. It was  our first time in NY and she answered any questions we had and provided recommendations for the city.

title: An oasis of calm in the city.
text:
The Marmara hotel is a wonderful oasis of calm. Is it perfect no, but from my point of view comes pretty close, especially the rooms. The staff are welcoming and friendly and very responsive.

Loved the spaciousness, high ceilings, artwork, and cleanliness of my room. The bathroom was beautiful, however one drawback was there is no bathroom counter space, and so if you're someone who likes to lay out your toiletries then this will bug you. Could easily be fixed by hotel if they installed a couple of small shelves in the bathroom. Other than that I think the rooms are amazing. 

In my room there were tiny issues like the toilet wouldn't stop running unless you remembered to manually stop it by pushing the flush pad that gets stuck - again an easy fix for the hotel to address along with the casing on the door handle that kept falling off. However, these are small niggles and would definitely not prevent me from staying again. I intend to make this my default hotel stay whenever I am in the city. Thank you Marmara for giving me a relaxing oasis for my 4 day stay.

title: Will book again.
text: This hotel exceeded my expectations. The service was amazing the rooms were very clean, and spacious. Would definitely book this hotel again. Cassandra ensured that i had everything i needed and that my stay was seamless. Simone, Angie, Tyrell, Mayerly, and Herdi were amazing amazing as well. They made sure to answer any questions i had during my stay. The professionalism of the staff really shows that this hotel has great management that cares about hospitality!

title: Great Stay!
text: Great location, friendly staff, clean and comfortable.  Staff were very accommodating.  Our granddaughter loved coming back to the MarMara pool after a busy day of exploring the city.  Easy to get to and from places on the subway from hotel.

title: Best hotel in NYC from someone who visits monthly
text: Amazing experience. I took a solo trip and everyone was so helpful, especially Jo and Angie! I can’t wait to visit the hotel again on my next visit. The rooms were impeccable and I have nothing bad to say. Probably the best hotel in NYC, I visit once a month and can’t wait to book here each month.

title: Miracle Manager!
text: What can I say about this amazing property and it’s even greater staff! Last month I booked a romantic weekend getaway for my anniversary. I wanted to surprise my hubby and was so excited when we arrived. Then, it happened! The reservation was no where to be found! Did we have to now go somewhere else last minute?? Thankfully it was all resolved by the amazing front desk manager, CASSANDRA. She was able to locate our reservation which was actually an error on my end and dates! Thank you so much for making our amazing weekend possible! We will surely be back!

title: Excellent Service. Home away from home.
text: Excellent service.  Mayerly at Front Desk is friendly, professional and very accommodating.  Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Very quiet rooms.  I have been staying here since 2017 will never stay anywhere else.

title: Best hotel
text:
Best hotel ever, great location 
Tyrell was phenomenal at the frontdesk, really happy with our stay and the service we received. The Turkish bath and amenities are fabulous as well. 
We will be back!!

title: A pleasant experience
text:
The staff were all so friendly and hospitable. The room was clean and spacious. 
The location of the hotel is also very convenient and accessible. 
Overall a very pleasant stay at Marmara. I would recommend it.

title: Superb Service
text: Tyrell is superb! He’s like a friend. Always taking care of the guest needs, friendly and yet very professional. Highly recommended hotel with best service and clean room. It’s nicely designed as well. Will be back in my next trip.

title: My new favorite hotel!
text: My wife and I chose this hotel so we can get away for a bit and we are so glad we did. The front desk gave us a complimentary upgrade to a beautiful suite and we spent most of the time in the wellness center. This is our new getaway spot! Shout out to the amazing front desk team.  Angie, you’re amazing! We’ll be back!

title: Nice hotel with nice staff
text: Fantastic hotel located close to the Empire State Building. They have a pool as well (rare to find in Nyc), which I enjoyed every day. The front desk staff are so friendly too. Tyler at the desk always greeted us with a smile and was able to help us with many late night recommendations and directions around the city. Will definitely return.

title: Had a great stay
text:
Mayerly was very helpful with any assistance that was needed 
Very nice hotel had an amazing stay no complaints to be had everything we needed was there for us valet was very quick and easy had a smooth experience

title: Comfortable stay in the heart of Manhattan
text:
We (couple & teenage daughter) stayed 9 nights at the Marmara. The Marmara is ideally located just off Park Ave, close to subway (line 6), Grand Central, Chrysler Builidng, The Summit (One Vanderbilt) and many other sights.

Our rooms (a one bedroom suite and a junior residence next to each other) were very spacious, clean and had all the amenities (incl. dishwasher, washer & dryer) even for a long stay. The amenities and furniture are modern contemporary and suited our needs well. We particularly appreciated the new windows which blocked out the typical NYC noise almost completely.

The aircon units under the windows were a bit noisy and struggled somewhat with the unseasonably high temperatures (86°F /30°C) at the beginning of our stay but were okay afterwards. In the living room it would have been nice to have a few cushions on the couch and some decorations on the shelf to make the ambiance a bit more homely.

The staff was very helpful and always friendly. Jo Z. helped us with the booking and made sure we got rooms adjacent to each other (thanks again!). The other staff at reception, the doormen and at the coffee bar were also greeting us with smiles and made us feel at home.

We would definitely stay again.

title: I recommend highly
text: Everything was excellent. The staff are so kind and know how to solve any issue quickly.  I’d like to thank Mayerly.  I recommend this hotel to anybody seeks clean and comfortable place to accommodate.

title: Best frontdesk sevrice
text: Always having an amazing time in The Marmara Park every year when we are in NYC.They have the best crew and Mayerly is the one of the best! When we need a help at the frontdesk and for more.Thank you Mayerly always great to see you.

title: Excellent Stay!!
text:
I rarely ever leave reviews but Marmara Park Avenue really stood out to me!!

I had to stay in NY because my father was in the Manhattan VA hospital.  His situation was critical and unpredictable so I had to extend my stay multiple times.  I ended up bouncing to different big brands hotels (Hilton,Hyatt..) due to availability.  Marmara Park Avenue was the last of 3 hotel stays, and it was by far the best experience.  Customer service was awesome!!!  When I entered  the hotel Jo asked what brought me to  Marmara.  When I explained she said "don't worry, if you have to stay longer to spend time with your father, we will do everything we can to extend your stay so that you don't have to go to another hotel".  I ended up having to extend but the hotel was completely occupied.  Jo and team did everything they could, and somehow they were able to extend my stay.   They even left me a beautiful box of chocolates and a note wishing my father well. 
Not only was the customer service top tier, but the room was fantastic.  I had a kitchenette,  washer, dryer and the room was very clean. Considering I had been bouncing around from one hotel to the next for 3 weeks, these conveniences were exactly what I needed.
I can't thank Jo and team enough.  Marmara is 100% my first choice for hotel stays in NY.  
Thanks Jo and Team!!!

title: First class all the way.
text:
Outstanding room and service.  Mayerly took care of me with exceptional service that suited my tricky requirements on a Saturday morning after a long flight in from the west coast. 
The room is spacious and comfortable; and the ambiance is chic and appropriate.

title: Great experience.
text: The Marmara is an excellent hotel.  The rooms are large and well appointed and the amenities are excellent.  The service is top level and in particular the receptionist named Mayerly was extremely helpful and professional.

title: Jo is amazing
text: Jo is very helpful and super supportive. 5/5 experience. My patient stated here for 3 nights. They enjoying it so much. The front desk and the lobby are very nice. The breakfast restaurant is a little pricey. The swim pool and the Turkish bath are great.

title: relaxing family experience
text: Amazing service. We were surprised by the size of the room, and the pool, spa and Turkish bath were a surprising oasis in the city. Thanks to Mayerly and everyone at the front desk and in the spa. We will be back

title: Over the years
text: Great relax space enjoining swimming every morning. Comfortable and quite rooms. Nice welcoming and assistance by Mayerly. Location very convenient in the city center. I’ve been coming to Marmara Park 2 or 3 times a year for the last 5 years and keep on coming

title: Lovely hotel in a great location
text: The front desk and bell staff were very kind, courteous and helpful.  The room was nice, clean and spacious.  The location was also a nice area and close to many landmarks.  We enjoyed the stay very much and would definitely stay again!

title: Beautiful Hotel and Wonderful Stay
text: What a beautiful hotel, and what a lovely stay. The staff was super accommodating and made me feel right at home. Thank you, Mayerly, for the hospitality! Looking forward to staying at the Marmara again.

title: An Extraordinary Stay
text: The staff was the nicest staff I have ever met at a hotel, delightful and eager to help! The atmosphere and service were great. Definitely, a must-do if you are looking for a good time in NYC! Turkish Hamam was an extraordinary experience thank you!

title: Amazing Experience
text: I had the best experience! Jo the director was a great help and sorted everything out for me, she is amazing. Recommend 10/10! The rooms were beautiful and clean and the whole space felt very homey especially with how welcoming everyone is. Recommend 10/10!

title: Nice Hotel In a Nice Location
text:
I spent Friday to Sunday At the Marmara, sadly I did not take any pictures of my room, but I should have.

The hotel is in a real nice location, its less crazy in this location and away from the full hustle of NYC, but also very close to the Subway (33 St Station) Is just a few minutes walk away and will get you to the 4,5,6 green lines, those can basically take you anywhere.

Check in was simple and quick and the desk agents very polite. Once you take the elevator up and enter the hallaway , it has a very cool dark vibe with some nice smells.

My room had a full kitchen setup and a nice size TV and comfortable Bed. There was also a dining table and some good closet space. The rooms are pretty big for NYC Standards.

title: Stolen headphones
text:
Housekeeping stole my headphones and deactivated them, and the hotel staff refused to help me with the process 

I will never return to this hotel or recommend anyone to stay here, the staff is sketchy and unhelpful

title: A great hotel with friendly staff
text: I've stayed at this hotel many times - I probably know the rooms better than some of their own staff. Do some rooms have minor quirks? Yes. But overall, this is a well maintained, and very comfortable hotel that is kept immaculately clean. Even the smallest of the rooms in this hotel are significantly more spacious than many typical comparable hotels  in Manhattan. The front desk people are great, and treat me like a member of the family when I check in.

title: A éviter
text: A éviter, service loin d’être à la hauteur du tarif. Lit mou, salle de bain minuscule sans étagère pour les affaires, 2 tiroirs et 1 penderie pour 4 personnes et le personnel qui ne sait pas dire bonjour ni sourire. Piscine froide qui chaque jour doit être soit disant réparée.

title: Excellent Expeience
text: I was impressed across the board by my experience. I was checked in with great hospitality by Mayerly and Tyrell. My suite was spacious, well appointed, very clean and comfortable. I was impressed by the gym and made good use of it. It was clean and well equipped with weights, mats, and treadmills. I particularly appreciated the use of a Peloton bike. The Spa attendant Tuba was gracious. I had two breakfast meals and dinner at the hotel restaurant and was pleased each time. The hotel staff was continuously courteous and eager to please.

title: EXCELLENT SPACIOUS AND CHIC
text: This is a gem of a hotel! It’s a contemporary vibe but cozy and everyone who works there feels like family. I have stayed at this hotel at least a dozen times because the rooms have a kitchen, a view, comfortable beds, friendly staff, and there is a beautiful hotel bar and a spa and a gym too. Did I mention the sauna?! This place is the best. Well-priced, delicious food. I will be back!

title: Not a 5* hotel
text:
EN
Dark and dirty hotel. We found our door room opened once, reading other reviews I found that it happened to other people as well.
One month later they charged us 400$ more in taxes.
I ask to reception to call us at 3:00AM to wake up because we wanted to catch a flight and they didn’t call until 3:20AM. 

ES
Hotel oscuro y sucio. Una vez nos encontramos la puerta de nuestra habitación abierta y leyendo otras reviews me encuentro que les ha pasado a otras personas.
Un mes más tarde nos cargaron 400$ solo en impuestos.
Pedí a recepción que me llamaran a las 3:00AM para despertarme porque queríamos coger un vuelo y no llamaron hasta las 3:20AM

title: Unique and luxe
text: This is a unique hotel with apartment like amenities. The spa and pool are amazing way to end each day. The staff was all professional. My new go to hotel in NYC. The hotel is quiet and relaxing. I highly recommend.

title: Not what it used to be.......
text: I have stayed at this hotel multiple times and have been very happy with the service and our room. When we came in December, paying $600 plus a night, I was extremely disappointed with the service and the room. Our room was subpar at best and had a view of the AC unit, broken blinds, stained night stands, a leaky shower, etc. The staff seemed to do what they could, but there were not enough of them. We were left without toilet paper and when I called housekeeping, they didn't answer. When we checked out, they told us they didn't have anyone to help us with our bags. At a supposed 5 star hotel in New York City, they should have ample staff to help with bags. Will likely not go back there again which is a bummer, because I really liked the hotel prior.

title: Decent for long-term, awful staff
text:
We booked this place because of location, room size and because it had advertised having a spa area. The good things first; the location is top notch right off a 6 train metro station in the heart of Midtown. We received an upgrade to a 1BR apartment suite which would normally go for double we paid for a regular two queen room.

Firstly, I'd like to say that the 'spa' is pretty much non-existent. The pool looks way more appealing in the advertising. In reality it's a rancid, unkept dungeon. The 'turkish bath' wasn't functioning at all (temperature was way too low) and there was a persistent smell of urine which I only know from the restrooms at train stations. Further there were two staff on duty which were rather unmotivated and pissed to answer questions. Secondly, we needed a murphy bed prepared since we initially booked a room with two seperate beds. The staff that showed up spoke no english, we needed to actively help them and then they left leaving the bedding unmade (!) on the bed. I had to call twice to get them back to actually make the bed. Hilarious.

This hotel has a 2 star service and probably is more like a 3 star property. The staff seems to follow the credo of the art/sculptures in the lobby area (don't see, don't listen, don't hear). Never again.

title: Terrific Hotel
text: This is a wonderfully located boutique hotel with excellent service and well appointed rooms. The lobby is a lovely little space with bar and cafe and lots of seating. Our room was spacious, clean and so comfortable. Definitely will stay there again!

title: Nice property with uninterested staff
text: Interesting juxtaposition between a very nice property/amenities with lukewarm reception and service. Our room was very nice, bathroom tiny but expected in NYC, Hotel lobby lovely. Hotel has their own parking. Great location. But between check in and just general conversations (asking directions for example, or ordering a drink at the bar) it seemed we were either annoying people or boring them. Can probably find a hotel where they are a little happier to see you. But if you don’t care about that this place is good enough.

title: 2 star service, 4 star price
text: The location of this hotel is good, the lobby is charming, and the pool is a nice touch. However, the service and the rooms are extremely subpar for the price. We arrived to a chaotic lobby full of confused and angry guests and it took them over an hour to check us in. We sat ourselves in the bar and finally after an hour+ we were checked into a very small room overlooking an A/C unit for $700 a night. What a disappointment to say the least. I would forgive the room size if it weren't for the service. Additionally, I have been disputing a charge on my card and have contacted the hotel 3 times with no response. I finally had to contest it through my credit card company. We shall see. Lesson here: it is probably a better bet to stay at a larger hotel with better training and infrastructure to handle customer service.

title: Terrible experience
text: Stayed here recently. It’s a mess. (1) shower drain was horrendously backed up and they didn’t fix it despite four different messages. (2) supposedly high-tech iPad room service ordering sent us an error message saying “order was canceled “, and then after we left to go find food outside; they claimed they tried to deliver it. (3) the hamam bath and changing rooms  are infested with bugs, no idea or help how to use the lockers (4) the wifi didn’t work for an entire evening (5) elevator mysteriously stopped working and finally (6)the entire effort to play up a Turkish theme was so poorly done they may as well forget it and just focus on the core needs of delivering a decent hotel experience.  They also had a water pipe burst so we spent one half day without any water in the rooms or hotel and a management that appeared entirely helpless about it. Don’t go.

title: Lovely hotel, but smoky
text: We stayed here for my birthday. The manager upgraded us to a suite with a balcony for no charge and provided both an early and late check out when I mentioned we were coming for the occasion. The pool and Turkish spa areas were very nice - not crowded and quiet. We went both days of our stay. Staff was very nice. Overall we enjoyed our stay. But two complaints. First, there was little air circulation in the room. Second, I complained several times about the smell of someone smoking cigarettes on our floor. They said they would send security but no one did anything about it. Given that I was pregnant and told them I was so couldn’t have smoking around me, they should have moved us.

title: Absurd policy
text: J'ai fait une réservation pour trois nuits et envoyé des messages pour dire que ma soeur arriverait avant moi. Ils m'ont confirmé qu'elle pourrait entrer dans la chambre. A son arrivée ils ont exigé qu'elle règle la chambre avec sa carte de crédit si elle voulait avoir accès à la chambre ! Que j'arrive quelques heures plus tard n'a rien changé. INTRAITABLE. La "policy" de l'hôtel sans aucune empathie pour quelqu'un qui venait de faire 12 heures de route. Je regrette vriament de séjourner dans un hôtel aussi désagréable avec ses clients. JAMAIS PLUS.

title: Robert & Elizabeth ~ The Marmara
text: The hotel was a great location and had a cool vibe upon entering. The entire staff was Super friendly, especially Mayerly who went above and beyond to help us with a personal situation, and Birken, the bartender made great drinks! We enjoyed our stay and time spent at The Marmara. The lighting is somewhat dim in the room, but that is the only thing that could be better!

title: Labor Day Weekend Stay
text: My boyfriend and I spent Friday-Monday of Labor Day weekend at the Marmara. The service was absolutely excellent! I emailed the hotel before our stay explaining that my boyfriend and I were spending the weekend in NYC for our anniversary and asked for early check-in and a room with a balcony. Although they were all soles out of balcony rooms our room was extremely spacious and had a nice view out the window, we were definitely very happy with our room. Rachel, who responded to my email on behalf of the hotel, also gifted us a bottle of champagne and charcuterie board which we found in our room once we checked in. Rachel was extremely  helpful and did her best to accommodate our request. Would definitely recommend this hotel and we are looking forward to our next stay there!

title: Clean and friendly staff, but not 5 stars…
text:
First things first, the hotel was clean. We were very appreciative of the housekeeping staff. Not only just clean, but one morning we were not quite out the door yet when housekeeping knocked and she was so friendly and agreed to come back in an hour. She also saw there were 4 of us and left us enough towels (we had to request more when we first arrived). We ordered room service a few times and it was good and delivered in a timely manner. The mattresses and linens were very comfortable. The size of the room was an unexpected surprise. However, we wish they had taken some space from the room and given it to the bathroom. The bathroom was so tiny there was hardly room to move. We were thankful for the kitchenette because that was where we brushed our teeth and did our makeup, as there is zero counter space in the bathroom, not even enough to put a tube of toothpaste. The toilet is so low to the floor, my 43 year old body almost needed assistance getting on and off lol. The hotel is in need of some tlc, things are definitely looking dingy. Dinged up furniture, chips in the paint, messy caulk in the bathrooms, etc. I  also have some new dings in my shins from the corners of the platform beds - ouch. Our entire floor reeked of marijuana 3 out of the 4 days we were there. It once woke us up at 4am it was so strong. And, as others have noted, the hallways are so dark I needed my phone’s flashlight to find my room keys in my purse. There are several homeless folks set up outside the hotel, mostly men who are there all hours of the day and night, who catcall all the women that walk by, including myself and my 17 year old daughter. 
Overall, this was fine for a weekend as it was clean and the staff were friendly and accommodating, but it is not the five star hotel it claims to be.

title: A quirky three-star at best
text:
