Three nights with the tweenagers in NYC for a whistlestop tour of all the old haunts and this slightly quirky, kooky and very shiny place stands out as a reasonable buy. There’s a pool in the basement (a big winner with the kids) and a kitchenette in the larger-than-average and extremely well appointed and clean hotel room.  It certainly looks very starry, perhaps even the five of them that it claims.
So why the three star review? 
Beware mutton dressed as lamb my friends. This is a brilliant three star mid-range hotel, but that’s about as far as it goes. Think of it as a really classy top of the range holiday inn and you’re about there. 
Why? There’s no bar and restaurant, well there is, but it’s basically the hotel lobby with a few tables and pot plants chucked in. It’s certainly not somewhere you’d feel comfortable sitting and having dinner or breakfast. The menu is extremely limited and the wine list at the bar is mostly unavailable, but they do have a large selection of Turkish reds for you to try, which are all awful. The corridors are SO dark (this is a thing now, apparently) that you need a phone torch to find your way. Reception isn’t really that helpful, check-in seemed like an inconvenience to them and there was no question of anyone helping this single dad with two daughters (having jumped straight off an 8 hour plane journey) to the room at midnight - just a wave of ‘there’s the elevator’.  The laundry bag left outside of the room for the ‘same day service’ the next day failed to materialise before check-out two days later. When pressing the hotel on the matter they eventually found it in later that afternoon in a cupboard - it had never been sent, so off we went in filthy clothes. Rather than an apology or at very least a nod to the inconvenience, we were met with ‘well, we can’t guarantee a same day service’. That’s not hospitality, that’s rude.
The location is fine, it’s certainly quiet and out of the way so you’re not kept awake all night by the horns and sirens. Don’t expect the hotel to help you with directions or local deli/restaurant recommendations, they simply don’t have the info. 

This hotel is ok. If you get a good deal then it’s worth it for the hotel room which has a sparkly kitchenette in it - a big bonus. Just set your expectation levels to average and you’ll be delighted.

title: Great Hotel wish my stay was longer
text:
Had to make a quick trip into the city and friends recommended The Marmara Park Avenue. As I honestly has never heard of it I decided to give it a try. 

Staff was friendly but also very professional. I liked the room, very clean. Bathroom was a little awkward the way it was designed but I don't expect a huge bathroom in the city.

I wish I had time to experience other amenities that The Marmara has available but it just gives me something to look forward on my next ( more extended) trip.

title: Belles prestations et hôtel bien situé
text:
Hôtel idéalement situé à 2 pas de l’Empire State Building.
Nous avons eu quelques soucis en arrivant du fait d’une mauvaise communication entre Booking.com et l’hôtel (chambre ne proposant que 2 couchages alors que nous étions 4 dont 2 ados)…
Il nous a fallu discuter pendant 1h pour obtenir gain de cause mais, au final, la directrice est intervenue et nous a carrément surclassés dans une chambre immense et hyper bien équipée!
Nous avions beaucoup de place, 2 chambres, 2 salles de bain et une pièce principale avec salon, salle à manger et cuisine (toute équipée) ouverte!
Le gros plus de cet hôtel est la piscine au sous-sol qui est ouverte presque tout le temps, très pratique lorsqu’on est en décalage horaire…
Merci encore à Kajsa pour son intervention et nous ne manquerons pas de revenir dans cet hôtel quand nous serons de retour à New-York!

title: The worst hotel & management…stay away at all costs!
text: Booked this hotel through Amex travel. We were assigned the darkest room on the darkest floor. The bathroom shower walls had holes, the mirror is behind the bathroom door in front of the toilet seat so the only way to use it is to stand on the toilet. Asked for a room change even if I had to pay more, they couldn’t help so booked another hotel and checked out of Marmara. The lady at the front desk gave me an invoice for one night’s charge only and told me i will get refunded by Amex. We are now in August and Amex continues to tell me hotel will not refund even if I have an invoice for one night only. Please go look at the room before you swipe your card and check-in. The online photos do not match all rooms.

title: Great stay.
text: Great location and friendly staff.  Loved the balcony on the room. One elevator was down for service but it didn't slow things down much.  It's a smaller hotel and each floor feels comfortable with the floorpan - no long hallways to make you feel processed.

title: Terrible management and front desk staff as well as bad construction
text: I am having a very difficult time getting a corrected bill and their phone numbers do not work.  This is not surprising because I had difficulty throughout my one week stay.  My room door had issues with the lock, and although maintenance was terrific, the front desk was terrible at communicating throughout the process.  During my stay I noticed that most of the doors, bathroom and inside bedroom, also did not close correctly.  I did not feel safe during my stay.

title: Very good
text:
We travelled looking for a hotel with a pool and this hotel has one of the best 
Rooms were very clean but our bathroom was very small
What makes this hotel is its staff both in the morning and evening.
The girls in the morning were exceptionally helpful and the young man on duty in the evening was wonderful, patient and kind.
A treat in NY

title: A happy repeat visit
text: After a few years away from NYC I returned to The Mamara with a friend for a weekend birthday celebration.  Rachel helped me navigate the booking with ease and Mayerly and the team at the front desk were always cheerful and helpful making our stay memorable.  The rooms were excellent in every way and we would return in a heartbeat.  THANK YOU ALL for looking after us so well.

title: Very good Family Friendly hotel, excellent location
text: We stayed here last december (post christmas trip to NYC) and loved it. We believe the best way to see and experience NYC is by walking the grid and taking uber as needed. This place is located almost equidistance from many of the popular spots. The rooms were clean and well maintained. The staff were cordial and helpful. We gladly recommend this place to fellow travellers!

title: a great stay in NYC!
text: I travel to NYC for work on a regular basis and after years of spending much too much time trying to find the best deal at a decent hotel, I started consistently staying at The Marmara and am very happy that I did.  The rooms are great (I think I've stayed in at least 4 different sizes, and all were good), the turkish spa is a lovely perk and the staff are accommodating and attentive.

title: Everything you were looking for in New York
text:
Finally i found a hotel i am happy to revisit in New York.
Location is great, Very close to Empire State building. Not too busy an area but yet accessible.
There are lovely restaurants nearby.
Metro station is a minutes walk
Staff is helpful.
They have a pool, spa and gym too.
The rooms are the best part. mine came with a little kitchenette and was spacious by New York standards.
Just loved the hotel!!

title: Great location for exploring the city
text:
My husband and I stayed here with our teenage daughters and it was just perfect! We had a 2 bedroomed penthouse apartment which provided plenty of space and privacy. The kitchen is well equipped with everything you could need including a dishwasher, washing machine and dryer plus essentials like coffee and tea. The lounge area provides a great place to plan your day together or chill after a long day sightseeing. 

The master bedroom and ensuite were generously sized with super comfy bed and toiletries are supplied. Our bathroom included a jacuzzi bath which was great after a long day of walking! 

The second bedroom and bathroom are smaller but still big enough for 2 and equally well equipped. 

Plus there is free wifi - if you have teenagers you’ll know how important this is! 

The pool and gym were an added bonus and the kids enjoyed their early evening swim whilst we enjoyed the friendly bar situated just off the lobby! I’m afraid I can’t remember the barman’s name but I know he was from Turkey originally and really looked after us - so thank you! 

In fact all the staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful but a very special mention to Kajsa who prior to our visit went above and beyond to offer advice around Covid rules, sightseeing help and ideas of what to visit. Kajsa also organised a transfer from the airport for us so we could surprise the girls and arrange in style! She was super informative and so helpful. We really appreciated all her help so thank you! 

I should also say the view from the room was incredible! Sadly the roof bar wasn’t open whilst we were there but it looks great so yet another added bonus for a fabulous hotel. 

We found the location of the hotel great and walked to many sightseeing locations but there is a subway right outside. 

Next time we visit New York we would definitely stay here again ☺️

title: Great hotel,great staff
text: We have just had a family 6 night stay at the Marmara. The rooms were a great size and had everything you need for a very comfortable stay.All the staff were very helpful and pleasant.It's really well situated to explore New York.We enjoyed using the pool and gym facilities at the start/end of busy sightseeing days !

title: Biggest NYC hotel room ever!
text: Here for business and it was amazing to have such a spacious room with a kitchenette including electric kettle, nespresso machine, microwave and fridge. There was even a washer and dryer in the room! Generally NYC rooms are small, however this was more like a small apartment. Decor is nice. Breakfast in the lobby restaurant is spendy but good and they’re honest about just how long your order will take (a long time). They have Free snacks and coffee in lobby bar which is nice as you’re heading out for the day.

title: The Best Hotel In NYC
text:
I spent my birthday weekend in this hotel and I had such a wonderful experience here. I took my kids and we had such an amazing time! This hotel is so perfectly clean and the bed was the most comfortable bed ever! They have a nice indoor pool which is heated and very clean, they have a super awesome sauna which we enjoyed very much, the locker room by the pool was also so clean and so neatly well-kept it was amazing. 
They have beautiful art everywhere for you to enjoy, a beautiful little bar and restaurant with delicious drinks and food, the reception area has a very unique and modern appearance, all of the hotel staff were so accommodating and so super nice. The staff is really caring and very, very helpful in every aspect. We travel a lot and been to a lot of different places but this hotel is the best we’ve experienced. I can honestly say with confidence that there was nothing negative about this hotel, 
I loved every minute of being there and will come back very soon!

title: Most wonderful experience in NYC
text:
The Marmara Park Avenue continues to be my favorite hotel to call “home” when I am on business in New York. The sophistication, decor, caring staff, attention, cleanliness, and overall vibe is just spectacular. The hamman baths and indoor pool and gym are a true sanctuary. Enjoying a cup of tea on the balcony outdoors overlooking the city is so peaceful.

Kajsa has been the most hospitable and welcoming. Thank you to everyone making my stay always one that I can’t wait to come back to.

title: The Marmara is a home away from home
text:
The Marmara is not your ordinary hotel.  They have wonderful layouts of one and two bedroom apartments that are perfect if you want spread out and stay a few nights.  You can feel like you live in NYC instead of being a visitor!

Clean and comfortable beds.  Centrally located close to the subway and in walking distance to many great destinations.  Friendly staff and accommodating.  Will definitely return!

title: March 2022 stay
text: We were very disheartened because even today the website says that they have free parking but we just checked out from a 3 night stay and ended up paying over $200 in parking!!! I asked the front desk if they compensate for some of it since they do not have free parking right now and was told “sorry, we don’t do that”! Also the room was not very clean. The first night we were there I found a flower petal in my bed the next morning(disgusting) 🤮.  I pulled the blanket off and put it with wet towels and asked housekeeping to change all bedding while we were out and about, but when we came back it seemed the same bedding had been put back on because the same brown dot was on the blanket and it was damp from the wet towels. We are so disappointed with this hotel because the room size was great but the other issues definitely make it a place we would not want to stay in the future!

title: The Marmara Park Avenue is Marvelous in March!
text: I chose to stay at the Marmara. The location was perfect for me because it’s a block away from the office I was doing business at. I walked in to the beautiful lobby and was met by Omar who told me there was a room available. He was smiling, wonderfully friendly, and polite… So were the rest of the staff I saw working there. They all were happy and cheerful, and to me, that says a lot about a hotel. When I saw my room I was very impressed… Omar gave me a huge suite, with a fantastic view of  Manhattan from my own walk out balcony! There was a full kitchen in another area, with all the amenities you’d want in a Park Avenue apartment! The room had a cappuccino maker, a refrigerator, a stove, a microwave, a sparkly sink etc… I felt like a had a beautiful home in the heart of the city! The location is perfect, too! Walking distance to The Empire State Building, Macy’s, Central Park, Broadway… I loved it! I decided to stay another night. The day after that,  I rebooked my room with Herdi who, is very friendly and polite. We talked about music with Omar, and the two of them gave me excellent directions to every place I asked them about. Very helpful…. So knowledgeable about the neighborhood… Over the next couple of days I always saw smiling faces and very courteous, helpful staff members. Even the guests were smiling there. On Wednesdays, they feature beautiful live music in the evening. The Marmara is the place to be, and the place for me if I’m in NYC

title: Fantastic hotel, staff and location
text:
My sister and I stayed 5 nights at the Marmara Park Avenue in December 2021 in a room with two queen beds and views of the Empire State Building. The room was wonderful, (larger than expected in NYC) and surprisingly quiet despite the typical NYC noise outside. The beds were excellent and exactly the level of comfort required after averaging 30k steps a day!

The hotel was clean and well presented, perfect to celebrate a birthday trip. It did seem extra special to be there in December because it was decorated for the holidays beautifully. As a birthday surprise we were greeted with a lovely cheeseboard and prosecco for our first evening which really helped start the celebrations.

The hotel location itself is ideal - it's midtown on 32nd/Park Avenue and is right on the subway #6 line which is great if you want to get downtown quickly. Close to a traditional American diner great for breakfast on 33rd/Lexington, ATMs and Macy's. It's also easily walkable to Union Sq and Times Sq.

The staff were superb, from the desk staff (Paul, Omar & Mayerly) to the doormen who were all super friendly and always keen to assist. But special thanks go to Kajsa who went above and beyond even before we arrived to make our stay perfect. When the testing rules unexpectedly changed during our stay Kajsa was on hand to assist and arranged for a COVID testing firm to come to us at the hotel and test us for free, which not only saved us a lot of $$$, but also allowed us to maximise our last two days to enjoy and explore New York.

If we return to New York we will be sure to stay at the Marmara Park Avenue and couldn't recommend it to others enough!!!

title: THE MARMARA IS MAGINIFICENT!
text: I am a performer, so I do a lot of traveling. I’ve stayed in countless hotels and rarely post a review unless a Hotel is exceptional. Marmara Park Avenue is magnificent! I was thoroughly impressed by the staff, the accommodations, and the location. I love the fact that a parking structure is located adjacent to the hotel. I checked in late in the afternoon, so the parking structure was full, and could not accommodate my large Cadillac SUV, so I parked down the street. I walked in To the Marmara to check in. I was instantly impressed with the beautiful lobby. I was cheerfully greeted by Herdi and Kajsa upon arriving. I mentioned to Herdi that there was no space left for my SUV, so he gave me an upgrade to a suite with a kitchenette! I arrived upstairs I was delighted to see a super clean, modern and very large room! I love the view of NYC from the window, and the Nespresso coffee machine, the  large TV and the iPad was awesome to see as well! I slept like a baby within 30 minutes. The next day I woke up to fresh coffee in the lobby, and very cheerful, attentive  staff. Paul was at the front desk and gave me several new coffee capsules for my room. Upon returning later in the evening I heard a singer performing live in the lobby. I would up extending my stay two times, and the only reason I left was to avoid a snow storm that was heading to NYC. During the stay I enjoyed the fabulous Midtown Manhattan neighborhood with its excellent restaurants, beautiful views of the Empire State Building, and all the elegance of Park Avenue, that I had read about. Everyone at the Marmara Park Avenue, and even the Parking attendants next door, showed me such kindness and attentiveness that I consider them to be friends! They are wonderful ambassadors for the New York City! I look forward to visiting New York again, and I will most definitely be staying at Marmara! I can’t wait to go swimming in the fabulous pool next time I’m there. My advice if you are going to visit New York, is to book yourself a room at The Marmara Park Avenue! You'll be sure to have a fabulously memorable time, and it will be easy to see why I love it so much!

title: Great Property!
text: We had a terrific stay.  Hotel was clean, room was big and staff very friendly.  Asked for water and they gave us four.  Free coffee every morning down stairs.  Very well located in Murray Hill.  Will stay here again next time!

title: Love the Mamara!
text: We have stayed at the Mamara multiple times over the past few years and always look forward to our stay. The amenities like the pool and Turkish bath are fabulous. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms are stylish. We will be back in the spring!

title: Great Marmara Park Avenue stay
text: Moved our daughter into her new apartment in Kipps Bay. Stayed at Marmara Park Avenue for its convenience. Will come back because of the staff and well equipped room. Kajsa at reception was super friendly and actually interested in our journey. She helped with recommendations and little extras. The room had a fridge and teapot and coffee maker as well as utensils. Just a nice touch. As long as our daughter lives in Kipps Bay we will return to this hotel.

title: The Marmara Park Avenue is the best!
text: The Marmara is everything I could want. I love their Studio Lofts with the beautiful marble bathroom and huge bathtub, and the kitchenette and washer/dryer is a terrific bonus! An indoor pool was what in particular drew me to find the Marmara, and I made use of it every day of my stay. There is a hammam (special steam bath) and an elaborate shower in the same area as the pool. The rooms are quite large for Manhattan, and lower Midtown is a great central location (it’s right by Koreatown). The staff is impeccably kind and helpful. Prices are a bargain for all these amenities. I plan to stay here for every NYC trip.

title: 10 days …
text: We just wrapped up a 10 day stay at The Marmama. The staff was warm and friendly. The general physical state of the hotel was very well cared for and the food/hospitality was first rate. We definitely plan to return!

title: Cozy and Clean
text: I’ve stayed at The Marmara Park Ave several times now and I am never disappointed! The staff have always been exceptionally helpful and friendly. The rooms are spacious and the location is pretty central. Every inch of the hotel is super clean  with all the amenities I need. I highly recommend a stay!

title: Location and coziness
text: This past year, we've stayed in quite a number of hotels in the city since we moved out to Long Island. We booked the Marmara Park Avenue simply for the convenience to our NYE countdown dinner at Eleven Madison Park. And boy, I wish I had known about this place sooner because we're definitely coming back again. Our room had an unblocked view and a small kitchen that was sufficient for a longer staycation, super cozy! The location was wonderful as well. It's right next to the day spa I go to and it's within walking distance to our workplace and K-town for a late-night supper.

title: poor customer service
text:
Hotel looks grand, the lobster roll is absolutely delicious, actually the food is good!
great location, the bar staff were also pretty helpful.

the loft is huge, definitely a lot of space but poorly utilized - dont understand why in NY the toilets are inside the bathroom....there is enough space in the room to separate the toilet...the bath itself needs modernising, very much 1980s style.
kitchen was really modern in the loft. Plenty of working space., chargers and USB ports.

Receptionist have to go on training, the Hotel Customer service Director definitely needs more guidance herself on how to  stay in touch with her staff and reach back to the guest!

for a 5 star hotel , the least they could do is to provide a complimentary water bottle but even that was restricted to 2 bottles on the day of arrival and then you got to buy it at the restaurant or drink from the tap for the remaining days - very very stingy...
I honestly didn't have the right experience during my 3 night stay to recommend this place to colleagues or friends, didn't use the pool or any amenities, was put off by the mere fact that I personally had to chase the director and staff for their own mistake.....
Will definitely avoid this place for the near future, might just go in to the restaurant and get a lobster roll but will surely wont be staying in there.

title: Small Boutique Hotel in NYC with Exceptional Staff and Service
text:
Superior service and positive guest experiences--the kind that make folks return and recommend the property to friends--never happen by accident. It's the result of hiring the right people with the right mindset and skill set and them train, train, training them.
The entire Marmara staff came together to make our recent two-day weekend stay a most enjoyable one. The welcoming front desk staff, the attentive waitress and a behind-the-scenes accomplished chef, the friendly bellmen and the efficient housekeeping staff all made us feel welcome and appreciated. And not to be remiss, a special shoutout to front desk manager Herdi for repeatedly going out into the rain to hail down taxis for us.
Well done, Marmara, we'll be back!

title: 40th birthday trip
text:
What a lovely hotel! 

Great central location, subway (line 6) a stones throw away. 
The room was lovely, large and with a great view of the Empire State Building. 
The staff were exceptional! 
They really went above and beyond, from helping helping us in and out, assisting us get PCR when Uk Gov changed the rules, to helping us celebrate our special birthday with Prosecco and cheese. (Kasja was wonderful)

I would definitely recommend the Marmara and stay again if I’m New York x

title: Our new favorite hotel in NYC
text: Stayed at The Marmara Park Avenue last weekend with my husband to celebrate my birthday! Not only is the hotel very centrally located, it is very clean, staff is very accommodating and the bar downstairs is great! We were welcomed with champagne and a fruit platter to help celebrate my 50th birthday! The hotel is pure class and has all the amenities one could ever want in a hotel. If I could give it more than 5 stars, I would! Oh and did I mention The Marmara Park Avenue has balconies in some rooms? It does! That was definitely an added bonus for us in our stay at the hotel, the balcony and it’s breath taking views of Manhattan.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking into visiting NYC soon.  I know this will definitely be the only hotel my husband and I will be staying in when visiting New York in the future! Marmara Park Avenue, thank you for helping our past weekend be so enjoyable and memorable and for helping us celebrate this milestone! You are the best!

title: great  hotel great location
text:
I traveled with my friend and we booked 2 double size beds room
the hotel was great
good location
big room for new york
espresso machine, fridge,
great shower 
very clean
and all of the hotel workers was very friendly and helpful

title: New City Girls Bucket Item List
text: We enjoyed our stay at the Marmara Park Avenue.  It was very quiet, but yet close to many attractions.  We loved the subway access that is just steps away from the hotel.  Staff is very friendly and hotel rooms are spacious and very clean.  Nespresso machine was a great hit! Highly recommend The Marmara!

title: Great Location & Very Accommodating
text: There's very few high quality hotels near the NYU/Langone Medical Center and the Marmara Park Ave is one of them.  The staff were very helpful and on time with everything we needed, from reservations (shout out to Rachel!) to in-room service and beyond.  The location made it easy for us to walk to everything we needed.  A special thank you to Kajsa for her compassion and customer focus.

title: The best hotel in nyc!
text: I love staying at the Marmara when in nyc, great location middle of everything with the best views, best staff, spacious rooms , the Turkish Hammam is my favorite! I would rate my experience a 10/10!!

title: Excellent stay
text: We very much appreciated the time Kajsa took to work out the best rooming situation for our family. It worked out perfectly!  Everyone at the hotel was great as well.  Very welcoming!  Great location and easy to navigate as the subway was steps away.

title: Park Avenue Gem!
text:
Five star experience at The Marmara Park Avenue surpassed all expectations! We visited for a weekend trip and chose the Marmara in part due to its fabulous location. Located a couple blocks from the Empire State Building, the Maramara made access to the city extremely convenient. The hotel was beautiful with an amazing staff. Kajsa and her team went above and beyond to greet us with tons of happy energy and professionalism. My group arrived early in the AM and were ready to start the day. Kajsa and staff welcomed us to change our clothes and store the luggage for a perfect transition to the day ahead.

The public spaces are lovely and the rooms are beautifully designed, comfortable and very clean. The rooms are much larger than your typical NYC room and beautifully decorated. I was particularly impressed with the sparklingly clean bathroom and shower that appeared to be barely used. I visit NYC often and have stayed at many fine hotels through the city, but between the hotel and the staff, I will make sure to always stay here on future occasions!

title: Highly recommended
text: I stayed at The Marmara Park for a weekend in NYC with friends. Kajsa and the rest of the staff were amazing, everyone was very friendly and professional. She provided us with great rooms - awesome views. The hotel is in a great location and beautifully decorated. Highly recommended!!

title: Clean spacious excellent location
text:
Excellent location, large rooms, very thorough housekeeping, good range of drinks and food on room service, roof top terrace bar with quiet scene.

Pet friendly. 

Ground floor coffee and bar facilities. Some business facilities. 

Very effective doormen. Friendly and attentive. 

Only negatives - slightly slow elevators;

title: Great Stay!
text: I love this hotel. The rooms are clean, spacious and the staff is friendly and helpful! Had several deliveries and pick-ups and everything ran smoothly. I also love the bar downstairs, great Palomas. I highly recommend staying here as I will be back.

title: Simple the best of many choices!
text:
The best experience ever in NYC! Mike (building super) is one cool dude that went over and above to make us feel at home! Omar at the front desk- awesome guy! The rooms were perfect, clean and spacious and housekeeping was spot on!
 We will be back!

title: Why I keep coming back!
text: I travel to NYC every fall to visit family, do some shopping and enjoy the city. Sometimes I have my husband or a friend with me, sometimes I'm on my own, visiting family and friends who live there. The Marmara Park Ave has become my go-to place to stay the past 4 or 5 years. The location is centrally located and convenient - a nice little walk or a short cab ride to get to where I want to go. The hip little lobby bar has a residential feel and is a great place to meet up for a glass of wine. Or you can order a wonderful charcuterie platter from room service and enjoy your room, which feels more like an apartment as they are spacious and well appointed. The staff and housekeeping has always been warm and responsive to any requests. I truly cannot say enough about the Marmara Park Ave. I'm so happy they weathered the pandemic and are back in full swing ... and I can't wait to go back! : )

title: A Weimaraner’s wonderful weekend!
text:
I was fortunate enough to visit the Marmara with my parents on Saturday for one night. 

On arrival, we were greeted with warm smiles, pets, and a complimentary upgrade! 

On entrance to the room, I was pleasantly surprised with the size, amenities, and a state of the art IPad to plan my walkies in the ideal location on park avenue.

After an afternoon nap, we grabbed a drink in the bar area (Yes dog friendly) and popped out for a spot of dinner taking the doorman’s recommendations. 

For sure, the highlight was the continental breakfast! I’d made sure I was a good boy, so was treated to an array of fresh pastries, fruit, coffee, and granola, all on the balcony overlooking the Empire State & Chrysler building! 

Following this, we popped up to the floor top, and took in the view with a bowl of water provided by the friendly staff. 

All in all, if you have a parent/s who are looking for a dog friendly boutique hotel, You can’t over look this quaint & stylish hidden gem. 

Will sure to stay again!

Reggie the Weimaraner @reggie_theweim xx

title: Great location, exceptional staff and facilities and a terrific public rooftop terrace.
text:
We had a recent long overdue trip to New York and stayed at the Marmara and were blown away by the location, quality of the hotel and exceptionally helpful and polite staff.

Beautiful room with a terrace, lovely lap pool and turkish sauna, amazing decor as well as an amazing rooftop bar terrace with great drinks and even better views of the entire New York skyline.

I have to say the highlight though was the helpful and friendly staff. In particular 
Kajsa Koustoubardis was a super star.  We wanted to eat at Le Bernardin while in New York and Kajsa took our call and actually managed to find an impossible reservation for us.  She also assisted us with a private room when we had a nurse visit to give our pre-travel covid test.  Also ready with a friendly response and made the trip even more enjotable.

Located at Park and E 32nd the location was amazing and we will definitely return.

title: Lovely Boutique Hotel
text: My daughter and I met in NYC for the weekend and the hotel was just perfect for us. The pool, spa, and workout room were all clean and well equipped.  Our room was spacious and the beds were clean and comfortable. The staff were very helpful and friendly. It was conveniently located, near shopping and restaurants. We would absolutely stay here again.

title: Location Location Location
text: Modern and classy hotel on Park avenue. In the middle so you can get downtown and uptown very easily by cab. Lots of restaurant options nearby and the rooms are very luxurious. Raised bed and a little balcony with lofty views of the skyscrapers. Subway is a few minutes away and a relatively safe area. There is a homeless shelter nearby where I used to drop off food every night and they are very welcoming. Relaxing pool and the hamamm is the best feature of the hotel. Classically designed foyet and very courteous staff. The spa has really nice towels and slippers too. Reasonable price for a business stay.

title: Hotel Marmara
text: The hotel is in a good location. The staff are very friendly and  very helpful. The breakfast we had  was excellent, with freshly made bake good, jelly and honey,  a bagel and cream cheese,  juice, coffee or tea, fruit and a hard boiled egg.  The roof top bar showed us an amazing view of New York.  Enjoyed our stay.

title: Completely and Absolutely Satisfied!
text: Our stay was awesome. The overwhelming memories of our time spent at this hotel will last forever.The botel is beautiful. The food was very good. The room was large and spacious.  The pool is really nice too. My grandchildren are still talking about the amazing time. The staff was extremely hospitable. The location is nice. Everything was top-notch. Natalie was exceptional. Mike was ver freindky and helpful. All of the staff was professional and kind.  We can’t wait to visit again.

title: Buyer beware - not a 5 star hotel anymore
text:
I came here during the weekend of Hurricane Henri for my sister’s birthday. I booked the double queen room for 2 nights 5 months in advance through their website. When we arrived, we were given an ADA room when I didn’t request for one. I emailed the concierge, Jackson, 3 days in advance of our arrival to confirm my room and there was no indication it was an ADA room. We went into the room extremely disappointed because there were no shower stall and only a curtain between the sink/toilet and the shower. We called to request a different room and was told they were sold out of double queens. We were pretty upset because the room appeared in need of renovation and not what we expected from a 5 star accommodation that cost $450/night. The concierge offered a king room but the space was much smaller and my sister and I wanted more space. After that, they didn’t do anything more to make our stay better despite giving our room away. To make matter worse, we asked for more towels in the evening - never received them. Then the next day when we left our room, the cleaning staff came into our room without our consent to drop it off while we weren’t there. We felt that our privacy was violated since our personal belongings and valuables were left out. 

The hotel is in dire need of a renovation - chipping walls, elevator wallpaper held up by scotch tape. They also seem to be sort in staff and the rooftop bar was a small balcony with a few small tables and sofas. The decor was tacky. 

I would not recommend you stay here if you want 5 star services, accommodations or amenities. The location is great but there are better hotels nearby.

title: Finally Back in NYC!
text: Well, we finally returned to NYC for the first time in over 20 months.  When we returned we knew exactly where we were going to stay.  Our prior hotel at which we have stayed for the past 8-years on the UES of NYC unfortunately closed permanently due to the pandemic; however, there is a sister property in Midtown East - The Marmara Park Avenue.  I have stayed there on several occasions previously, but this is the first time as a family.  Marmara - Park Avenue never disappoints.  The hospitality of every staff member is outstanding.  The suites are some of the best in the city, and the location is excellent.  Highly recommend The Park Avenue property for anyone visiting NYC.

title: Weekend in Manhattan
text:
Spent last weekend at the Marmara with my sons. Location is great. Short walk from Penn Station and Grand Central Station. Very close to the 6 train for easy uptown and downtown travel.

Staff was very accommodating. Rachel was great with reservations. We needed to add an extra night after the original booking. She made it happen with no issues. We needed a rollaway bed. Again, no issues. It was in the room when we arrived. Bell staff was fantastic. Thanks Kevin! Omar at the front desk couldn’t have been more welcoming.
Room was cleaned each day, without requesting. Turkish Bath and pool were fantastic!

title: Sad
text:
I stayed at this hotel a few years ago and since then it has really declined. Not sure if because of Covid or what, but it's really run down and not very clean. Everything is a bit dirty if you look closely, with a few items left by other guests in my room and the shower stall less than clean. The tiny balcony could have been a nice touch, but it was very neglected. The view itself is crap, so they need to spiff things up a bit.
The pool area and the water were so cold it made swimming unpleasant, and the couch was stained. The decor looked cheap and peculiar as well. The whole downstairs area was really sad and tacky. Are they about to remodel? There were bits and pieces in disrepair.
I was disappointed by how much I spent and the quality of the accommodations, and, oddly, the room I was given had what I could tell after closer observation, a Murphy bed. Also, no fridge in the room, which is usually a given. I actually needed store some items and didn't think to ask while reserving. Was told I could store things in with staff, but then I would have had to go downstairs every time I nee something.
I would not stay here again unless they  make some major improvements.
Was quiet though, and the room was nice and dark for sleeping. But those don't make up for the rest of the cost of the room.
Very disappointed.

title: THE MARMARA - Great Boutique hotel - superlative service by staff
text:
Excellent location esp. as we were helping my daughter, (a doctor at NYU Langone, ) move to a new apt. The staff at Marmara were such a pleasure to deal with - starting with Chance Moffitt who made my reservation and went out of his way to ensure we had exactly what we required. 
Kay Ann and Jackson at the Front Desk - always helpful, Elizabeth (GIRL POWER!!) and Junior who handled our considerable luggage with ease - we transported supplies for two apts. in NYC and NJ - twin daughters in new spaces.
Kajsa - Front Office Director, who was most kind and gave us a beautiful room - thank you!!
This was a stressful time for us with our daughter moving apts., dealing with inevitable problems and glitches - such a comfort to have strangers around us who supported us completely - a home away from home.
Room Service and Cleaning service were good - our South facing Studio Suite  had a great view of Manhattan and we even watched the Fourth of July Fireworks from our terrace - partially obstructed by an adjacent building, but we felt the excitement!!
Strongly recommend this hotel.

title: The pool is the gem of this place
text:
Was a fan when I came a couple of years ago. But without availability of the pool, a lot of the value is lost😞 Great location though, and very clean. I felt like I overpaid this time around, since the pool is undergoing maintenance. 

Smells amazing, super helpful staff and baggage handlers!

title: Great Stay, Will Return
text:
We are so glad we chose this hotel.  The room with 2 Queens was spacious enough for our family of four, clean, nicely decorated, great AC and beds were very comfortable.   The staff were warm and welcoming.  Location was great. Easy access to 4th of July fireworks and subway system. We’d definitely stay at Marmara again.  

The only negative is that there is no counter in the bathroom, just a stand alone sink. No where to put a hairdryer down.  Particularly difficult when 4 people share, but we made it work.

title: Amazing Birthday Stay
text: What an amazing birthday experience! From the service and great smile at the front door all the way to the manager. I walked into my room with a whole balloon surprise for my birthday! I couldn’t believe my wife coordinated so well with someone lol but even she said the service was exceptional working with the hotel. Although an unexpected pool closure occurred the day I checked in Kajsa the Manager handled it so well. Room was gorgeous- tall ceilings. Balcony was my favorite part. Thank you everyone at The Marmara for a wonderful birthday stay!

title: "Consistently outstanding"
text:
From the time it opened, The Marmara has been a jewel. The place is beautiful, with many amenities. Although it is in an excellent, central location, you could also just stay in the Hotel for the wonderful experience.
I cannot say enough about the staff! Kevin, Junior, Matt, Roger, Mike, Liz, Tino and Mae are especially outstanding, most particularly with any special needs.

title: Good
text:
Overall I enjoyed my stay. My room was very big, especially by NY standards, with a kitchenette and a table with chairs. The amenities were great-a nice pool and gym. The service was good too. 

One thing that bothered me was that they charged me $55 a night for parking, though their website says it costs $39. They told me at checkout that the website price only applies to direct bookings. However, there is no indication of that on the site, it just says that parking costs $39 (maybe I would’ve parked off site for a better price then). I didn’t have the energy or patience to fight about it, but I left feeling a little jipped, and it dampened by previous (well earned) enthusiasm for the place. I would recommend that they make this clear to avoid misunderstanding in the future.

title: Excellent boutique hotel
text: Loved our stay!  Comfortable room with a great view, nice gym & pool.  Perfect midtown location.  Convenient valet parking included in their Parking on us offer.  Nathalie was terrific!  Super friendly & helpful. Great hotel- highly recommend!

title: Deceptive
text:
I booked our stay directly through their website. Upon checking in, the front desk agent asked how old my kids were (12 and 15) and then I was told that there would be an additional charge of $65/per night for my 15yo. Nowhere on the website does it ask for children's ages (like on hotels.com or or other third party sites). IT IS COMPLETELY WRONG TO ADD THAT CHARGE AFTER WE ARRIVE WHEN IT IS TOO LATE TO CANCEL WITHOUT PENALTY! We come into the city every chance we can get since we live 35 minutes away and have stayed in many different hotels, looking for our favorite ones and never has this happened in other hotels. The website should indicate additional charges for kids above a certain age so that a person who is deciding between hotels can make an informed decision. We could have easily chosen another hotel.
We find this practice quite deceptive. They certainly need to update their website and need to be more transparent with these types of details. especially if they want repeat customers.

title: Terrible service for a place that has even 3 stars, much less 5 (even with allowances for COVID)
text:
This was absolutely disappointing given what I expected/might be expected from a well-rated hotel (in this case quite over-rated).

Hotel service was very poor, but that likely had as much to do with the hotel management, training provided, and supervision. The precautions for covid were not particularly good or adhered to; the management was completely unresponsive to significant concerns. The hotel itself is greatly located and has some good (not great) amenities. anyone looking for something in the 4-Star or 5-Star range in the area could do much better.

title: Definitely exceeded my expectations.
text:
The Marmara is by far my favorite hotel to stay at in NYC!  The hotel is centrally located to explore this great city and make the most of your visit. The hotel interior is stunning! From the start, the staff were all very courteous, accommodating, and professional in answering and addressing all my needs and concerns. 

Before my arrival I had ordered meal preps to have delivered to the hotel to enjoy during my stay. Upon checking in, the gentleman at the reception desk named Roger informed me that my meals had not only arrived but, he had graciously taken it upon himself to store them in my room refrigerator. Props to Roger, thanks so much, I greatly appreciated that!  The room itself was in pristine condition. All in all, I highly recommend staying at The Marmara. I look forward to my next stay!

title: Καλό!
text: Κεντρικό ξενοδοχείο σε καλή τοποθεσία για να πήγαινεις παντού με τα πόδια. Ακριβώς δίπλα υπάρχει μετρό.Διπλα δυστυχώς υπήρχε άσυλο αστέγων κι έβλεπες τις δύο όψεις αυτής της πόλης ξεκάθαρα. ευρύχωρο δωμάτιο,με πολύ μεγάλη τηλεόραση και ωραιο μπάνιο,μπουρνούζια, καφετιέρα εσπρέσο και ομπρέλα. Αρκετά σκοτεινό θα το χαρακτήριζα αν και είναι όλο το στυλ του ξενοδοχείου τέτοιο. Μικρό lobby μεν με υπέροχα κρεμάστρα τζάκια δε.Στο -1 διαθέτει εσωτερική πισίνα που δε χρησιμοποίησα βέβαια. Για το πρωινό δεν έχω άποψη γιατί δεν τρωγαμε ποτέ εκεί.. τρως με πολύ λιγότερα εκτός ξενοδοχείου.. καλο room service μέσω εφαρμογής απο το tablet του δωματίου.οι τιμές είναι ΌΚ μιας και βρίσκεσαι στη Νέα Υόρκη. Εμείς κλείσαμε νωρις για Χριστούγεννα και η τιμή ήταν γύρω στα 250€/μέρα. Συνολικά, θα το χαρακτήριζα καλό μόνο και μόνο λόγω κομβικής θέσης.Θα το επέλεγα ξανά.

title: Excellent Midtown NYC Hotel
text: The hotel rooms are quite nice and very spacious. It’s an apartment style hotel with good views of the city. Some of the rooms do have a kitchen (not kitchenette), which is rare, so you can really have a staycation and cook. (It’s not always about room service, you can cook and make it equally special).

title: STAY AWAY!
text: I’ve seen motels run better than this place! Absolutely horrible 1st they tell you if you want room service you have to order through the iPad which doesn’t work, 2nd after specifically asking for my car to be out at 4am so my girlfriend can catch her flight they told me the Garage Wasn’t open even though they said it would be. Rooms are trash they look like a 3 star property. Walls sooo thin you can hear everything. Oh and staff continuously knocks on your door from 8am -12pm. I even had a front desk agent walk into my room at 9am! The best part is when i ask for a manager to express my frustration they send me to a supervisor who catches an attitude with me like it’s my fault.

title: Not as good as expected.
text:
Take care when you book a room as the pic sent with the booking is incorrect . We booked a suite and it was tiny,complained and got moved to a much bigger room.
Staff on the desk were not at all friendly or helpful,however the manager was and he sorted it.
Good location.
Room was Ok ,not what I would call 5 star more like 4 ,wooden floors ,shower ,not much storage space.Lot of scuffed furniture and on walls , needs an update. Dark dingy corridors!
Breakfast ,so slow and pricey so we ate out every day.

title: Great location for MSG
text: 10 min walk to MSG or grand central station. Lovely room, Nespresso coffee, nice toiletries and water on arrival in the room but neither water nor toiletries replenished after arrival so you gave to purchase your own. No bottle opener in the room which is an issue when served at the bar and bottles left unopened!!  Lovely smell in the lobby and throughout, and overall a good experience but not quite 5 star. Only mirror in the room is in the bathroom so difficult to do makeup and hair when partner wants to get ready too. Remote control doesn’t reach from the bed so it’s pointless!!  And mouldy bathroom door frame, Only minor things but still they’re annoying and not expected of a 5star hotel.

title: Just ok
text:
I wish I could say I was way more impressed, but this hotel has more of a transient feel for someone who is transitioning from apartment living rather than someone who is in town visiting. Inside the rooms there are dishes, glassware, a coffee machine, toaster, but lacks things that you actually want from a basic hotel room. 

1) Lighting. It was so dark in the room, even opening the blinds did not help. 

2) zero counter space in the bathroom. Which seems trivial, but when you are getting ready it’s helpful. 

3) plugs next to bed

4) carpeting. I absolutely despise dirty carpets, it really sets the tone for the stay and room in general. Our room had a beautiful view, but the filthiest stained carpets. 

On a plus, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was clean and beautiful. The staff in front is nice, we never bothered to ask for anything.

title: The Marmara Park Avenue
text: My friend and I stayed at the Marmara In NYC one night before we set out on a trip through New England.  For $369 a night I expected something more.  It is a drab, dark, uninspiring small hotel. The rooms are small and narrow.  A slightly better furnished La Quinta is the best way I can describe it. That said, it is clean and neat.  For your money there are many better options in NYC.  When a hotel approaches $400 a night I expect more.  The Marmara was equivalent to a small boutique hotel you can book in any capital city around the world for $200.00.  $200 to $250 is what you should be paying for this hotel.  Not a cent more.  There are so many better options in NYC at the $350 and above rate.

title: We are regular visitors to NYC and this is the first time staying at The Marmara Park Avenue location.
text: The Marmara Park Avenue is a an awesome location in the heart of Midtown East Manhattan with incredible accessibility by subway to anywhere else in NYC just a few steps from the front door of the hotel.  Fully updated rooms and suites with high ceilings and modern amenities.  Hotel staff was awesome, and the lobby bar has a lot of great energy.  Most rooms have full kitchens along with washer and dryer.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: LONG TERM STAY
text: I basically lived in the Marmara for four and a half months, in Fall 2019.  I was working in NYC and needed a place that could provide the comforts of a hotel with a more apt. like setting.  I stayed in one of the Marmara's one bedroom, full kitchen apartments. It was a perfect option for me. A large living room, kitchen, bathroom and bedroom with laundry and dryer built in. But what I appreciated most about the Marmara was the service. I so appreciated the extra effort put out by Yolanda and her staff, including DuWayne, Emily, Annabelle, David, and everyone else who went out of their way to make me feel comfortable living at this hotel.  I couldn't have asked for a better option considering I was away from home so long.  The staff was wonderful!

title: Couples holiday
text: We stayed there for 4 nights, it’s a beautiful hotel but I wouldn’t say it’s the cleanest. We had a king room, when booking it we had no idea what the room looked like as there was no pictures of that particular room, however it’s the best room I have ever stayed in. We had a balcony and amazing view of the Empire State. Comes with a coffee machine which came in handy! When it comes to the staff the main women who checked us in wasn’t too friendly however the other staff was friendly enough. at the end of the holiday we had to pay a tourist tax, which came to $133.12 which luckily we knew about so I set some money aside. Paying that I wasn’t happy about as that hotel isn’t cheap anyway. Location is okay, but it’s an expensive area to be in, the subway was literally right next to the hotel so that was handy although we only used it twice.

title: A great place to stay in the heart of New York City
text: I enjoyed my stay very much. The staff was very kind and helpful. When I had a problem with the heating in my room, they solved it in a matter of minutes. The room was very spacious, comfortable and clean. Breakfast was great and the internet connection fast. The swimming pool and the gym are very clean and the hamam beautiful. The hotel is so central I could walk most of the time rather than using transportation. I would definitely go again.

title: A solid NOMAD option
text:
I had not heard of this hotel, and booked it based on a favorable rate.  Overall, I was happy with the choice, but there are some issues the hotel could address.  

In terms of the good things:
* Reasonable NOMAD location....a bit far East but within a 15 min walking distance of Madison Square Park, Eataly, the Flatiron, tons of good coffee shops, excellent restaurants, etc.  Not prime NOMAD, but good and literally 50 meters from the subway (6 uptown).
* Rooms were reasonably sized, and beds were comfortable with nice linen.  The bathroom was very small with no counter space, but clean and attractive white marble.  Good closet space, Nespresso machine, and nice standard amenities.   Good quality bathrobes and slippers
* Good sized exercise room reasonable stocked with equipment including free weights, treadmill, eliptical, rower, etc.  EXCELLENT pool and lovely hammam....exceptional for this sized hotel.  Locker room with showers was great. 

The not so good:
*  Even rooms on high floors can be dark if they face East.
* . Lobby area walls, furniture, etc are worn and dirty and need maintenance immediately.  Likewise the interior of the elevators.
* . The elevators are annoyingly slow even at off hours.
* . In this day and age, every hotel should have bedside outlets....NONE.
* . Zero counter space in the bathroom is a huge inconvenience
* . Service can be a bit spotty.  I asked for a few small above and beyond services (like faxing a document) and they were not done  (claim that fax number wasnt working, but it worked fine for me when I walked 6 blocks to FedEx to do it myself)

Overall, if the price is right this is a very solid NOMAD option.

title: Un excelente apart fuera del centro
text: El apart cumplió con creces las expectativas. Agradable, bien atendido, muy buena limpieza, excelente trato. En cuanto a la lejanía de los lugares eran 20/25; minutos desde el hotel en subte. Cómo hotel bárbaro me replanteo la ubicación sobre todo en invierno cuando a las 4.30 de la tarde es de noche

title: Not a 5* hotel and a scam !
text:
When you pay over $3000 for a week for a studio, you would at least expect something similar to what the photos reflect. I expected a spacious studio and hoped that we would get a balcony. 
This was the most disappointing hotel I have ever stayed in. 
It’s in no way a 5* and unfortunately the disappointment is not rectified by the staff. 
A couple of days before travelling to New York we got an e mail to say the changes we requested for had been done and that the new cost would be roughly another $1000. Which is shocking to say the least. 
We called the hotel to clarify and after argument we had the pricing reversed to the original. 
At check in we were early, but they stored our bags and they promised to call and let us know when the ‘studio’ was ready. They did. 
Once we went to the room I was shocked with the small size it was. It was actually smaller than the standard and double rooms that they advertise. I looked at photos on their direct website, trip advisor and booking.com before booking and they all matched so I was satisfied I would get something along those lines however the difference is quite drastic. 
I asked the receptionist what room we were in and she reluctantly said a studio and that it was one of the smaller size ones, also that the hotel was full and could not change it. 
I told her about the advertised photos and she said that they get this from booking.com all the time as they advertise the wrong photos !! I told her that all websites advertise the same photos but then she just argued and said there was no space. She also said that if we wanted a bigger studio it would cost more and if we wanted a balcony it would cost even more😡 she said we should have called the hotel after making the booking to make sure we would get a studio with space. But there was no space and nothing she could do. 

When I returned to the room I saw housekeeping and asked again. That lady said our room was a standard and not a studio!😳
So .. what do you do ? Start looking for another hotel and loose payment ?
Then I started to understand. You make a booking through booking.com thinking you’ll get a spacious studio with possibly a balcony. They don’t charge you until you go there. They try to up the charges before you arrive. If you challenge the additional cost you get downgraded and they call a standard room a studio! I feel that this is the biggest scam hotel. And felt rather stupid for falling into their trap. 

That aside, we stayed and had no contact with any of the staff. 

The location is ok, just a little out of the way. 

The room could have been cleaner. There were stains on the carpet and one of the towels was dirty. The bathrobes were frayed. 

There was a nesspresso machine which was great. 

The bathroom was tiny with no space for your own personal effects. The shower pressure was good however there was issues with hot water and we had to complain almost daily to get it working. 

The room lighting was very bad. No ceiling lights at all. And no sufficient lamps. 

The hotel in general could use better maintenance. 

I never used their spa or pool. 

I would never stay here again. 

If you choose to, contact them in advance . Ask them to send you photos of the room you will get. Confirm the pricing in advance. Be ready to pay their resort fees.

title: Magnificent Accomodation and Professional Representatives
text:
Striking Penthouse with double decks and views of the Empire State Building and Chrysler building from one deck and the World Trade Center from the other.
Elegant and palatial quarters with modern ammenities. Large gally kitchen with a Nespresso machine and well stocked for serving. Living  area has a lovely  gas burning fireplace.
Director Of Operations, Yolanda was extremely accomodating with our needs.

title: Lovely hotel
text:
A great hotel with friendly staff. We had room service one evening as my wife was unwell and the food was great. The rooms are well equipped and very comfortable. The hotel is right on the subway (4 line) and is only a 10 minute walk to grand central station. The hotel has a number of great restaurants around too for added choice. 

The hotel is well run and organised and has a fantastic smell in the lobby! I’d love to know what that is so I can get it for my own home.

title: Spacious rooms, lovely indoor pool!
text: Stayed here for a few nights in February and should have reviewed before as this hotel is definitely one to recommend in New York. The rooms are more like suites with a very well equipped kitchen area with nespresso machine, fridge, small hob,  microwave etc. and very spacious by New York standards. The excellent kitchen facilities would be very useful for an extended stay. Also one of the few hotels in NY with an indoor pool - a great bonus and very relaxing. (Check it is open as when we first arrived it was closed for maintenance!). Room had comfortable bed, was kept immaculately clean and had a spacious well presented bathroom. Staff were accommodating and changed our first room to another with a bath tub as the first only had a shower. I seem to remember that the bathroom had a washing machine and dryer in a cupboard. The rooms are laid out in different styles but all seemed spacious. We didn’t have breakfast so can’t comment on that. The lighting in the room was a little dark but a small point to mention when overall a very comfortable place to stay. Highly recommend whether staying for business or leisure.

title: 8 day trip
text: Lovely boutique hotel, very spacious rooms by NY standard, modern and well furnished with a great hammam/spa.  Great location in midtown with easy access uptown and downtown.  Yolanda who is the operations director is awesome - great to see hands-on management with her at the front desk on a Sunday.

title: Really cool studio apartment hotel.
text:
The place has really big rooms that are nicely furnished.  Nice big bathrooms that were well maintained.  Adequate kitchenette if you want to buy food to make for breakfast and lunch.  Full size fridge in the room.  Big TVs in the rooms.  

Location is great if catching a show or game at the Garden.  Easy walking distance to many attractions. 

Minor gripes - no shampoo in the room,  didn’t get any the second day after the maid was in.  Luckily I had some from a previous trip.  For a hotel like this, that is a poor oversight. There was no trash can in the bathroom, which was just odd.  We got two coffee pods for the cappuccino maker.  No real coffee maker in the room.  We ordered a coffee for breakfast and it came as a one cup pot.  You’re better off going to a nearby Starbucks for coffee.  

Room service breakfast was good (but seriously they need to up their coffee service). 

I’d stay here again.

title: Excellent hôtel
text:
Très bel hôtel très proche d'une station de métro et à proximité avec Broadway.
Personnel agréable et disponible.

Notre séjour dans dans cet hôtel s'est passé en deux temps. La 1ère chambre était un simple lit double. Pas très confortable, car on dormait quasiment l'un sur l'autre.
Nous sommes allé voir la réception le lendemain et ils ont acceptés de nous changer de chambre pour deux lits doubles. Et là c'était complètement l'opposé. La chambre était très grande, avec deux grand lit (voir les photos) et une vue magnifique sur l'Empire State depuis le petit balcon. On pense qu'on a eu une suite (à la place d'une simple chambre).

L'hôtel propose également un "Roof top" au 20ème étage. La vue est époustouflante !

C'et un excellent hôtel.

title: BEST BOUTIQUE HOTEL!!! ❤️❤️
text:
The Marmara is my new favorite home away from home!  

The lobby is amazing! When you walk inside- you know you are walking into an elegant but not stuffy boutique hotel.  It is understated, tasteful, and modern.  The interior design elements chosen for the lobby are so memorable- from the glass entryway, to the modern bronze statues, to the flying bird installation to the sleek sofas.  The restaurant and bar in the lobby don’t overrun the lobby- it isn’t a party atmosphere- it is a sophisticated elegant atmosphere you can be comfortable to have a meal or a drink, wait for friends or just enjoy the decor.  

The staff is very friendly.  The restaurant is very willing to work with any dietary restrictions you may have and make modifications to the dishes as they are able.  The front desk staff seems genuinely happy to be working here and greets you cheerily with a smile, and with repeat visits, they make you feel like you have just returned home.  

Im obsessed with our room- so much so that its our 2nd time in the same room!  My daughter, my luggage, and I have plenty of personal space!  I love that we are not on top of each other!  It is very difficult to find hotel rooms in Manhattan that are not the size of shoe boxes and do not show the wear and tear on the property.  The Marmara is a standout on this point.  We don’t have to shimmy around our beds and luggage to walk around the room or go to the bathroom.  Because there is enough space to live and exist, you can walk upright unhindered, and really enjoy the room without bumping into anything because the room functions actually the way it was designed to be used.  The room itself is chic and beautiful.  The entire room has dark wood floors and much of the custom furniture is made of the same.  We have 2 super comfortable queen sized beds a large window, and a kitchenette.  One of the things I love most is being able to make myself tea in the evening with a proper super clean hot water pot.  The marble bath isn’t big- but it is really nice and clean and has C.O. Bigelow Pharmacy products throughout, as well as cushy bathrobes and comfy bedroom slippers.  

In case you need it- there is space for your glam squad.  You don’t actually have use your bed as a staging/seating area for anything.  There are sensible, appropriate height chairs, a beautiful small glass dining table, plenty of outlets, and space to maneuver. 

Another plus is that the 6 train is literally right outside of the hotel, and the next stop is 42nd Street where you can connect through to pretty much every train line.  

This is our new favorite spot we will be returning to on the regular!  In case you are checking out the hotels in this area, we also tried the Mondrian which is a block away and it did not hold a candle in any way to The Marmara.

title: Well situated mid-town base for a couple of days
text: Comfortable efficiency-type room (room types vary), clean and modern, suited us very well for two days before a cruise. The almost black decor of the corridors is weird - NOT a plus point, but of little consequence. Don’t bother with the bar/restaurant, but get a Universal Breakfast just two minutes away

title: My ONLY Hotel in NYC - Stunning view, refined style, soft sophistication, and amazing staff.
text:
I excursion worldwide with my business. Travel being a lifestyle function, each city I frequent across North America, Asia, Europe, and the South Pacific consists of one hotel that I call home. In NYC, that's the Marmara Park Avenue. I've stayed many places... The Plaza, Four Seasons, Ritz, etc. The Marmara tops all of them here. 

I love city views. The 280 degree view of the entire Manhattan skyline from the roof rivals being atop the Empire State Building (which you can see, just up the street). The rooms are well refined, without sacrificing homeliness and comfort. The bed is amazing. Located between Park and Lex on 32nd... FiDi, Gramercy Park, Greenwich, Meatpacking, NoMad, Midtown, and Central Park are all easy access (relatively speaking, it's NYC). The subterranean work out facility, pool, and turkish bath are second to none. 

More important than anything to me and above all at this hotel are the staff. I have never been treated more like a resident, friend, valued guest, and family member than at the Marmara. From my first stay forward, everyone knew my name and greeted me when I walked in and left the building. Need quick dry cleaning and the in-house loads were sent out for the day? Yolanda and her amazing staff will find the nearest spot, take your items, and have it back same day. You do not find this type of personal-professional touch anywhere, especially in Manhattan. I am very happy when I'm here and would call this place home. 

I also feel that for the high quality across the board, the rate is more competitive than any 5 star spot in the city. 

I routinely recommend The Marmara to my family, friends, and business peers.

title: Excellent service!
text:
We stayed for 3 nights and had a wonderful time. The room was comfortable and clean.  The location is great, not that busy and at the center of town. 
Staff was incredible! Thank you Yolanda and all in the team for making us feel at home .

title: Hotel 4 star minimalist
text:
A hotel certainly inspired by Apple!!!
No refrigerator. No boiling kit to make tea or coffee. 
Only one chair. No book on services. 
Only an I pad. I couldn’t find the checking out time.
I had to look on their website.
I chose the hotel for the swimming pool and steam bath. 
Steam-bath in the ancient manner. Hot water runs and the steam rises. You have just to wait 10 minutes.

title: A hidden secret of personal comfort in NYC
text:
I never often stay at the same hotel more than once as you don’t experience new innovations and the unknown. In NYC I’ve made this hotel to be my base. Ideally located on Park Avenue and 32nd. It’s a short walk to GCT and Madison Park. 

The hotel is simple a small but effective reception attentive staff and a Turkish massage to die for. With a great roof garden and local restaurants it’s all you need. 

In general you get great rooms much larger than the normal NYC closets, with kitchenettes and helpful service it’s great for longer stays. 

Now, it needs a make over, the rooms are showing the signs of wear along with the corridors. It’s slightly dark, but to stay on my list they have to upgrade. 

Happy memories, but maybe not in the future as I need The Marmara to thrill once again.

title: Absolutely fabulous hotel!
text:
This hotel is fabulous. Firstly the location is fantastic. I was working in the Empire State Building for the week and despite the humidity my walk to work was great as my hotel was so central!  The hotel was amazingly comfortable to sleep in, that’s everything from the beds to the actual silence inside. I’ve never stayed in such a quiet hotel. The rooftop bar is fabulous, what a gorgeous place to watch the sun set. Finally the staff were just amazing and couldn’t have looked after me better. 

I’d recommend this in a heartbeat!

title: Manager needs to take a customer service course
text:
After traveling 2 hours to Manchester airport waiting 2 hours to check in flying 7 hours from England to jfk waiting in a 3 hour passport control queue and 1 hour transfer  my husband and 3 children couldn’t wait to check in to our 5 star hotel and start our dream of visiting New York. 
We were greeted by Yolande (manager) who looked at our booking and said there’s “no way we can stay for that price” 
4 nights for $1800 I know great price for a 2 bed apartment. 
She said they don’t even have that room available she didn’t know what’s going on with the booking and just kept screwing up her face saying nah nah nah nah
No way. 
We had a print out in black & white of the room details and the booking yet she insisted we couldn’t stay for that price. She was loud, rude and obnoxious. I tried to stay calm but after almost an hour of her talking over us I started looking for other hotels she had me close to tears after telling us we could stay but it would cost another $1000. I didn’t get the fact we had the documents in front of her stating price and room booked. In the end after us all getting upset she said we could have the loft for 1 night then we would have to be moved! How can the fact that we had a room booked be no longer available. I wanted nothing more to do with her. my husband had to find her the next day to ask when we would be moved she told him we no longer would be. She told us nothing about the hotel didn’t welcome us at all and spoke down to us like naughty school children. This is not a 5 star hotel more 3 star i don’t know who had cleaned it but the toilet was disgusting and the bathroom covered in hair. Very disappointing start to a trip I’ve been waiting a lifetime for. Safe to say I would definitely not recommend this hotel to anyone.

title: Schade...
text:
Von aussen sieht es schick aus und die Lage ist perfekt.
Gut geschlafen hab ich auch, mein Zimmer im 16. Stock war ruhig.
Aber das wars bereits an positiven Aspekten. Als ich ankam und offensichtlich Mühe hatten meine 3 Gepäckstücke zu tragen, bewegte sich der Concierge keinen Meter auf mich zu und schaute einfach wie ich mich abmühte.
Meine Hemden aufbügeln zu lassen war nicht möglich. In Hotel geschickte und bestätigte Messeware war angeblich nicht da. Als ich mir von zuhause die Trackingnummer besorgte, fanden sich die Packete dann doch, der Concierge war einfach zu faul nachzuschauen.
Die Zimmer sind ungemütlich und leicht schmuddelig, ebenso wie das gesamte Hotel. Selbst besagter Concierge trug ein verdrecktes Hemd.
Eine Rechnung konnte beim Check-our nicht ausgestellt werden, da ich angeblich bei einem Drittanbieter gebucht hätte (was ich allerdings nie mache).
Auch wenn der Eingangsbereich erstmal schick aussieht, ist es bei genauerer Betrachtung ein Reinfall. Keine Seele, kein Charme, unfreundliches und wenig bemühtes Personal. Für diesen Zimmerpreis war das nicht genug. Sorry.

title: Good choice for an apartment style hotel in New York
text: I would definitely consider staying here again. Room choice is important. This aparthotel has a fanstastic upmarket swimming pool, sauna and gym. Room choice is very important though. For me it works if you go for a loft suite - this given space and washing machine, fridge cooker etc - all high end, a real feel of NY living. Bedroom only are a little small. Can be expensive unless you secure one of their offers. Staff very friendly. Free local calls

title: Удобное расположение в центре
text: Отель удобно расположен в центре, многие достопримечательности, магазины, рестораны - в шаговой доступности. Очень внимательный и профессиональный персонал. Многие недоработки в отеле компенсируются вниманием к твоим нуждам со стороны персонала. Номер оказался гораздо меньше того, который сфотографирован на сайте. Кровать загнали в нишу, доступ к ней только с одной стороны, в итоге для прикроватных тумбочек места не нашлось. Заявленных Кофе и чая в номере нет. Отель с хорошей звукоизоляцией: тихо. Вид из окна неплохой: на город. Очень неудобный душ: нужно пользоваться очень аккуратно, иначе весь пол в ванной комнате по щиколотку залит водой.

title: Lovely little gem
text: This is my second time at this hotel, great location, lovely well appointed rooms, fabulous roof terrace in the converted penthouse, great facilities. Staff are pleasant but not terribly knowledgeable but I am struggling to find fault it was very good

title: Not a great start but our stay improved
text:
First impression of this hotel was the light and airy reception area and check in was efficient. Our room appeared very modern but once we had been in it for a few hours our opinion changed of the practicality of it. The bed was a drop down which fitted tight to one wall, was very high and the gap at the top was wide so pillows fell into it. The one chair in the room was mainly metal  - no cushion and most uncomfortable. 
We asked to be moved and it took 2 nights before we  were allocated a deluxe room with mini kitchen and well stocked bathroom. This was a most comfortable room to return to after  long days sightseeing.

Breakfasts were generous in size if expensive but we just shared one between us as there was plenty of food for both! 

The hotel was ideally situated as we were able to walk to places like Times Square, Macy's, Empire State Building etc and the blocks are easily navigated. 

An Indian and Italian restaurant was a very short walk away and both served very good meals.

This was a comfortable hotel and we enjoyed our stay BUT ensure you book a room with a 'proper ' bed unless you are happy with one tight against the wall!!

My review and scores are based on the nights we spent in the upgraded room.

title: One bedroom Suite for Summer 2019
text:
This was my second stay at The Marmara Park Avenue i had arrange don this occasion to stay at the one bedroom suite as i enjoyed having the flexibility of having a big room with a  nice living area and kitchen with  coffee maker toaster sink microwave and fridge which gives u the feel of NYC living, with the perk of  room service  and cleaning.

The team  managed sur e that i was given  a room with a terrace a great luxury and something u dont always find in NYC.  I used that balcony a lot for breakfast and great pics  for instagram and a view of the empire state building

The rooms a s spacious and  well maintained.  The room iPad was useful to ensure turn down and room cleaning was done  and  the breakfast  was simply delicious 

When u walk into the hotel not only is it  a fantastic lobby but very friendly and  lovely staff who remembered me from my lats visit .  They really feel like family and are always  helpful.

My room wa since and quiet and i got a  good amount of sleep 
The gym was well equipped but having the pool and human was a nice touch and again very rare in NYC 
the staff again so friendly
Overall thanks to Yolanda and Gina i had ana amazing stay which i would recommend to anyone and i am happy to say this will be my hotel of choice when i visit NYC.

title: Idéalement situé!
text: Non loin de Times Square, de l’Empire State Building et de Grand Central Station, cet hôtel de bon confort est idéalement situé pour découvrir New-York. De plus il se trouve à quelques mètres d’une bouche de métro. Seule mauvaise surprise, nous avions réservé par Voyage Privé, et à notre départ nous avons dû payer $120 de "fees" que nous n’avions pas prévus.

title: Plusses and Minuses but Overall Good
text:
Recently wrapped up a 3-day “staycation” here and here is my honest review.  I will caveat this by saying I know Manhattan and specifically chose this hotel due to its proximity to Koreatown which is two blocks away.
First, the area is very convenient for thise travelling by train or subway, as Penn is a few blocks away and the 6 stops right on the corner if coming from Grand Central.  Also, the area is very quiet on weekends as it’s off Park on 32nd so far enough away from Penn/KTown/Herald Sq area but close enough to walk.  Downside is there’s a homeless services center literally right next door so lots of homeless congregate at all hours right near hotel entrance and particularly during mealtimes and also at the corner near Subway.  However this is not the hotel’s fault and NYC has homeless everywhere anyway so it doesn’t faze me.  Now to the hotel itself.  We enjoyed a 1 BR “suite”, wet bar (not the full kitchen) on 15th floor with views of Chrysler and Empire State Building.  We specifically asked for this view and thankfully request was honored.  I can say that it looks like the only balcony rooms were on the 13th, 15th and 17th floors so most rooms do not have a balcony.  frankly, not sure you need it as after one night the thrill wore off.  The room itself was nicely appointed with two massive Samsung tvs (one remote didnt work but I didnt complain).  The wet bar is nice and it had nice furnishings and bedding.  The bathroom is very small but we got by and the water pressure was outstanding.  
The Hotel lobby is nice, we had breakfast there one day and the food was okay, very overpriced but not unexpected.  Lobby bar is understaffed (as is hotel in general).  
The pool and Hammam in basement are very nice.  We went to pool twice and were only ones there.  Pool is 4 feet to 4’6” and has life guard.  Hours were 7-9.  The Hammam was stunning and a true luxury.
The rooftop bar was nice and offered open views of July 4 fireworks which we enjoyed however was understaffed and dis not have full drink or food menu.  Also, the last night we were there the hotel literally pasted a note in the elevator at like 8 pm that it was closed for private party which was disconcerting as we had planned to go up there after we came back from dinner.
Also the service.  I wouldnt say it’s bad I would say it’s more nonexistent.  It seems more a corporate housing hotel or one for those like me who don’t really need blanket service while in NYC.
Overall a fine hotel probably a solid four stars (nowhere near five).

title: Stay in this hotel at your peril !
text:
