We arrived,tired from St Louis, late afternoon and were keen to be out and about as we only had 3 nights here. Bad start - as a swimmer, I’d chosen this hotel as it has a nice basement pool, just room for 3 people to do laps.
, so naturally I want to know when the spa and pool opened. The girl at reception first of all had us sign a list of monetary penalties we’d incur for stealing items from our room ; breakages ; smoking in the room and more !! Welcome to the Marmara ! She confirmed that the pool opened at 9am,so in the morning, I woke early,but hung around waiting for 9am only to discover, when going to the pool,that it actually opened at 7am !!
Am expensive midtown hotel,and our basic room was small,and with a bathroom without anywhere to put all our toiletries,so naturally these and other items had to be placed on top of the drawer unit and fridge provided. Unfortunately, despite the limited room size, the huge bed impeded movement,so that my wife and I were constantly trying to avoid bumping into the very sharp corner of the bed base without success. Finally coming back on our final night at 9.30pm I bumped again but this time,the sharpness of the corner made a severe gash on my leg. Luckily we had ice in our room,and with that wrapped in towelling,it stemmed the blood flow only after a half hour or so. In the morning we reported this to 2 receptionists who told us their admin boss was on her way back to NYC and would like to speak to us. Not possible,as we were returning to UK,the Spain shortly,but my wife had taken 3 rather gruesome photographs,which one of the staff couldn’t look at. We did email the management lady,including these photos,and a rather pointless weak reply arrived a few hours later.
No further correspondence resulted after I made it clear that waiting to hear her apologising would have been a complete waste of our time anyway. We all understand that ‘sorry’ is the most abused word in the English language unless accompanied with some form of compensation, which to date, has not happened.
All in all a disappointing experience in a hotel which looks better online than what you get in facilities and service. I still have these photographs for anyone interested.

title: Inakzeptabel
text:
Das Hotel Marmara Park Avenue an der E 32 nd Str. NY Manhatten wird als luxuriöse Unterkunft angeboten. Für uns, die NY nicht zum ersten Mal bereisen bot mir schon früher eine „einfachere“ Unterkunft weit viel mehr Komfort und Annehmlichkeiten. Das Hotel entsprach in keiner Art und Weise unsere Erwartungen! Inakzeptabel ist zudem noch, dass das Hotel diese Frechheit besass uns wörtlich bezüglich unseres Zimmers reinzulegen. Statt ein „normales“ Queen Zimmer mit einem „richtigen“ Bett bekamen wir ein „Reserve-Zimmer mit einem aufklappbaren Bettsofa zugeteilt, das eh zu schmal war aber vor allem äusserst unbequem war. Da wir nach einem langen Flug und beim jet lag dies nicht sogleich realisierten nahmen wir das mit dem ungemütlichen Zimmer hin. Nach aber 6 Tage heftiger Rückenschmerzen möchten wir das Hotel ganz klar degradieren. Nebst dieser pardon: „Verarschung“ hat auch sonst nicht viel geklappt: unfreundliches, nicht hilfreiches und sehr unorganisiertes Personal bestätigten unsere rundum negative Erfahrung, nie im Leben kämen wir wieder hierher und raten andere ganz klar davon ab. 

Bei den Fotos ersichtlich: das aufgeklappte, das uns als Queen Bett uns „verkaufte“ Bettsofa!!

title: Vacation in NYC at the Marmara Park Ave
text:
Staff are great and very friendly. Mike who will always greet you with a smile and handshake. 
A very enjoyable stay, and hope to see them all next time. Great views from the rooftop bar on level 20...

title: Avoid Marmara. PLEASE READ!
text:
The Marmara Park Hotel After charging through Internet, charges additional compulsory 29usd plus taxes when you leave (even if spa isnt used). Im considering to start a legal action soon.

Beware of this. Many customers argue about it online.

Maintainance is horrible condition and reception awful mood.

Better pay same USD for hotels nearby. I go to NY often and strongly recommend to avoid Marmara.

Pics are just a small example.

title: Scam hotel! Not a five star ( not even a motel)
text:
our time in the marmara park hotel was beyond terrible.

We checked for 7 nights and felt robbed

The first night we were send to a handicapped room but did not ask for it when booked one month ago. The only thing that separate the shower from the rest of the bathroom was a lame courtain. Everything got wet, I almost fell.

The windows double curtain let all the sun come in. We woke up a five am because of the light.

We complain about this with Yolanda Garcia( manager) but she told us that all rooms where the same, without bathtub and so.  Of course It was a lie! 

We slept upset and the next day, after a terrible second discussion with her (where she yeld at me telling me to back off that she was older that me and that I should shut up), we were sent to the room , imposible to sleep because of the AC compressor noise inside the room.

After this , Yolanda sent an apologize letter with two pieces of fruit ( yes, that’s what we needed) after making our second day a nightmare. She sent a engineer, the guy told us that was imposible to fix.

The third night we were sent to a different room ( third time I did the luggage in 3 days). We founf filth inside the blankets. We wanted to leave and the told us it’s imposible because it was payed in advance.

When we did the check out they wanted us to pay a resort fee. First time I have to pay in a 5 star an extra for the pool and “gym” of course we argued and they took it back. Another scam.

This was supposed to be our happy vacation. They know nothing about customer service. We even tried to reach the director and of course she didn’t answer

title: Peaceful oasis, great customer care
text: This is a gem, a calm and quiet oasis well located in lower midtown. The decor is swanky and sophisticated and the rooms are really nicely done. I loved the loft with the kitchen. However, the prices are extremely reasonable as well. There is a great team of friendly, helpful people to take care of you. The spa is amazing. You must get a hammam massage in one of only 7 authentic turkish baths in NYC. Highly recommend.

title: Located close to many trains
text:
I recently stayed here since my BF was staying here for work, so I decided to stay with him to make my commute easier as well. Here is some of the good and the bad:

Pros:
-Location - it's located right outside of the 6 train, and if if you walk two more avenues, you'll have access to the B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, and the Path train. Two more avenues in the opposite direction will take you to a load of restaurants, bars (warning - most of them are bro bars), a Target, and a Trader Joe's
-They give you a pair of slippers. I've never seen this in an American hotel - only hotels in Asia, so this was a nice touch
-They have an indoor pool, and a Turkish Bath you can use that's included in your stay. The bath is kind of like a sauna with wall to wall marble. It's nice to relax in there - however, it closes at 8:45
-Next to the Turkish bath was a shower you can use to rinse off, which has 9 shower heads. Could have been nice if we were able to figure out how to get it to spray warm water, instead of water that was ice cold (especially since you're coming from a steam room)
-There's an iPad they use for servicing - meaning you can order toiletries from it, select a time preference of when you want them to clean your room, and they even have turn down service!

Cons:

-No fridge. These are apparently available in all rooms except for the standard one
-There's a balcony but it's a bit weird - it's connected to the room next to yours so technically, strangers can walk over to your room from the balcony. Would be cool if you are traveling with friends, but creepy if you are not. Just be sure to keep those doors locked
-Sink is small, so there's no where to really put your toiletries

I don't know how much it was per night, but I'm guessing it was not cheap. But if you're willing to pay the price, this is a great hotel if you're visiting NYC. It's located in Midtown, so it's a good jumping point to explore Manhattan.

title: Bueno pero....
text:
El hotel no es malo, para mí no es un 5 estrellas, pero las instalaciones están más o menos bien, les faltaría un poco más de cuidado.
Ahora lo que es PÉSIMO es la gente de recepción, el huésped acá ni EXISTE!!!. La ignorancia y colaboración al viajero es absolutamente notoria. Llama la atención como la gente del lobby esquiva en todo al viajero.
Eso no es de un hotel 5 estrellas.
Después es como todos, pero si van a pagar un studio loft como nosotros a casi 500 dólares la noche, acá no lo hagan!!!!

title: Stylish medium sized retreat
text:
We stayed in the deluxe room in between cruises, plus points....
Room size generous 
Bed very large, comfortable 
Eating in room - great facilities 
Central location
Negatives...
Lift slow, 
Private parties absorb resources such as roof top bar and lobby bar
Check often takes to 3pm to get into room
Restaurant facilities limited 

Overall good value in central location.

title: Great Stay
text:
The hotel is beautifully decorated sharing a lobby and a lounge. I stayed in Mid- April for a couple of days and the weather was a bit wacky but the complimentary umbrellas were a life saver. The room was decent, a bit on the small end but we did book the standard room but the Queen size bed was really comfortable. The wellness Center was amazing I slept like a baby. Upon arrival, I was impressed. I was greeted by Yari who gave us a complete overview of the hotel and was completely outstanding. The doorman Udu was also a charm. Highly loved their customer service and definitely recommend to look for them if you are there. It seemed though that not everyone else there was up to the same standard. The bar staff seemed very rude with one word answers but I think it's a language barrier? They did end up telling me that the hotel is Turkish. Also upon checking out with Natalia it all seemed so rushed, as if she was trying to get rid of us as quickly as possible which did not feel like 5-star service & was not a nice finish to our lovely stay =. I do always ask for names because I like to acknowledge those who deserve it. 
Overall, I recommend The Marmara 100%, it can really be a home away from home with the amenities it offers.

title: Could be better....some staff not up to scratch
text:
We had a few problems with our stay. The room smelled and there were multiple issues with the air con which was incredibly noisy - enough to wake you up regularly. That is, if it actually works. For us and at least a couple of other rooms it did not during exceptionally hot temperatures. Whilst this was fixed the system was really poor, fragile and slow - ie the repairman blamed the failure on several units on one resident setting the temperature  too low and breaking it! Actually - no - one day when we got back we saw that staff had changed it....

Speaking of staff  - overall not great: when trying to get air con fixed staff were downright rude and dismissive as if it was not an issue. Another incident involved a member of staff loudly complaining to us of what an awful place Mamara is to work on the basis of its disorganisation. In general whilst a few staff were friendly many particularly front desk didn't understand they work in the 'hospitality'  industry and a degree of friendly interaction and responsiveness with customers was required at this price point -  which they simply did not have/ were not trained for. Hotel manager knocked on door when do not disturb sign up.

Shower room was tiny, prone to flooding and as several others have commented uncomfortable in terms of flow and temperature.

However location is excellent  - as is in room coffee/ tea facilties/ fridge and outstanding swimming pool. If we had not had the above issues would have been five star.

title: Nice hotel, good location, overpriced (but that's NYC)
text:
Stayed for two nights mid-April. The first room they assigned us was pretty bad. The bed was very uncomfortable (Murphy bed) and the room was small and dark. Only one window. Not at all what I expected for the rate. Talked to the front desk in the morning and they moved us to a much nicer room the second night. If you check in and find a Murphy bed in your room I advise going straight back to the front desk for reassignment rather than "giving it a shot" like I did!

The pool is great, nice and warm. Location is also very convenient to the subway etc. We did not get room service or eat at the hotel. 

Overall nice but really expensive, especially for the first room we got!

title: A small moan
text: This hotel is 200 yards from my wife’s NY office and not only convenient but a great place to stay.....here’s my complaint. Great room and great staff always helpful and friendly, but seriously, Coffee Mate. There’s a refrigerator in the room and I feel like I’m staying in a Motel 6 when these non-dairy abominations show up.

title: Well placed hotel
text:
Based in mid town Manhattan the Marmara is well placed to sightsee New York.

The room was in three parts, bedroom with a super king sized bed, Wall tv and side cabinets. A kitchenette with sink, fridge, microwave and more food/plate cupboards than you need. The third part was a smallish bathroom with walk in shower.

The lobby area doubled or tripled as a bar and restaurant and reception. The staff were most pleasant and not at all like the stereotypical TV New Yorkers. Lovely people and very helpful.

The corridors and lift areas were very darkly decorated and moodily lit.

title: Muy buen hotel en NYC.
text: No conocíamos el hotel y nos alojamos una semana basándonos en lo que vimos por internet. El check in fue más que adecuado y la habitación Studio era amplia y muy bien equipada. Nos tocó en un piso bajo sin vista, pero el confort hizo que fuera irrelevante estar en el contrafrente del edificio. El tamaño del baño y su ducha eran excelentes. La cocina estupenda. El personal, en su inmensa mayoría, atento y eficiente. Hay algunos detalles menores de limpieza y mantenimiento pero no afectan la satisfacción que nos ha provocado alojarnos en este lugar. Volveríamos allí sin dudarlo. Es un poco incómodo y contradictorio el cargo que cobran por reservar vía los sitios de hotelería (unos U$S 20.- por día), pero el monto es irrelevante en el precio de la habitación (eso si, la factura de dicho cargo es un poco confusa). Pudimos obtener un check out late, con cargo, quizá un poco caro por las horas en que nos excedimos (pero tampoco es un tema demasiado relevante). Resumiendo: altamente recomendable.

title: The Marmara Park Avenue
text: We stayed here for two nights after our cruise, booked and pre-paid by our Agent Six Star Cruises. The room was spacious and bright with a view over central Manhattan. A coffee maker was provided, a 'fridge, and a large flat-screen TV. Also provided was a Tablet enabling internet access. All the staff were friendly and helpful, our only complaint was being handed a bill for $66.56 on check out. I queried this, saying we had a pre-paid voucher and was told that certain local taxes cannot be pre-paid, which I knew, but what I didn't expect was to be charged a 'Facility fee' of $58 for the two days - what's that all about. I was told to take it up with my Agent and am awaiting a response from them atow.

title: Fairly modern Hotel
text:
Very modern reception, staff helpful. We were initially given a standard ( Murphy ?) room, which initially looked very cool & modern with ample facilities. However when trying to use the room it appeared that design had been put above function, the bed was positioned right up to the wall so one person had to clamber either over their partner or crawl to the bottom of the bed. As there were no bedside lamps , this was a challenge if you needed the bathroom in the night. There were also no bedside tables so you couldn’t even put your mobile near at hand to use the torch . 
We did speak to reception re this & were moved rooms for our second night. - much better ‘deluxe’ room , where the bed was better positioned with bedside lamps. Also had small kitchenette area with tea & coffee facilities & small fridge. 
Would recommend asking for a room where bed is not positioned near a wall.

title: So dissappointed
text: Breakfast was ridiculously limited in seating types and comfort, rooms a disaster of lighting and dated design but trying hard to be hip and the place seriously overpriced for what it is - my business partner also had a security problem in his room so all in all not a good experience. Won’t b staying here sgain

title: my favorite NYC Business Hotel
text: In terms of location, you can't get much better. Also, if you like to swim, the lap pool in basement is great. If you're not experienced with hammams, well, read up on it. In general, as long as the rates are okay, this will be my go-to NYC business hotel. I didn't try room service, but overall, decor is great, beds are nice, and service is pretty friendly. Elevators are slow, but that's my only minor complaint. Also, generally fairly quiet, good design. Spa staff are nice and helpful too.

title: Mike  maintenance
text: I had stayed at the Marmara a couple times on business. A couple of times when I needed something technical from the chief engineer that used to be in charge, I couldn’t get it done, or get a straight answer from him. But they have a new chief engineer named Mike, and that guy always came through and made me feel good. I’m a real technical person, so when I want to hook up my Apple TV to the television, or have access to a smart TV remote, etc. the guy always took care of me. The entire staff was very great and helpful, but the engineering department stood out for me and mainly because of Mike. I highly recommend this hotel!

title: Amazing Stay at the Marmara Park Avenue Hotel
text: Our experience at the Marmara Park Avenue was extraordinary from start to finish! The view from our room was amazing, and we even had our own balcony which is such a treat to have in New York. The Marmara also has a beautiful Hammam spa and indoor pool great for relaxing after a long day of walking. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for accommodation in New York! Also perfect location, very walkable to most major sights!

title: Excellent service
text: Let me start off by saying that I completely loved this hotel and I will definitely come back. The bed was superb and the sheets were comfortable. Yary was exceptional. She was so friendly and I can tell she is a perfect asset to the hotel. I work in the hotel industry myself and I have to say the service she gave was exceptional. Upon all the little things she did, she checked up on me and my husband to make sure that our stay was going well, how great is that? The detail was great. The staff greeted me by name. Another member of staff that I want to shout out is Dawan who was also very great. Now, the room was spacious, the view was beautiful and the pool area was sublime. The wellness center is magnificent. Everything was great with my stay. Thank you all!

title: Fantastic
text: The most amazingly comfortable bed I've ever slept in. Friendly and helpful staff. Lovely communal/bar area. Turkish bath and pool were lovely too, and deserted when we used them. Highly recommended, can't fault it!

title: Nice hotel, and even better location
text: The hotel was very well presented and our stay was very enjoyable. The staff was engaging & helpful with suggestions. the hotel was just fine for my wife & i for the weekend. We got booked this location thru Hotwire, so you are not sure on where you are staying and we got lucky. Hope you do, too

title: Amazing staff
text:
Thank you for all you did to take care of my parents and I during our recent stay. You made our visit so comfortable and treated us like family .

Look forward to coming back for the fantastic service , great restaurant, inviting lobby and hope to try the pool next time.

Thank you again

title: Sleep deprived parents be ware!
text: PR will be on this review like white on rice, however, management did nothing to help alleviate my concern. Here's a detailed review! Upon booking, I explained to the front desk that I am a new mom and would like a room that is quiet so I can get some sleep! The front desk assured me that they will do their best with my request. Upon check in, my partner and i dropped off our stuff and left. We didn't return to the room until it was time for bed (probably 9pm).  We got into bed, and were instantly terrified by the horrible creaking of the bed (if I could attach audio or video evidence I would!) We both looked at each other and "uh-oh'ed." I know I should have called concierge to complain and be placed into a different room. Fearing that it would take another hour before that happens and potentially having more issues in a different room, we decided that once asleep, the creak wouldn't bother us. Alas, we kept waking each other up just from turning our head. Needless to say, I did not get any sleep. At 6am, I called and spoke with Yari Guzman, who told me that the manager isn't on site to address my complaint. I instantly called Expedia and explained the situation.  Very long story short, after almost two weeks of back and forth with the hotel, management told me the beds are new and refused to issue compensation leaving me no choice but to write this review warning other potential customers.

title: Won’t stay anywhere else but here now
text: I must start my review by saying I had always heard amazing things about this hotel and it’s amenities, customer service and overall warmth . Little did I know those descriptions surpassed my expectations . Staying here made me feel like royalty from beginning to end and that could not have happened without the AMAZING customer service from all the employees . Genuine customer service is a lost art in the hotel world but Marmara Park Ave has kept it a top priority . From the spa to the pool to the room to the lobby,one more breathtaking then the next . As a New Yorker this made me feel like I had escaped into paradise . All of the employees were so genuinely interested in the well being of my stay but two in particular really set the bar high. First, Rob K at front desk who literally went out in a snow storm to hail me a cab up the block .That should say enough right there . Then their was Crystal P at the Wellness Center in the cellar . To say she is an individual who you want representing your business is an understatement . Both of these individuals really made my stay that much more memorable. Do yourself a favor and stop debating if you should book this hotel and just do it .Your mind body and soul will thank you. Can’t wait to visit again .

title: A spacious and warm stay in the concrete jungle
text:
This is the second time I've stayed at The Marmara Park Avenue.
The rooms are very lovely and extremely spacious, with beautiful stone bathrooms. 
And the level of cleanliness is excellent.
And the heating system is super quite (this is so helpful when you're jet lagged and don't want to be woken by the heat/cool starting up).
The lobby is so beautiful and you always feel relaxed as soon as you walk through the elaborate entrance.
Having a coffee machine in the rooms is such a useful bonus.
And the CO Bigelow bathroom products are great, it's so lovely that they support a local business.
And the underground Hammam is amazing and has to be seen to be believed. As is the pool.
This was the main reason I stayed a second time. On a freezing cold day, knowing you're able to head back to the hotel and have a lovely steam is a really nice thought.
The lifts are getting a little slow and you can be waiting a little while if you're on a higher floor, but that doesn't really take away from the overall beautiful and relaxed feel the hotel has.
The staff are also very lovely and always look up and welcome you when you arrive.
If I was to find one criticism (and really it's only a small bit of feedback), upon arriving and leaving with my bags it would have been great to have someone help hold the incredibly heavy glass and metal doors. (I'm sure this isn't an issue in the warmer months.)
I would absolutely select to stay here again.

title: Hidden Gem on Park Avenue
text: I stayed here for several days and I have to say my stay was spectacular. I made an account just to review this hotel. It is luxury, just walking in it puts you in awe.  My favorite part was heading down into the Wellness Center. It is so nice down there and it always smelled good! I liked that they had showers there to. My only complaint is the bathroom space. Although the bathroom could have had more space, the amenities the hotel offered made up for it like the rooftop bar. My oh my. The staff was great. I checked in and out with Yari and she was always friendly and smiling, even in the early mornings! She felt easy to approach which was hard for me since its my first time in NYC! Robert was also very friendly and easily approachable. The bar and lounge is right next to the entrance, which can get a little cold sometimes but they have nice fireplaces in the lobby to keep you warm. Overall, great hotel with great staff. Definitely coming back.

title: Two Month Stay Was Impeccable
text: Staying at Marmara Park Avenue will remain one of my fondest NYC experiences ever.  The building has breathtaking views, is centrally located, and service is top notch.  Marmara Park Ave truly felt like a home away from home.  The staff always showed an interest in going the extra mile, and in many cases did for me.  By the end of my stay the staff almost felt like family.  I was not overly impressed with the food options at the hotel but with the abundance of outstanding restaurants in the city this was never an issue.  Enjoying cocktails on the open penthouse terrace with views of the Chrysler building and Empire State is both calming and invigorating. Not to mention the indoor pool, gym, Turkish bath, and small business center, all thick layers of icing on the cake.  Staff of note include Rob, Brian, Yolanda, Gina, and Faseha.  Really appreciate all they did to make this the very best hotel experience I've ever had.

title: Feels like luxury
text: We had a lovely 2 night stay. It’s a great location and has that rich minimalist feel to it. The service was outstanding and the staff well trained to accommodate. A bit pricey but great for a special treat .

title: Simply the Best hotel in New York
text: Great location, very friendly helpful and kind staff, amazing overall design, huge fully equipped hardwoodfloor room with high ceilings, big windows, beautiful views, kitchen with water kettle and micro wave, modern, perfect cleanliness, soft towels and bathrobes, spa with beautiful REAL swimming pool, Turkish bath and fitness, very good food, greatest hotel ever!!!!

title: Ms Marion white
text: Eleven of our family from aged three to 77 had a lovely stay of four nights. Very friendly and thoughtful staff in the lobby, the bar and pool area. Even brought warm cookies and milk to the children one night.Very nice rooms and baths. Beautiful lobby.  The gas fires give a great feeling of warmth on a rainy cold day.  However a real tea pot instead of a cup of hot water with a tea bag would be more appropriate to the atmosphere.

title: So disappointed
text: I am a recent upper extremity amputee who stayed with my 2 daughters last night at the Marmara Park Ave. and had an extremely disappointing experience.  Although the Room was small, the beds were comfortable and it was well appointed. However, When we woke this morning and went to shower there was no hot water! When I asked the front desk at check out if they could perhaps discount or comp the room for our inconvenience I was told no. The only offer they were willing to make was to comp our extremely small room service bill. Shame on you! We paid close to $600 for this room and didn't even have hot water...Do yourself a favor and find somewhere else to stay instead of getting gauged for a small room, no hot water and horrible customer service. Never again!

title: ✨❤️Coup de cœur❤️✨
text: Nous avons adoré cet hôtel, sobre, élégant et discret. Dès notre arrivée, l’accueil a été très agréable et souriant. Nous avons apprécié également notre chambre au 17 ème étage avec une vue plutôt sympathique. L’emplacement est idéal sur New-York. Merci...

title: Terrific location, chic hotel, excellent service/ staff.
text:
Terrific neighborhood, chic hotel, excellent service/ staff.

I have stayed here a number of times and have been in different configurations of rooms. Sometimes solo, sometimes with my partner. Would also be great with friends and/or family. Gorgeous lobby. Quiet rooms, no matter what street we were facing. The rooms have all been clean and spacious.  The color scheme is modern — white walls, black floors with touches of black and gray. Light. Quite chic and relaxing.

Staff are incredible. I particularly want to give a call out Yolanda Garcia (operations manager) and Fisseha. I had a couple of issues the first time I stayed, I talked with them about it and they solved my problems. They and all of the staff have been helpful, kind and thoughtful. Do you have an issue please let the staff know, they will do everything I can to help you.

Free Wi-Fi, iPad, phone, smart TV. One unit I stayed in had a balcony (there aren’t many of these; while it is nice, I wouldn’t insist on a balcony over other amenities). 

All have a kitchenette area or full kitchen. Great for extended stays. 

Beautiful bathrooms with white marble floors and walls. Bright, clean and modern. Some bathrooms are small with just room for toilet, sink & shower. Others have been quite spacious and included bathtubs. All have a large for length mirror on the back of the bathroom door.

Bathroom sinks are all very modern rectangles. There’s no lip to put your cosmetics or toiletries, they go on the shelf below the sink. So putting on cosmetics is a little bit irritating because they either have to go on the bottom shelf or on the closed lid of the toilet.

Storage: great closets and drawers. 

Comfortable chairs in each unit, great lighting.

One unit had a washer dryer. There are also several wash and fold laundries nearby on Lexington Avenue and Park Ave., South, south of the hotel.

Gorgeous indoor pool and Turkish bath. Pool is just large enough for swimming laps.

Neighborhood: subway steps away, walking distance or short taxi away from museums, restaurants, tourist attractions, Times Square. Lexington Avenue in the 20s has tons of Indian restaurants. Highly recommend Pongal, saravanah Bhaven, Bhatti Indian Grill. Sarabeth’s kitchen, breakfast favorite, five-minute walk south. For Paleo folks, Hu Kitchen on 5th Ave between 13th /14th is my favorite. Park Avenue winter/spring/summer/ autumn is terrific fine dining, seven minute walk south. Union Square is a 20 minute walk South. Jazz Standard is on 27th St., five blocks south.

title: Great location, good amenities, lack luster on service.
text:
We stayed at The Marmara Park avenue for a weekend in October 2018, we arrived slightly early for check in, right around 1:00. We were told our room wasn't ready so we decided to get lunch in the lobby restaurant. The food was good, pretty pricey but that was too be expected. We waited for over two and a half hours to get into our room, which normally wouldn't be a problem but we watched at least 6 other rooms get checked in before us, even though they arrived after we did. We weren't told why and we didn't ask, but the front desk did know we were sitting waiting for our room. 

The room itself was clean and spacious, we had a room with a kitchenette area that we didn't need but I can see being very helpful for people staying for an extended period of time. The bathroom was on the smaller side, the toilet was practically pressed up against the wall. I am a bigger guy (6'2) and when I was on the toilet I pretty much had to sit sideways so my leg wasn't hitting the toilet paper holder. Sorry if this was TMI haha. 

The highlight of the hotel should of been the indoor pool and the Turkish bath. We tried to use the area 4 times, all of the times we were met by a wall screaming children as soon as we exited the elevator. There didn't seem to be any rules as far as kids go, they were running back and forth from the pool to the Turkish bath which didn't make for a relaxing environment. 

This was a critical review in a beautiful hotel, we would go back but not at the very high price this hotel normally costs. Maybe if I can find slightly inexpensive dates we will return as the location and potential is great.

title: Last night experience ruined our overall stay
text:
Unfortunately our last night experience in The Blue Bar and lack of response from senior management has marred what was until then a lovely stay in a beautiful hotel that is perfectly located. We were very comfortable and our room was very clean and tidied daily. We had a lovely view and could just see the top of the Empire State which was great. We didn’t eat or have a cocktail until our last nite as the other evenings we had been to see shows on Broadway but on our last evening we visited the Blue Bar to try one of your tempting cocktails and check out the amazing view of the New York Skyline. Unfortunately from start to finish this one experience has ruined our lasting memory of the hotel.  We walked into the bar to find 2 female staff lounging in comfy chairs on there phones chatting away, even when they saw us there was no urgency in there manner, no oh Good Evening Ladies no jokey friendly welcome but more of a hmmmm well that’s annoying we have to move!!! This is unacceptable in our opinion, we had to ask fHello Gina

We wanted to say thank you for a lovely stay in your beautiful and well located hotel. We were very comfortable and our room was very clean and tidied daily. We had a lovely view and could just see the top of the Empire State which was great. We didn’t eat or have a cocktail until our last nite as the other evenings we had been to see shows on Broadway but on our last evening we visited your Blue Bar to try one of your tempting cocktails and check out the amazing view of the New York Skyline. Unfortunately from start to finish this one experience has ruined our lasting memory of your hotel.  We walked into the bar to find 2 female staff lounging in comfy chairs on there phones chatting away, now you may allow them to do that when the bar is empty but even when they saw us there was no urgency in there manner, no oh Good Evening Ladies no jokey friendly welcome but more of a hmmmm well that’s annoying we have to move!!! This is unacceptable in our opinion, we had to ask for a menu and while one staff member brought it the other seemed to have disappeared. We ordered a drink each and asked if we could pop outside to look at the beautiful nigh time view to which the response was ‘Yeah’ not yes of course or good idea it’s such a great view just ‘Yeah’. It was thanksgiving day evening and was exceptionally cold and windy so we didn’t stay out there long just long enough to take a couple of pics and a quick Snapchat for friends and family back home. We came back in and sat down to enjoy our drinks, we were thinking of having a few as the menu offered more than 1 we wanted to try but the menu had been taken away and neither staff member was in sight, so we thought we would ask to see it again once we were almost ready to order again. Our minds changed because while we were sat chatting there was no interaction from either staff member no ‘Soo have you had a good Thanksgiving’ or ‘what have you been doing today did you see the parade’ nothing just an occasional head would pop out from behind the wall beside the bar. This made us feel very very unwelcome so decided we would leave, I had to go to the bar to ask for the check but no-one  was visible so I walked around the side of the bar where I saw both staff members were there playing on the phones again one sitting on a stool and the other leaning against the wall and in my opinion waiting for us to leave so they could continue to lounge in the chairs they had occupied before our arrival. We went back to our room and had a much earlier night than planned. Our check out the next morning was with a staff member we hadn’t encountered before so we didn’t mention the issue to her. Once we returned home I emailed the contact I had communicated with on numerous occasions and who had been most helpful as always her response was almost immediate and promised to pass on my concerns to the relevant head of department for further investigation. This is now a week ago and we have had no further contact which is very poor in our opinion hence the low rating. We will not return or recommend.

title: Thanksgiving in NYC - 2 bedroom Suite
text:
I had the wonderful experience of staying at The Marmara Park Avenue on 17/11-27/11/2018 
Staying at one of the 2 bedroom suites that the hotel has  which has   2 bathrooms and a small kitchen ( microwave and fridge nespresso machine full  plates spoons and sink)
Prior to arriving all my reservations request were dealt with in such a great way by Both Gina and Yolanda.  This trip as to celebrate  a birthday and  my folks 45 th wedding anniversary

The hotel ha s beautiful ( instagram worthy) lobby and front door.  The room was  beautifully decorated and was just perfect for our needs in a cold NYC .  The team tried to ensure we got the balcony suite but   another  resident decided to stay longer but that wasn't the hotel's fault.  The room was clean wifi was excellent and the kitchen wells rocked 
we had a lovely fruit platter and   morning able to make bagels ( Toaster included in the kitchenO) and tea and coffee.  The ipad in the room sorts out times for  housekeeping and any requests
It is on 2nd and park so have subway  outside uptown number 6 goes to  blooming dale sand  city hall   u have to walk t Macy's but uber is also easy
The hotel concierge recommended restaurants to get delivery much as Dough boy pizza,Dhaba ( indian) , Hong kong ( chinese) all good  food 
Th breakfast was  great and staff really looked after us very friendly stored my shopping packages and it was a safe  hotel
Nice roof top bar 
I slept well with no issues regarding traffic
Overall a new find for me in NYC and defiantly recommend to those who want  a fab luxury NYC experience

title: Beautiful & Cozy
text: I stayed here for one night for a friends birthday and had a great nights sleep and experience. This hotel felt like a boutique hotel and was very warm and welcoming. While the lobby area was small it didn't feel like you were in the city which I appreciated. The front desk staff were helpful with recommendations in the area. The rooms were a bit tight which is expected in NY but very quiet and did not hear other guests like many hotels in NY. Loved the warm lighting in the lobby and the classic decor in the rooms. A bit overpriced for size etc but would love to visit again in the off season.

title: Good location but average
text:
Very well located for shopping and sightseeing. The photos on the web site make it look a lot more impressive than it actually is, the lobby, reception area is quite small. The lifts are slow especially at busy times, the corridors are very dark. Our room was a reasonable size but looked out on a brick wall, it was comfortable and had everything we needed. The rooftop bar was very small and there were not enough seats, the lobby bar was also small and when we went there the waitress was reluctant to serve us and was very rude. 
This is not really a five star hotel.

title: Not a Five Star Hotel
text: I stay in 5 star hotels all over the world and this is not a 5 star hotel, very disappointed. On the first day of my four night stay you have two small bottles of complimentary water, on the second day after my room was cleaned I asked why no water was replaced, I was told that you only get free water on the first day and after that you need to pay. So the longer you stay the more you pay, strange strategy. My room had black out blinds but they did not fit the windows properly, on the first morning I really wanted a lay in but it was impossible due to the poor fitting of the blinds and the terrible light which came into the room. I was then accused of booking a car back to the airport at the hotel which I didn't, total confusion by the bell boy which led to me having being charged for a car I did not order. Good choices in NY for five star hotels so I will not be returning after a poor experience.

title: Pretty good hotel in a great location
text:
I don’t like the huge hotels with no soul so this was a great pick. It has character. The rooms are a good size but the bathrooms are small and there is no surface space for toilet bags. I’d have reduced the Sleeping/work/kitchen area and made the bathroom bigger. 

Staff were great and always there when we needed anything. The beds are super comfy and the pillows are luxurious. All in all, a great value midtown hotel.

title: First visit to New York
text: Stayed at the Marmara for nights after crossing on QM2. Having read some reviews was a bit worried but unfounded as everything was first class. Yes they need more shelves and the all black corridors were a bit weird but staff were very helpful and sorted out a problem we had with the room immediately and with no fuss. Enjoyed happy hour on the rooftop terrace where the staff were so friendly and gave helpful advice.

title: Very comfortable Hotel
text: We stayed in this 5 star Hotel for 3 nights on a short trip to New York.  It is a Turkish-owned hotel and we found it very comfortable indeed.  We were given a very big room on the 14th floor, which had painted wooden floors which I so much prefer to carpets - you never know how clean the carpet is.  It was very quiet, we never heard the lifts or anybody else's doors opening or closing.  There wasn't a lot of space to put stuff in the bathroom:  some shelves would be good.  If you wish to eat, the "restaurant" is in the foyer, which is interesting as you can watch people go by.  But it is not romantic, if that is what you want!  The service was very good and friendly, and the hotel is within walking distance of Times Square and the theatre district.  And the Metro station with a direct line to the 9/11 Memorial and Museum is just across the road, which made it very easy to get there.   We did not spend much time in the hotel, but were very happy with it when we were in it.  I don't know what our room cost, as it was included in a package deal with Imagine Cruising:  fly BA to NY, come back to the UK on the Queen Mary 2.   I would think it was probably very expensive,  But then, so is everything in New York, we found.  We both thought it a good experience and would recommend the hotel, despite some other not so good reviews.

title: Could be good!
text:
We crossed the Atlantic in QM2 and were
Looking forward to 3 days in New York staying at the 5 star Marmara Park. Unfortunately we weren’t told in advance that we had to kill 6 hours before we could get to our room!!
So on arrival at 4pm slightly chaotic scene, still waiting for some rooms to be finished 
Eventually told room ready. having come from a lovely suite on the ship I was really disappointed 
To find I had a bed in a kitchen and a fairly cold room at that. So the next 3 days we had to live out of the suitcases there being no draws at all
For clothes no shelf or anywhere to put anything in the bathroom ending up with a very full worktop. (The room got no warmer even with temp turned up)
Being tired decided to eat in house perhaps a mistake restaurant is in the foyer, really very little choice and very expensive.
Next day told reception about room temperature (by last day they got it right!! )
The Hotel is in a good district and walking distance from many of New York’s attractions  
In spite of the above it is a five star hotel so perhaps we were just unlucky 

T

title: Marmara Park Avenue
text:
Nice property!  Front desk people are fabulous!  Most of the Bellmen are great!!  Rooms need more shelves and bathroom needs more shelves as well!  With in walking distance to theatre district. 
About 2-1/2 to 3 miles.  We enjoy walking!  Safe area!

title: Disappointment  The Marmara
text:
It was so far one of the worse experiences my family and I had. In a good rated hotel.
We got at the hotel and first no one came to offer help to us, we had to go to front desk and ask for it, it was myself with a baby and my mother in law with lugares stroller and car seat.
We got at the hotel in the morning and after checking-in we were told that as soon our room were ready we would receive a phone call about it. 
It was past 4pm and no phone call (check-in is supposedly 3pm), we called and found out the room was not yet finished but soon to be.
We came back to the hotel around 6pm to collect the room keys and get ready for dinner and now comes the big surprise, we were never informed that we had to stay in an accessible room, what is not a problem unless you have a baby to bath that doesn’t fit in the bathroom sink.
We kindly asked to be placed in a double  room with shower box or bathtub since in the reservation they never told us that the room that we were getting had different specifications than what was sold to us.
The front desk first offered us if we wanted to exchange room for a upper category paying the difference, what was fine, when we said we would do it they said that they in fact didn’t have the room.
After,  they offered to us to change room in our second night cause they couldn’t accommodate us in our first night, but with a baby moving after settle up was not an option.
With all their inflexibility and ZERO efforts to make the stay a little better after all we end up switching to another hotel.
They said the manager was calling us to fix the situation and this never happened.
I asked for a hair brush and was told that it was available and it never showed up at the room and later on I found out they didn’t have.
With all the mess we barely made to our dinner reservation.
So far if I could rate this hotel ZERO star, I would.
DO NOT recommend at all.
TERRIBLE service.

title: Amazing stay in NYC
text: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights and it was wonderful. Our room had a nice view of the Empire state building and the room had ton of space. I loved the bed, it didnt feel worn out like other hotels do. The pool in the cellar level was nice to unwind in and was almost always empty in the morning. Yary was very charming and so was the bellman. She told us about Rossinis and we had delicious dinner there! Will definitely come back NYC!

title: Consistent excellence
text:
This review is not the product of one, but many wonderful experiences at The Marmara. The beauty of the hotel is matched and enhanced by the remarkable staff. If anything, it just gets better.
If you want to enjoy a relaxing “staycation,” you don’t have to leave the building, because everything is there. If you want to explore the City, it’s at your fingertips. Management and Staff are wonderful, warm and welcoming in a beautiful hotel  summarizes my experiences.

title: Comfortable hotel, good location
text: I stayed here for 9 nights in June 2018 while on holiday.  The hotel room was a good size, and in good condition, bigger than a normal hotel room and had some basic kitchen items like a toaster, jug to boil water and a small fridge.  The housekeeping service was very good throughout my stay.  I didn't use any of the other facilities while here but the pool looked nice.  The lifts are small and slow, but other than that I had no issues and the reception staff were helpful.  A good location to be based for sight-seeing in New York.

title: Insensitive staff and horrible accommodations
text: When we checked in (early), we were told we would be contacted when our room was ready.  Called around 4pm and told it was ready, but no one called to inform us.  We had requested a crib for the weekend, and there was nothing noted in our reservation as promised.  The carpet in our room was filthy and our room was a handicapped room which we did not request and did not want.  When using the shower, the entire floor of the bathroom was wet.  I slipped and fell.  Requested another room and even though they had other categories available, they did not move us and said we could move within our category the next day, which was useless since we were there for two nights.  We checked out the next morning and moved to another hotel.  When checking out, they had charged us for bottled water which was complimentary.  An overall horrible trip and will not stay at the hotel again.  Don't be fooled by the reviews.

title: Fantastic stay.
text: Stayed here for five nights to celebrate a birthday. Our room was 1706 on the 17th floor. Nice and big. Comfy beds with a small kitchen, coffee machine and bottled water replenished daily. Five minute walk to Empire State Building. Only minor issue was no shelves in the bathroom to put stuff on. Staff very friendly. Spa also nice to unwind after a days walking. Murray Hill Diner just around the corner from the hotel is great for breakfast. Typical American diner and set us up for the day. Will definitely stay here again when we return. Thanks to all for making our stay so nice.

title: Quarto Studio
text: Ficamos no quarto studio com uma pequena varanda, quarto muito espaçoso, limpeza impecável  e mini cozinha ( microondas, geladeira, chaleira e máquina nespresso) ótima localizaçao e com certeza voltaríamos nos hospedar lá.

title: スタイリッシュなホテル
text:
新しく、スタイリッシュで現代的なホテル。
ロビーはコンパクトだがスタッフの対応も良く居心地よい。
ミッドタウンの地下鉄 33rd St 駅からすぐでアクセスは◎
アクセスの良い28St 駅も徒歩圏内と、マンハッタンの観光には便利。

部屋は決して広くないが清潔感あり、アメニティやディスプレイなどがとてもオシャレ。
アメニティは、シャンプー、コンディショナー、石鹸、マウスウォッシュ、ボディローションがあり。歯ブラシ、スリッパは無し。
ネスプレッソマシンと、ドライヤーあり。

ステキなバルコニーもあるが、隣の部屋と繋がっているので防犯に注意。

ハウスキーピングは、タオルの枚数や、サービスのミネラルウォーター、コーヒーは日によって数が違ったりして、適当さはあるが、清掃は問題なし。

ジムやプール、ルーフトップバーもあるようですが利用しませんでした。

title: Not a great place to stay, but quiet
text:
We stayed for 4 nights and were under the impression it was a 5 star hotel. So sadly we were disappointed by our stay. The plus points were that the staff were all very friendly, it was quiet for any city and it was clean. 

But black corridors everywhere except in the lobby with strip lighting above the skirting boards didn’t make a good first impression. The room was a studio with a large kitchenette. There was a glass table and 2hard dining chairs, and no other seating. There was a small glass fronted cupboard and a few small drawers. The floor was black cheap wood effect that was badly scratched. 

But the shower room was minuscule with only room for one person just. The door almost touched the toilet while shutting and had no hooks. Only a large mirror on the back , so while sitting on the toilet ....  There was a makeup mirror but nowhere to put anything down as no shelving. No bath/tub, and the shower was so ferocious it really hurt. It had 2 options, fully on or fully off. 

We did get the shower fixed. But for a hotel that was only a few years old to have such elementary design flaws. There was plenty of room to have a decent size bathroom. And hooks and shelving. 

We were told that there was a Restaurant. But there were a few chairs in the lobby with a tiny bar. Breakfast was €36 plus tax plus service for a buffet continental offering in a soulless area. 

The hotel location has one plus point. The subway station was very close. But there was nothing else close by, except Starbucks! 

And when we checked out we were told that there was nothing to pay. But a few days later they took $18 plus tax per day Resort Fee. We knew nothing about this and had booked 9 months in advance. We did manage to sort it out, but..

So we wouldn’t recommend this hotel. It’s far more comfortable and better equipped at a Premier Inn!

title: Fantastic!
text: Checked out last week from a wonderful stay at The Marmara Park Ave. Staff on front desk great and housewkeeping replenished water, coffee, and towels daily! As soon as you arrive at the hotel you are welcomed with such a beautiful aroma! Not sure what it was but it was beautiful. Perfect hotel for the perfect stay in NYC 😁

title: Room carpet had more stains than a family tablecloth at Thanksgiving
text:
By any standard of promise versus performance, we were very disappointed with stay at this trendy hotel. The carpet was horrible! Interior doors would not open or close properly! Wood night stands had scratches. Plus, we had a room set up for the disabled, and the shower water would flood the entire bathroom floor!
This place, at this price point, was a disaster!!!

title: A great place to stay
text:
This hotel was booked as part of a Cunard package and it certainly lived up to expectations. The room was very clean and comfortable and the bed and bedding were really comfortable, with the pillows being just right! 
There was an issue with our bathroom door, although there was no-one inside when the door decided to jam! Someone arrived very quickly and was able to resolve the problem.
The room was kept immaculately clean and there was plenty of storage space, which was just as well given the quantity of luggage we had!
We found all the staff to be friendly and helpful and enjoyed spending time in the bar. We weren't there long enough to use the pool facilities but we would certainly want to stay here again if we are ever fortunate enough to return to New York

title: Une belle expérience
text:
Un bel hôtel bien situé et personnel aimable 
Dommage salle de bains minuscule et rien pour poser sa trousse de toilette .
Dommage housse de couette servant de drap déchiré !! Impossible que la femme de chambre ne l’ai pas vu!! Signale le lendemain matin après avoir dormi dedans, on a refait le lit avec !!! Et à 18h une femme de chambre est venue changer la housse de couette !! Pas d’excuses pour un 5 étoiles ça marque mal.

title: Fantastic stay
text:
This hotel is amazing. As soon as you walk in it feels like you traveled to another country. Oh the decor!  Yary, the receptionist who checked us in was exceptional. She was very friendly and always greeted us with a smile. I only wish that when we checked out with the other receptionist that we would have gotten the same treatment. 

The bed is comfortable and they accept pets as well! The turkish bath downstairs is beautiful. 
Can't wait to come back!

title: Lovely hotel but reception staff should be more friendly
text:
This hotel is few steps away from being a true luxurious hotel. The interior design cannot be faulted. Nice swimming pool, hammam and a gym. Good views from the rooftop bar. 

The reception staff however, did not smile, did not make eye contact, were not useful and looked like they did enjoy their jobs. There was more one one staff who acted similarly. We were not asked how we are doing, enjoyed our staff...we were there to get married!! 

Making a stay truly wonderful and memorable are the characters of staff, not just the design of the hotel.

title: elegante e confortevole
text: Hotel moderno, elegante ,con stanze ampie e molto ben insonorizzate. Il bagno un pò piccolo ma comunque dotato di ogni comfort. A disposizione acqua e caffè gratuiti ed anche una piccola cucina per chi volesse farsi qualcosa da mangiare. Non conviene fare colazione in Hotel perchè è buona ed abbondante ma anche carissima.

title: Un hôtel "presque" parfait !
text:
Hôtel tout de blanc vêtu à la décoration soignée. Belle et grande chambre parquet  avec  cuisine, salon et terrasse , vue magnifique sur NYC au 17 ème étage (1703 ou 1702)  Bonne literie, chambre au calme des bruits de la circulation. Mise à disposition de bouteilles d'eau quotidienne, Machine Nespresso et tablette numérique. 
Happy hours tous les jours de 17 à 19 h sur le roof top, bon cocktail excellent accueil.
Le personnel s'implique dans la résolution de vos soucis. 
Metro et Starbuck (petit dej)  au pied de l'Hôtel. 
A amélorer : Etrangement AUCUN membre du personnel ne parle Français (regrettable pour un hôtel de cette catégorie, surtout quant vous devez règler des problèmes de retard de bagages)
 Idem pour les chaines TV aucune en Français parmi les 10enes proposées.
 Room service efficace, cependant la carte proposée est très courte.... 
Salle de douche, wc un peu petite mais suffisante
Dressing un peu juste pour 2 si vous restez 8 jours.

title: Un buon hotel un po’ decentrato
text:
Pulito, camera ampia, silenzioso. Buon letto. Solerti nel riassettare la camera. Bagno con tutte le dotazioni necessarie. La nostra camera era dotata di terrazzo che faceva vedere l’Empire State Building.
Colazione cara da evitare, a 100 metri c’è un ottimo locale per fare colazione a prezzi contenuti.
Metro a 50 metri. Tuttavia per raggiungere i posti più famosi si cammina molto o si deve usare la metro anche con cambi di linea.

title: Outstanding.
text:
Booked for a 30th birthday present by my husband - and I could not have been more pleased. This hotel is modern, functional & a pleasure to stay in. The staff are polite & helpful.

The rooms are clean, light - housekeeping comes every day. Beds are fresh & comfy. 

The room we stayed in had a shared balcony with chairs to use, and a view of the Empire State building. It also had a nespresso machine, kettle, tea, coffee & bottled water (replaced each day). The shower room was spotless, with lovely fluffy towels and bathrobes/slippers, with good quality toiletries. 

It had an ipad with useful apps like maps & room service/laundry. 

Location wise - this hotel is ideally located for the subway & is in walking distance of grand central terminal - an ideal place to start exploring from.

title: Third stay at the Marmara
text:
This was my third visit to this hotel and unfortunately it was not as good as the previous times.  We were celebrating a milestone anniversary.  When we arrived, our room was dirty with stained carpets.  I complained and they immediately rectified the situation and then upgraded us to a one bedroom.  The new suite has two balconies with amazing views of the Empire Street Building.  I also like the convenience of the fridge and the microwave.  
The location is perfect as always - close enough to important sites but removed enough to be tranquil.
The new roof-top bar is a must.  Perfect for cocktails with an amazing view.

Areas for improvement:
- Some of the front of staff were friendly and helpful, while others seemed bored and disinterested.
- the design of the shower resulted in a lot of water all over the bathroom floor which made it a bit slippery/hazardous.
- there wasn’t always a doorman on staff to open the front door.  This would have been helpful when I struggled to open the front door whilst carrying all my luggage.

Overall, I enjoyed my stay at the Marmara, but just missed the quality of service that I had received on prior stays.  I will come back again and hopefully the quality of service will return.

title: Imprescindible
text: Hotel de diseño muy "newyorkino" Las habitaciones son amplias y muy luminosas (la nuestra con vistas a los edificios Chrysler y Empire State). El hotel tiene un bar en la azotea con muy buenas vistas de la ciudad mientras tomas algo o comes. La piscina cubierta permite relajarse después de todo el dia visitando la ciudad. El personal es amable, atento y muy resolutivo. Especialmente Viviana de recepción que hizo nuestra estancia muy agradable.

title: Luna di miele
text: Abbiamo soggiornato 4 notti in questo hotel come prima tappa della luna di miele. Camera ampia e pulitissima, bagno spazioso, macchinetta del caffè e acqua sempre disponibile. Personale gentissimo e disponibile a consigliarti. Posizione ottima. Appena arrivi senti subito un piacevole odore di pulito. Piscina e spa carine e poco affollate. Non metto 5 solo perché, essendo in luna di miele, da un hotel di 5 stelle mi sarei aspettata un piccolo omaggio in camera (es. un decoro con dei petali sul letto, oppure dei cioccolatini, una bottiglia di prosecco, o anche solo un bigliettino di auguri...). Sono piccoli gesti piacevoli per i clienti.

title: Incredible Hotel
text:
Hotel is in best place in NYC
Subway is in walking distance to Main Entrance Door. 

Beautiful entrance  and great welcoming
Hotel rooms are amazing, very clean, smell is amazing. 

You should try gym, swimming pool and Turkish Bath. 

Restaurant for dinner is amazing and specially breakfast OMG you should have it

title: Such a terrible disappoinment
text: After a wonderful trip across the Atlantic on the Queen Mary 2 we were looking forward to staying in NYC and was booked into the Marmara Park Ave.  No front doorman to help with our luggage (we was seen at a later date).  Very disinterested receptionist gave me an ordinary room which continued to have a lot of air-conditioning problems, it was either freezing or hot, my friends room was the same.  I could take up pages on how ordinary this hotel is but instead I just wish to warn others.  I checked out after 3 days to the fabulous Dominick (next review) and as I was paying more at the Marmara ($828) this is shocking.  Apparently they could charge crazy prices because of Fashion Week!!!  The final straw was when I was checking out the disinterested receptionist wanted to charge me an extra $US18 per night for facilities such as spa/swimming pool, I didn't use these and the property advertises that it has them, not that extra charges will be incurred.  I didn't pay, enough was enough and I had certainly had enough.

title: Reasonable but some flaws
text:
My wife and I  stayed in this hotel in a " studio " room  at the end of August 2018. 
The hotel is sited in a rather uninteresting area but a 15 minute walk can take you to The Grand Central station part of the city which has far more activity and buzz. The spartan entrance area of the hotel is decorated in off-white with pseudo marble columns ,two lecturns serve as rather inefficient check in desks. After leaving this first section much of the rest of the hotel's public parts such as corridors and lifts are uniformly black.
 The studio prefix merely indicates that the good size room has microwave  cooking facilities sink etc. Our room faced an office block across the street which meant that
curtains needed to be closed to ensure privacy.
   Plus points are that the room was cool and quiet,a real bonus for New York and there was a decent pool with Hamman next to it.  The metro stop a few yards  away made for convenient travelling.
     Staff were very incompetent when it came to luggage transfer to the coach for cruise passengers.It took over 30 minutes to locate bags which they had misplaced.

title: Great hotel room but....
text: The hotel is based close to the empire state building within walking distance of time square etc.Away from the noise but close enough to exploring. The hotel room was lovely. Plates, glasses, cutlery, coffee machine, fridge and toaster. Bathroom toiletries etc  replaced daily. The staff though polite were uninterested in us. No small talk. Just seemed cold and mechanical. They were also unhelpful when we enquired about a taxi to the airport (this maybe because it's so easy to hail a cab but there were 4 of us so we knew we needed a larger one) . They told us it would be $90 to LAG even though it's closed than JFK which cost $52. They later came to the room and told us to go down at 7am to ask reception to sort a cab for 8am. The doormen opened the door as and when they chose (we are perfectly capable of opening the door ourselves but couldn't understand why they did it for some people but ignored us). Desk staff also didn't respond when we walked back in from being out, a simple hi or did you have a great day would have been nice. Wouldn't return just down to the lack of customer interaction

title: First time in New York
text: Hi My name is Peter and my wife and I have just spent four days at the Marmara Park Avenue on our first trip to New York and I felt I had to give a review . I can honestly say we had a wonderful time and I would like to mention two people in particular.Firstly Yolanda Garcia, she was always on hand for any advice on our sightseeing also where to eat and where to visit. And just to say everything was done with a huge smile. The other person was UDU and what a live wire he was, he never seemed anything other than to be there to help. So I would like to say thank you to all the staff particularly the two people mentioned.

title: Good base for work and pleasure
text:
I stayed 2.5 weeks in August, and it was hot in the city. 

I had a one bed hotel suite and it was perfectly spacious and comfortable for me, although the AC worked OK, it wasn’t easily controllable. 

The swimming pool and Turkish bath was great treat as well. Although the Turkish bath wasn’t hot enough as a steam room. More of a place to wash rather than steam. Perhaps I used it on an off day. I’ll look forward to it during the winter months I suspect.

The food is the only minor negative is raise, as it is limited to bar snacks on the roof terrace, plus the room service menu wasn’t up to much. 
I didn’t try the breakfast, so can’t comment on that. 
There are thousands of places to eat nearby, so this wasn’t too big a concern. 

Staff at front desk, cleaning, waitressing and bell boys were all great, polite and helpful.

See you again soon on my next trip.

title: Quiet beautiful hotel
text: The staff at The Marmara are wonderful. Our room was spacious and quiet. The shower pressure epic though it does get the floor very wet. The wellness center with pool and Turkish bath are peaceful and lovely. We did have a problem with our room that took some effort to resolve but I would stay here again. Wish I could use the Turkish bath everyday.

title: En toute honnêté
text: Roof-top super ! Vue magnifique. Personnel sympathique. Piscine en sous-sol magnifique ! Moquette un peu sale dans les chambres (standard). Peu de bruit (car nous n'étions pas très nombreux dans l'hôtel). Petits déjeuner : nous sommes allés le prendre au RDC et nous sommes arrivés dans une salle dans laquelle il n'y avait qu'une seule grande table (salle moderne, mais ça fait un peu bizarre). Autre possibilité, semble-t-il, aurait été d'aller dans le hall d'accueil (très classe). Sans doute, le service en chambre aurait été préférable. Le problème est venu des ascenseurs. Nous sommes restés coincés 20 minutes, le samedi soir, dans l'un des 2 ascenseurs à cause d'un problème "informatique" (d'après les informations que nous avons eues). Bloqués, puis nous avons fait le YoYo sans avoir d'informations rassurantes (>> l'employée nous ayant simplement dit qu'un ingénieur allait arriver)… Le traitement de ce problème s'est fait le lundi matin par la Directrice des opérations, qui, dans un premier temps, nous a expliqué ce qui s'était passé, en minimisant l'impact de cet incident sur ma femme (littéralement terrorisée pendant 20 minutes !) et sans avoir écouté notre version.. Après lui avoir conseillé de regarder attentivement la vidéo pour se rendre compte, nous avons du patienter jusqu'au lundi soir pour que cette personne nous montre un peu plus de considération et propose un "adjustement" que nous avons accepté (une réduction d'environ 15% du montant de notre réservation).

title: Sicuramente valido hotel ma..... lontano dalle 5 stelle italiane
text: Ottima posizione, bel complesso, una bella terrazza panoramica, camere di buon livello ma nel servizio complessivo mi sarei aspettato decisamente qualcosa in più da un 5 stelle. Nota positiva: personale molto gradevole ed efficiente

title: Attention Bien vérifier votre catégorie de chambre!
text:
Quelle arnaque ! 
Nous sommes arrivés vers 17h la personne à la Reception nous fait croire que c'est sa chambre preferee ! Une fois dans la chambre nous nous apercevons qu il y manque les éléments de la description de notre chambre. Il y avait noté cuisine complètement équipée. La cuisine uniquement un four micro onde un mini frigo 
Nous retournons à la Reception pour dire notre problème ! La dame admet que ce n'est pas la bonne chambre, on aurait dû avoir un loft et Non cette chambre. Mais l'hôtel est complet nous n'avons pas le choix pour cette nuit! Elle nous dit que le lendemain nous allons pouvoir changer de chambre . Elle nous propose un remboursement de 150$ pour seul dédommagement.
Le lendemain la bonne chambre mais pauvrement équipée ! Mais au moins machine à laver le linge et vaisselle, il faudrait penser à équiper la cuisine avec passoire, plat pour cuisiner dans le four, économe, louche ... 
la piscine est bien mais climatisation à fond!
Service de chambre est mauvais selon les jours !

Proche métro mais aucun supermarché autour 

Avis très mitigé vu l arnaque dont nous avons été victime !

title: Great hotel in perfect location
text: Stayed here 3 nights and found it perfectly placed for sightseeing (with a subway station just along the road). Helpful staff including handyman who removed broken lock on case with absolutely no fuss. Room was large and included kitchenette and very comfortable bed. Very nice toiletries. Looking forward to returning!

title: a real special hotel experience.
text:
stayed here for a few nights while in New York. 
really loved it and would definitely return. 
the room has a great view, the products are of high quality (there are even decaffeinated nespresso capsules!) and the interior design is really well done. 
the iPad in the room was more of a fun toy than necessary but it`s nice to have.

title: Super!
text:
Tout est parfait sauf:
-La moquette dans les chambres. 
-Le service du rooftop. Nul! Pourtant vue splendide et nourriture excellente.  
-Les portes des chambres trop bruyantes lorsqu’elles se ferment 
-Les portes des différentes pièces (salle de bain, placards...) tellement lourdes! 
Sinon tout est vraiment parfait. Emplacement. Literie. Ménage. Décoration.

title: Great Location
text: Just completed a four night stay and the accommodations were excellent. A balcony with a view of the Empire State Building what more could you ask for. Rooms where clean and spacious. The “1/2” kitchen was excellent. The pool was perfect for our son. With the subway just outside the door. Only downside one evening after requesting ice on our way in and again from our room it never showed up. Got it from the bar ourselves the following evening.

title: Great hotel in convenient location
text: Just back from a one week stay at The Marmara. Lovely apartment that worked extremely well for our family. Good facilities and helpful staff. Location also extremely convenient. We will definitely be returning.

title: Very nice Hotel in the Centre
text: In Murray hill, which is my favorite place to stay in NY, you have a lot to choose from, and we try out different hotels every year, so this was our first time stay at the Marmara, which had only been open for two years to my understanding. The service was very good. The rooms were extremely big in New York measure, and the location was perfect. There is a nice rooftop bar, it actually was the grand opening when we were there, and I saw a lot of potential, which maybe I’ll be able to enjoy next year around.

title: Reception
text: Много лет заказываю с интернет магазина в родной Баку. В этот раз решили переиграть. Пропала посылка. Вина ресепшн. По трэку бандероль доставлен. В реале ресепшн утверждает, что ничего не получали. Нет доверия ни USPS ни персоналу этого отеля.

title: A hidden gem
text: Where do I begin? This place is a true gem. We started the stay for a month because my children are models and ended up leaving with family. The staff are incredible. The hotel is swanky and a place for celeb sightings. The hotel was so accommodating providing cribs and high chairs for my children in our room. The beds were so comfortable. The rooms are spacious and luxurious. The room service and cleaning services were spectactular. The indoor pool and hammam was a nice perk but did I mention how amazing the staff was?!

title: Great hotel
text:
We have just returned from 5 nights in NY and stayed at this fab hotel!! Really comfortable, spacious room and fantastic location. 

Everything was really easy to get to and the beautiful air conditioned lobby/bar area was a wonderful relief after a hot day out. 

When we checked out we had a fairly hefty bill. Drinks and room service (obviously expected) but also a daily service charge which apparently we should have been aware of?! 

We had a great stay though and the lovely roof top bar was a real added bonus! 

Staff were also great and really attentive. 

Amazing to have an nespresso coffee machine in room too.

title: Incredible hotel
text: This hotel is amazing. Don’t have a bad word to say about it to be honest. Very central. Easy to get around. Nice part Of town. What we paid was very affordable for the city in general, but had such a lovely room. Great bathroom and shower with nice toiletries. The pool area is also nice and a luxury in the city. Staff are nice, friendly and helpful. We had a balcony with a view of the Empire State Building. Really added to our trip. Sat outside and ate breakfast there every morning. Comfy beds, spacious rooms for nyc. There is a trader joes 3 mins walk away which is good for picking up snacks etc. Also is quite high tech- iPads to control the room, order room service etc. Will 100% stay here again!

title: Fantastic & Excellent Service!!!
text:
What a Fantastic hotel, with truly excellent service!!! My son and I came down to see a Yankee Game. Not being from the city i want to begin by telling you there is a women by the Name of Viviana who is Truly Exceptional!!! Prior
To coming down, I was nervous about taking the subway. She was so extremely sweet and considerate not only making sure I knew how to get around, but went and grabbed me a
metro card ( i gave her cash ) and made sure I had the right amount of money on it!!! What an Absolute Professional and so kind to go above and beyond!!! The Rooms are Beautiful very spacious and clean!!! The 2 very large queen beds were so very comfortable and the Bathroom was new and well done! The pool and Turkish Spa you will love!!! Stay here, you will love it especially if your coming in to see a Yankee Game and want an easy commute by subway to the game!!! Thank you Maramara for an Amazing Experience!!!

title: Wonderful hotel with a Spa
text: We visited New York for a ballet competition and truly enjoyed this beautiful city.  Staying at Marmara was a treat - the rooms were clean and comfortable, but the Turkish spa was simply incredible after an exhausting day... what a gem in the heart of Manhattan!

title: Good, but could be better
text:
Overall, the hotel is very nice - I believe it's one of the most recent hotels in Midtown.  It is located by Park Ave, meaning you can get to attractions like the Empire State or Herald Square with a few minutes walk. If you're there for business I'd recommend something more central , though. Rooms are large for NYC standards, the same goes for the bathroom with a really good shower and tub.

Cons:
-Walls are thin, so be prepared to hear what goes on in other guest's rooms: couples arguing, TV, dogs barking (it is a pet friendly hotel), babies crying and couples making out.

-The restaurant has a really limited menu.

-A/C was noisy and not really responsive to controls. It was not a dealbreaker to me at all, but I assume depending on the weather this can be a critical thing.
-Possibility of early check in seems to be practically non-existent. I tried to arrange this prior to arrival with the concierge (who said would do the best to try to obtain a room), but ended up only being able to get a room way after the regular check-in time. While I totally understand that early check-in is in no way guaranteed (as mentioned by the concierge, they would do their best), I expected that at least I would be able to check-in in the regular time, which did not occur. Management was good in defusing the situation and I got a courtesy drink, though.

Pros:
- The rooftop restaurant/bar is very nice. While the menu is the same of the restaurant, so not a lot of options if you want to eat, the bar (and the wine menu) are excellent.

-Staff is really helpful and friendly. Keep up with the good work guys!

-Subterranean pool and the Turkish Hamam (it's like a turkish bath) are excellent to relax after a busy day in the city. Beautifully maintained, relaxed and family-friendly atmosphere.

-Pricing is reasonable for a hotel of this level in NYC.

title: Great Hotel for the price
text: I was in NYC for a quick trip and stayed at this hotel because my friends were there....I was given a suite with a terrace, which is so rare in NYC.....treated very well across the board, although I didn't eat in the hotel and was really  only there to sleep! Staff was very nice, and I believe there was some sort of promotion on the website that had a great pay in advance deal.

title: Gutes Hotel in bester Lage
text:
Das Hotel ist gut ausgestattet. Die Zimmer sind recht großzügig von der Größe und mit allen ausgestattet was man benötigt. Teilweise auch mit einer kleinen Küche. 
Das Frühstück ist sehr gut kostet aber extra. Das Hotel liegt ideal, von hieraus kann man die U-Bahn gut erreichen ist aber kein muss es geht auch gut zu Fuß.

title: Air conditioning broken. Fiasco.
text: We stayed for 1 night and had to change rooms in the middle of the night, waking and moving our 7 year old. Room was 85 degrees. Initially, the front desk said they would look into it, then they would call the building engineer and so on, hoping we would leave them  alone with nothing apparently happening for several hours. They stated that they were fully booked, but finally offered an alternative room at midnight. Pool is nice for NYC, good location. So, 2 stars, but I would not recommend it.

title: Nice but could have been five stars
text:
Great location at under 10 min walk to Empire State Building, Grand Central station. Hotel is next to the subway. Lovely hotel with helpful staf on reception. The room was spacious with a kitchen containing microwave dishwasher and fridge. We had a Nespreso coffee machine that was re stocked every morning. The bed was very large and comfortable.
When we checked out unfortunately the hotel tried to charge us just under 20 dollars a day for fun. They call it a resort fee and said it was for use of the pool and WiFi. We refused to pay it and they backed down. Small things like this spoil what was a great stay.

title: Wonderful stay!!
text: This is a beautiful boutique hotel in a great location. We had a lovely, big room, with all the amenities we needed. The staff were so lovely and helpful and helped make this a wonderful week stay in the Big Apple.

title: Aman diyeyim..
text:
Bu otel hakkında söyleyebileceğim iki olumlu şeyden biri lokasyonu-harika lokasyon ,merkezi,her yere ulaşım çok kolay..İkincisi de odanın temizliği-kaldığım 10 gün içinde NYC gibi pis bir şehirde beni rahatsız eden hiç bir şey olmadı.
