Fakat maalesef,personelinin ortalarda görünmediği-böyle bir otelde ilk defa bavullarımın tamamını kendim taşımak zorunda kaldım-ve göründüğü zamanlarda da hiç sevimli ve yardımsever olmadığı-çok tuhaf bir tavır içindeler ,sanki onlar beni değil ben onları memnun etmek zorundaymışım gibi,kim müşteri kim otel personeli belli değil-tuhaf bir mekân.
Her yıkandığınızda banyoyu su basıyor -burası Queen deluxe oda-banyoda eşyanızı koyacak yer bulamıyorsunuz.
İlk geldiğimizde oda çok soğutulmuştu,şikayetimizi ilettik.Bir zahmet 24 saat sonra olaydan bihaber bir teknik eleman yolladılar,orayı burayı kurcaladıktan sonra ısının ayarlanması için mail yazması gerektiğini söyledi.Meğer klima otel dışında bir merkezden idare ediliyormuş,nasıl bir saçmalıksa..36 saat o soğukta kalıp hasta olduk ve sonrasında tamamen kapattılar.Yani hava ısınınca da işe yaramadı,sürekli camlar açık yaşadık.
Kısacası ,paramızla rezil olduk.
Bir daha katiyen gelmeyeceğim bir otel burası..Niyetlenenleri uyarmak da görevimdir diye düşündüm.
Herkese iyi tatiller..

title: Hidden Charges
text:
We had a lovely holiday in NY staying in this great hotel until we checked out. Rooms, staff and location were all great.
The disappointment was after prepaying everything it was a surprise to be handed a statement with a further $20 per day had been charged to our credit card for facilities.
When asked we were advised it was for the provision of the pool (which we didn't know existed hence never used) and that our agent Amoma should have included this charge in their price offer.
I will take this up with Amoma but not expecting anything from them. 
Such a pity to leave NY with a bitter taste after having a faultless stay.

title: Favorite place to stay for business trips to the city
text: My absolutely favorite place to stay when I travel to the city for work. The location is great with easy subway access. All of the staff are really friendly and helpful. The rooms are very clean and don't feel small. It doesn't really have a restaurant, but I ate the food service in the lobby and the food was surprisingly good. Haven't tried the hammam yetm but that is a nice feature as well.

title: ESPERIENZA POSITIVA
text: Purtroppo non posso fare paragoni con altri alberghi a cinque stelle a New York in quanto è stata la mia prima ed unica  esperienza (non ultima spero!) e sicuramente gli standard qualitativi italiani sono superiori.. Premesso ciò la mia stanza era piccolissima giusto lo spazio per le valigie (al contrario di quanto ho letto nelle altre recensioni), la colazione era buonissima (e costosissima)..la hall senza dubbio è molto scenica anche se l'ubicazione dell'hotel lascia a desiderare xkè si trova in  una traversa dove  ci sono una marea di barboni e tossici .. ma l'hotel di questo non può essere responsabile.Tutto sommato un esperienza positiva, prezzo pagato alto ma in linea con altri 5 stelle di New York.

title: A cosy midtown hotel
text:
A good midtown hotel, offering good value for money !! A nice lobby / meeting place for after work drinks.
Room was adequate ( albeit a bit Spartan). An espresso machine would have done wonders for an early morning cup. 
Staff has room to be a bit more courteous and smiling. All said, a good value for money offering.

title: Amazing city
text:
I travelled to New York in March 2018 with my daughter, we arrived mid afternoon after a long journey, the staff were very welcoming and had upgraded our room to King studio, which had a small kitchen and balcony. It was just perfect!

We stayed for 5 nights, the hotel had everything you needed, the location was just around the corner from the Empire State Building, the staff gave good advice and were more than accommodating with any requests.

The city itself is just great with lots to see and do, just make sure you take comfy shoes as there is a lot of walking to be done.  We saw everything we wanted to see, in the time we were there, it was a wonderful holiday.

I would recommend Wolfgangs steakhouse, just around the corner from the hotel, it is an expensive restaurant but definitely worth it.

If you go to visit the 911 memorial, be aware that there are people that start talking to you about the sad event showing you pictures and then try and sell you books, they are reasonable in price, but this may not be for everyone.

title: Huge Disappointment
text: Rooms dark and pretentious - want to be modern but are dated. Public area on first blush looks OK but really not functional. Breakfast seating frankly uncomfortable but food quite good. We had a security problem and staff were frankly unhelpful until we made a fuss. This is a hotel that made me feel entirely underwhelmed and overcharged...be careful of their cancellation policy!

title: Perfection!
text:
I can’t say enough about how great this hotel and staff are! I think I could write a little book about their many kindnesses and the welcoming and efficient atmosphere provided at The Marmara. I’ve stayed here many times, so this is not just the product of a single experience.
   The hotel is certainly beautiful and well located. There are so many amenities that you could stay here and enjoy them, or go out and enjoy the incomparable New York world around you.
   I’d like to point out especially Yolanda, the General Manager. She is on top of everything, creates a welcoming and fun atmosphere and can’t do enough for her guests.
   Fisseha is one in a million! I don’t know where or how, in any hotel, you can find someone as efficient, kind and helpful.

title: Beautiful Hotel, Terrible Service, even from the Manager
text:
We were VERY excited for our trip to New York, it would be our first time in the USA, and it was my birthday gift from my husband. He had saved up for months to treat me. 
•	He told the Hotel that we would be coming to celebrate my birthday and asked them to put a happy birthday Note in the room, this was not done. 
•	On arrival, no welcome drinks or anything that one usually gets at 5 star establishments after travelling for 24 hours from Cape Town, South Africa! 
•	We asked the check-inn assistant, Michael, to please give us a room with a bath tub, he told us there would be a charge, we asked him to show us the original room, and then the upgraded option. 
•	The original room, 13th floor was tiny, and the upgrade was spacious with a kitchenette. The cost to upgrade for the week we would be staying there was $75, we agreed, and paid Michael, who gave us change out of his wallet, which we found strange. 
•	We did not ask for a receipt, as we usually get a bill at the end of our stay. 
•	I am Gluten intolerant so could not have the breakfast on offer, we queried this with the hotel, and asked if I could get an omelette (cheaper than the free breakfast on offer) and was told no. I literally had to go to target, buy gluten free bread, and bring it down to sit and have breakfast with my husband. 
•	And my husband also queried the lack of birthday note in the room, to which the response he got was – we gave you a free upgrade, wasn’t that enough? 
•	He mentioned that we had paid for the upgrade, and the response he got was no, you didn’t. There is no payment on the system. He explained exactly what had happened, and still got the response, there is no payment on the system, and we can’t help you.
•	I then took to Tripadvisor to state our case, low and behold, a few hours later we get an email invitation to breakfast with Yolanda, Garcia. 
•	The breakfast was awkward to say the least. She did not bring Michael, the person who had ripped us off to the meeting, or offer her apologies at first. 
•	Instead she told me that I am making very serious accusations. I explained the entire story and then she said yeah, she saw the footage, but Michael said it was a Tip. Her response to us then is “I have the money, I have the $75, I can give it back to you”. Of course we want our money back, we were conned by a member of your staff! 
•	The most awkward thing is that she had us go back to the reception the next day to ask for the money back. She should have just given it back to us in the first place. 
•	When querying breakfast, and telling her about the unhelpful way the staff dealt with any queries (a simple solution would have been for one of them to order gluten free options and charge it to our room!), she said that all the breakfast staff during the time we stayed there were training. They weren’t yet full members of staff. 
•	The passing the buck attitude was appalling. She made us believe that there was something wrong with us for complaining in the first place. 
•	The cherry on the top of all of this was the fact that she told us that she has a very high rating on tripadvisor, and that she will assist us with all the issues we may be having if we remove the rating. 
•	I did this for the duration of our stay, but feel very unsatisfied in the way that our query was dealt with. 
•	There was barely an apology, and the attitude we got from Yolanda was one that made us feel as though we’re a burden to the hotel. 
•	I’ve stayed in many 5 star hotels in the world. And I can tell you that it’s the attention to detail that matters. 
•	This is a gorgeous hotel, get the service levels to a level that matches the beauty. 

This was a very expensive holiday, one that we don't get to do often in our lives, and it was truly marred by the hotel experience, and the attitude of the staff. I was truly left with a pit in my stomach at the notion of being conned by a five star hotel, on the day we got to New York City.

title: Perfect!
text: Just ended a wonderful stay at the Marmara.  Very chic & trendy - beautifully designed.  Our room was amazing and the service amazing - nothing was too much trouble.  Christopher (in particular) was so helpful.  We used the small pool for a few laps and really enjoyed relaxing & soothing our aching muscles in the hamman.  The hotel is very well situated and we walked or took a quick hop on the subway to our various destinations.  Thoroughly recommend.

title: Comfortable Hotel
text: Although the size of our room was small, it was very comfortable and inviting.  The bed reminded me of my bed at home because it has a down feeling comforter.  The hotel boasts of allergy free bedding though so it may not have been actual down.  I used the spa and had one of the best massages I have ever had.  The personal trainer was skilled as well.  He recommended some great stretching exercises.  The concierge was friendly.  My only complaint was that the elevator has trouble going to the 14th floor.  This was a pain as we had to wait for the second elevator; a minor inconvenience, but they should consider fixing that problem.  The hotel has a bar with excellent service.  I would definitely stay at this location again.

title: Pleasant and quiet
text:
Our room had lovely views and was very clean and  nicely decorated.  The beds were comfortable with nice sheets. The downside for me was la k of any counter in bathroom to put toiletries or make up and poor lighting in room. There was lighting for reading but not for rest of room making it hard to locate clothing. There is also dim lighting in hallways which may be for either ambiance or to save energy, but I would have liked brighter hallways as well.
The lobby has large windows, and is very comfortable . Nice bar and happy hour snacks that were pleasant after long day of walking. Location is convenient for seeing city.

title: Good place to stay in Manhattan
text:
This 5 star hotel was located near the Empire state building.
Our room, on the 14th floor, had a great view on the Empire State. The king size bed was very confortable and clean, but without the service of a 5 star hotel (for example, nobody took us to our room nor carried our luggage...) 
The swimming pool was small, but enjoyable after a day of walking. Contrariwise, the steam bath did not work...
The staff was nice and professional.
In conclusion, it is a good hotel in Manhattan, but not a real 5-star hotel on my mind ;)

title: very pleasant stay
text: very nicestay, quaint restaurant inside, room service, ipad, nice amenities, great water pressure, very clean room. we stayed in a loft on the 10th floor. view was not of city but we had a balcony terrance. great, friendly,. wonderful staff.

title: Хороший Отель с «хромающим сервисом»
text: Расположение отеля в пешей (20 мин) доступности до Times Square, рядом линия метро 6, 900 м до Гранд централ станция. Выглядит внутри достаточно стильным, в двухместном номере нет ни чайника, ни кофеварки, но по просьбе принесли кофеварку, завтраков в NY практически никогда нет в отелях, здесь можно приобрести, но цены заоблачные, мы нашли рядом хорошее кафе с умеренными ценами и качеством. Достоинство-тренажерка и бассейн, в бассейне мы всегда были только вдвоём, есть хамам, но без пара, хотя релакснуть можно. Сервис страдает, карточка без конца не срабатывала в лифте, и каждый раз обещали это исправить, но за 4 суток так и «не получилось». Заселение предложили только после 15 ч, но сказали номер и забрали багаж.. когда мы вернулись через пару час, снова начали регистрацию и уже дали другой номер... Сняли со счета больше 100$ как гарантию оплат, но в номере нечего было оплачивать, никакого мини-бара не было.. за неделю деньги так и не вернули.. Но в целом -спалось хорошо и Релакс в бассейне большой плюс!

title: An Experience Beyond My Expectations!!!
text:
During a crisis I truly found a new family.  
I had been sick and no one knew why.  I then discovered that I had mold all over my apartment  which made it totally uninhabitable and had to move out immediately.  On August 21st, 2017 I moved into The Mamara Hotel Park Avenue, which not only made me feel better as I was away from the mold, but it introduced me to a group of people that truly became my family over the 7 months I was there... Yes you read it right - 7 months.
The accommodations, service and caring they all showed me, from every department in the hotel, was overwhelming. I can't speak highly enough about each and every one I came in contact with, from the Front desk team, to Housekeeping, Engineering, Sales and Marketing - the whole group.  They were really there for me during a very difficult time and I will never forget them. No matter what it is that I needed, at any given time, they came through. 
I finally moved back into my apartment on Sunday March 18th, 2018 and still to this day when I'm out and picturing coming home, I still envision the layout of my hotel room, not my apartment - it had really become my home for those 7 months.  
I miss the friendly hotel team that greeted me every time I came "home" or wished me well when I went out. 
You will be doing yourself a favor if you chose The Mamara Hotel Park Avenue to stay in when you're in New York. It's absolutely amazing

title: Aufenthalt März 2018
text: Angenehme Atmosphäre im gesamten Hotel, freundliche Belegschaft, für NYC sehr gutes Preis-Leistungsverhältnis, gute Anbindung an die Subway und 10-Minuten-Walk bis zur PennStation. Einzig unangenehm ist die übertriebene Duftinszensierung im Lobbybereich. Wir haben das Frühstücksangebot nicht genutzt - es gibt viele Alternativ in nächster Umgebung.

title: This room, definitely not 5 star
text:
We were here for one night, booked through Hotwire, so maybe that’s why we got a poor room. 

On a positive note, the hotel is fresh & clean with a modern vibe. The staff was friendly. The linens were very nice with some of the largest bath towels I’ve ever seen. 

Otherwise, the room was quite small, probably not unusual for NYC. The room had a Murphy bed tucked in an alcove. There was no room on either side for nightstands and no lights at the bed. You take these things for granted until you have no place to put down a book or your glasses, which was really moot since there was no light at the bed anyway. 

The bathroom was pleasant and clean, but there was absolutely no counter surface to put anything down. Again, the things we take for granted...

I realize that as an experienced traveler, I should have asked right away for another room. We were in a hurry and by the time  we realized how problematic was this room, we had already done some unpacking. I’ve learned my lesson. 

Also, at check out we were hit with an $18 “facility fee”, for facilities we never saw or used. I understand that this is a common cash grab in the NY market. There ought to be a law....

title: Maravilhoso
text: Hotel lindo, quarto bem amplo, serviço super cortes. Gostei da localização, fácil acesso para diversos pontos turisticos além de estacao de metro no mesmo quarteirão, o que facilita locomoção. Serviço de limpeza muito bom.

title: Quality hotel in quieter part of city
text: Completed a week long stay at the Marmara and overall, was very happy with the facility and services -- the Front Desk Agent Chris was particularly helpful and accommodating and made our stay most enjoyable.  The room was nicely decorated and everything was functional - nice touches (such as a Nespresso machine) made it that much more comfortable.  Wasn't a fan of the fixed, half shower only partition as it prevents the immediate shower area from reaching optimal warmth as well as increases water from going onto the bathroom floor but that aside, everything else was fine.  The physical location of the hotel is also nice since it's close to various sites in the city but for the most part, in a quieter part of town (Murray Hill).  Had a small breakfast in the hotel dining area one morning - typical fare.  Would be happy to stay here again in the future.

title: Vacaciones cortas
text:
Acabo de estar durante 6 noches en el hotel. Impecable la atención de su gente. El cuarto muy cómodo para una persona. Un tanto chico para 2.
Excelente servicio y atención. Muy biena vista a la ciudad desde el piso 17.
Sin dudas volvería a hospedarme en este hotel en un próximo viaje

title: Avoid the restaurant at all costs.
text: I checked into the Marmara Park Avenue mid-evening after a long day of travel and, having asked the staff about nearby restaurants, was directed to the one just off the lobby.  Fine, I thought; I was tired; I planned to go to bed early.  I ordered a glass of wine and a simple flatbread with prosciutto and mozzarella, thinking that would be simple and safe. Not. The wine was mediocre and underchilled; the so-called "flatbread" was simply the worst concoction I have ever been served: dry and tasteless bread (clearly from a freezer compartment) slathered with tomato sauce (on flatbread?) (clearly from a can an innocent of any seasoning), other ingredients sparse and equally dispiriting, including a few brownish basil leaves. Absolutely dreadful.

title: Great location, Nice room.
text: Enjoyed my overnight stay here in January, service is excellent, rooms are a good size and comfortably furnished.  My room could convert its bed to a couch in the event that is needed for a meeting.  My only criticism, which has been noted in other reviews is there is no counter space in the bathroom - no space around sink or anywhere else for toiletries of anything beyond a toothbrush.  Other than that the finishes were beautiful and high end and location is excellent.

title: High End Potential
text:
THE GOOD
* Customer service
* Rooms designed in good taste
* Minimalist and spacious
* Bed/Pillows very comfortable
* Bathroom was designed with old world luxury in mind

THE BAD 
* Details - details - details
* The Business section was lacking
* The Bar and seating area needed more space
* Lots of scrapes, scratches and chipped painting around
* Location lacked activity

THE UGLY
* Bath drain was too loud
* The pantry to the elevators need attention
* Bar closed before midnight
* Details details details
* Zero views from this hotel

title: Lovely stay
text:
I stayed at the Marmara for 4 nights arriving on December 11th ,the trip was a treat for my daughter's birthday and also for myself as I hadn't been to NYC before.

 Im glad I chose the Marmara ,the location was excellent, quiet ,but not to far from all the main tourist sites , only a short walk to the Empire state building and also walking to distance to times Square ect , there was also a subway station (32nd street) close by on corner of street, which was handy as we used the Subway to travel to Brooklyn ect .

The room was a deluxe Queen suite which was spacious , very clean and comfortable . Was equipped with all the things you would need for a short break in a hotel .The hotel even had a swimming pool , spa and Turkish bath, which not many hotels have in New York , unless you stay in the really posh ones . The Marmara is a 5 * but is reasonably priced compared to other 5 stars .

The staff were very helpful , attentive and professional at all times , nothing was to much trouble for them. We were able to check in early which was a bonus and on the last day our luggage was securely stored for us , so we could spend a few more hours looking around New York before we left .
Im am hoping to return to NYC in the future and I would stay in the Marmara Park avenue again .

title: Not bad....
text: I recently stayed at the Marmara on Park Ave January 28-30th. While the room itself was quite nice, I did find the bathroom sink way too small with nowhere near enough counter space- and I’m a guy!! Lol!! I can’t imagine how many women would regard it?? However, the thing which annoyed me the most was the facility fee which was added on to my bill at check-out, which was never mentioned upon check-in and nowhere to be found on their website... I can’t find it. I wish hotels would just include this in their hotel price to be more upfront.

title: Hotel Flooded During our Stay...
text:
On a second night of our stay the hotel lobby and several floors above the lobby flooded. It was a very cold January week and the plumbing in the hotel froze. We were on a high floor. 

We chose the Marmara hotel mostly for the location, but also for its the elegant style and high rating. The modern and impressive foyer with two fireplaces, bar and a restaurant. 
We knew we would be in and out of the hotel at all hours of the day and night,  as we arrived in town on moments notice for the birth of our granddaughter in a nearby NYU Medical Center. 

I made reservation over the phone mid-afternoon, on the day of our arrival. 
King size room, high floor. Very helpful young lady ( Rishnu) assisted with the booking and parking details and promptly emailed back confirmation.
We were on our way. 
On arrival we walked in the beautiful lobby and asked for a valet to park our car. After a while waiting, already checked in, no-one seemed available to park our car. Not wanting to leave the car on the street and risk a ticket, my husband parked the car in the garage himself, while I waited in the lobby. Just a slight inconvenience not expected in a 5 star hotel.

Our room was fine at the first glance as was the bathroom with a walk in shower. New and modern. 
We left the hotel quickly, to Uber over to the Medical center. 
Excited and happy we barely noticed how cold the room was, even when we returned briefly for about an hour. My husband adjusted the thermostat. Just after midnight we were again summoned to the hospital, this time for real. We were able to see the excited new parents and the baby. The hospital allows for family visit till 1:30 am. I am including this detail to show that we were in and out of the room that night and very early morning and did not realize how freezing the room was, till we returned. Too late to do anything at that point. And that was only the beginning of the hotels heating system problems. 
We were freezing half of the night, using a thin shabby worn out blanket we found in the closet. We did not get much sleep, there was also a lot of noise from the pipes "banging" throughout the night. We left the cold room/cold shower in the morning in a hurry to meet with the rest of the family in the Langone maternity center. 

We came back to the hotel after late dinner.  We were stunned to come back to water pouring from the ceiling on our heads in the lobby. Staff feverishly mopping the floors. 
We were shocked and disappointed because we picked Marmara for the elegant lobby, to enjoy with the rest of the out of state family for an after dinner drink by the fireplace. That was now out of the question. 

The lobby, the bar, the restaurant , the fireplace were out of commission. Tired and frustrated about the situation we went to the room, which was thankfully not flooded, but of course extremely cold. We overheard guests in the elevator and lobby complaining about the same situation, freezing cold rooms. We had no time or energy to move, when it was offered. We thought it was hugely inconvenient and would be a waste of time after hearing others complain. Because the whole hotel's heating system was obviously affected, whether they admitted it or not. 

My husband started to feel the effects of the two cold sleepless nights. He stayed in bed most of the next day. Best laid plans ruined. But he needed to recover some sleep before a ride home. We survived the third night coughing and they opened up the lobby restaurant by the time we were checking out. 

I spoke to Yolanda Garcia before we checked out and she comped one night of our three night stay. Even with that we spent a substantial amount of money that did not commensurate with the quality of our stay and seriousness of the hotel's problem. 
We certainly did not expect our highly anticipated visit to Manhattan to turn into such nightmare.

The hotel also has a unique facility - Turkish bath(probably a good place to warm up) and a pool - and both were out of commission during our stay, or so we have been told. Surely this is also a part of what makes Marmara stand out and the room rates reflect that.  

Upon return home I followed up with an email to Ms. Garcia, detailing our complaint and dissatisfaction. I have not heard back. 

I am convinced that a true 5 star hotel would have done more, as the comfort of their guests should be a high priority. 

We travel extensively, chose high rated luxury hotels and expect the best. Needless to say we were hugely disappointed.  

Throughout the ordeal, we found the front desk staff pleasant, apologetic and trying to be  helpful...
The valet parking if you can get it would have been $65/24hrs for our large Benz, less for smaller sedan. The next door self park garage is convenient. 
The location is great too, and if they get their heating/cooling system fixed it could be a great place to stay. 

The poor rating reflects our unfortunate experience in January....

title: Hotel boutique
text:
Es de los hoteles llamados boutique . Pequeños , acogedores , tranquilos . Esta muy cerca del meollo andando y no te clavan un rejón porque no es de los más conocidos . Es el típico sitio para ir a Nueva York y alojarse siempre ahí .tenia una pequeña cocina incluso para comprar comida y hacerla tranquilamente. Pero no con fuegos , me refiero a cosas frías . 
Buenas vistas !

title: Superbe. Très bonne adresse
text: Hotel très classe. Grande suite avec cuisine entièrement équipée. Personnel très pro et très agréable et serviable.. rien à dire de plus... 5 voyages à ny en 2 ans... 5 hôtels différents.. dont Sofitel, Parker Méridien, W et le Marmara est bien la meilleure adresse.

title: Unfortunately, a Very Bad Stay For Us
text:
Firstly, we really wanted to like this hotel like how we were initially impressed by photos and reviews to choose this hotel.

Being a 5 stars hotel, we booked this hotel for 6 nights as the hotel for our last half of our NY trip. We stayed in a 4 stars hotel during the first half our stay. The comparisons between the 4 stars hotel we stayed earlier and this are miles different. 

In summary and TLDR, we changed room 5 times. It could have happened the 6th time but we got so sick of packing/unpacking our luggage. 

In detail:

1st room - decently sized king sized bed with balcony. Lovely room except for the fact that there is no sofa but just a single chair for seating. The bathroom is tiny and inconvenient for two to get ready in. Air conditioning cools nicely but was making clicking noises every 30 seconds. The clicking noise could not be fixed by the engineering team (he knew about the issue and it is appalling how the hotel still putting guests in the room and hoping for the best) and thus a room change was offered. 

2nd room - Upgraded a higher class room but this room's air conditioning was not working properly. The lowest temperature for the hotel’s rooms seem to be 21 degrees but the air conditioning here decides to cut off much more regularly and leaving the room stuffy and warm. We left the air conditioning on and hoping to come back to a chilled room after dinner. Unfortunately, the room was still stuffy and warm.

3rd room – As we only found out about the issue late at night, the Night Manager upgraded us to an apartment sized room with separate bed room, living room, laundry and kitchen. Unfortunately, air conditioning was blowing but not cold air. It then thinks it hits the right temperature and cut offs refusing to start.  Again, we swapped rooms.

4th room - Much larger loft sized room with a crazy large bathroom that had dual sinks. Now, two or even more people can get ready in this bathroom. The air conditioning here was effectively cooling such a large room. 

Unfortunately, the person who designed this large room’s only bathroom was either trying to be funny or have not thought out how a regular shower occurs. Firstly, the only shower is by using the bathtub. However, there is no place to lodge the shower head on a handle to shower hands free. You have to hold the shower head to wash yourself. The water pressure is strong and while soaping yourself, you cannot just leave the shower head in the bathtub as the shower head will flying and spraying around in circles. Therefore, you have turn off the water and re-adjust the temperature again when turning on. Do you really expect guests to take a bath each time instead of a quick shower? 
Moreover, the hanger to hang your towel is placed around 10 feets away - meaning you have to get out of the bathtubs in the cold and wet to walk around the large bathroom to retrieve your towel. 

5th room - Considering we did want to go through all the hassles with just taking a normal shower and that this would be the fifth room change, we were angry. The next morning, we asked for the Duty Manager, whom agreed with the design flaws of the bathtub shower and hanging your towels. Further, we were advised that he encountered the same problems with some other rooms in the hotel with this bathroom design, and, management were actually looking in renovating the bathroom shower. He also offered free breakfast during our stay.

The fifth room that we were put in was back to an apartment sized room with separate bedroom and living area. The air conditioning works for the living area but not the bedroom. This time, we were so fed up we decided against changing rooms. Considering both air conditioning units were identical, it is blatantly obvious you can observe each unit’s behavior as well as the cold air coming out to feel the room’s temperature.

Other than that, the breakfast was not great. Even though it was offered as compensation to the room changes, we skipped the remaining mornings. Again, comparing to the first hotel we stayed in, the selection was poor and even easy things like bread/bagel are not fresh. The person serving the breakfast was also very unfriendly and refused to engage in a welcoming manner with hotel guests. Hello, it is breakfast, first meal of the day and you would nearly be the first other person that guests will interact with. 

Not a big issue to us but when we were there, the pool/spa was closed. We were not told about this prior to booking our stay. 

Location-wise, you are steps away from the Subway and good walk to most of Manhattan's must-dos. 

Perhaps it may be a New York thing with air conditioning being cold but the first hotel we stayed in, the air condition operates perfectly like how it should operate. 

Sorry, we do not like rating a hotel a one star but our experience with this hotel was so horrible that it ruined our plan to end our NY trip on a good note.

title: Very good location
text:
Excellent location ideal for all for all sight seeing, very close to the Empire State building.
Very clean and quiet. Close to the metro, railway station and taxis. Great retreat after a hards days sight seeing.

title: Nella media
text:
Sappiamo bene che gli hotel a new york non hanno la stessa concezione di stelle che abbiamo noi in italia. comunque, assodato ciò, per essere un 5 stelle lusso è molto bello. soprattutto l'ingresso è molto scenico. le stanze sono ampie, con angolo colazione e frigo a completa disposizione dei clienti. Nell'angolo colazioni vi sono bollitore con 2 bottigliette d'acqua al giorno e filtri the, macchinetta per il caffè con 6 cialde al giorno. Il frigo invece è molto spazioso.
tra le dotazioni della camera vi è una mega tv ed un tablet con cui interagire con i diversi servizi. ovviamente la pizza la sconsiglio, ma per il resto non si mangia male, a parte i prezzi alti ovviamente. infine vi è un armadio e un telefono. Nell'armadio trovate anche 2 accappatoi e ciabatte per scendere in spa.
la camera, come detto è ampia, con un mega letto matrimoniale. ne risente solo il bagno: molto piccolo, con una doccia molto grande, ma per il resto ci entra solo 1 persona alla volta. il kit di cortesia molto ben fornito.
complessivamente è un albergo ottimo, in una zona strategica.
al ritorno ci hanno conservato le valige tutta la giornata e offerto il loro servizio aeroportuale, a prezzi medi.

title: Matthew O. Fisch
text:
Marmara Rooms are very clean , and comfortable! Their service and Breakfast was outstanding. Special Thanks to Yolanda Garcia, and Shelly Singh who guided us the hotel and gave us good advice for some local restaurants 

Marmara had Spectacular &  unique style and a wonderful entrance breakfast and cocktail area. The hotel has quintessential European feel/style with very good lighting!  It’s a Very impressive atmosphere! 

We really enjoyed staying at the Hotel and highly recommend the Marmara!  

Btw- 32nd and Park was very convenient to NY culture  ie and fun ie the Empire State Building ( if you go at night after 10pm .. there are no lines!

title: Business trip
text: I had stayed at this hotel for a long time. Those who want to stay for a long time offering very affordable low prices. Good service, cleanliness, atmosphere and cheap prices. I had liked and suggest you.

title: Love this Boutique Spot
text: This hotel is lovely .. recently opened.. within a couple of years so everything is new especially the great faces that greet you. Shout out to to the young gentleman that took care of valeting my car and taking care of my luggage.. I'm so sorry that I do not remember your name as it was very difficult to pronounce but I know you know who you are. Atmosphere is beautiful, rooms are spacious and spotless.... try reserving a room on the upper floors as they offer a balcony,  priceless.  Was able to get a late check out as I was under the weather...love that . Will definitely be returning,  thank you.

title: Pessima esperienza
text:
Avevamo
Prenotato dall ‘Italia questo albergo che dalle foto sembrava al
Top ma .... arrivati in data 1 gennaio l ‘albergo si trova in una traversa di park Avenue , a fianco si trova un luogo dove gli homeless ( i senza casa ) si trovano per chiedere il pranzo o la cena quindi , con tutto rispetto , non mi sembra una location e una via da albergo a 5stelle , appena entrati e stanchi del viaggio e ancor prima di vedere la camera ci strisciano entrambe le carte di credito e ci trattengono 130 dollari a testa di cauzione per il check out oltre alla cifra pazzesca di oltre 2500 dollari ( a cui siamo
Arrivati con le loro tasse varie ), poi ci danno  la camera al sedicesimo piano , brutta e non quella della foto della prenotazione , gelida con problemi
Al riscaldamento e con moquette orrenda e sporca , la mia ragazza si lamenta subito e solo dopo varie insistenze e 20 dollari di mancia al facchino ci cambiano la camera mettendoci al 12 piano in una camera discreta ( comunque parliamo di 400 dollari al giorno )..... 
le colazioni si svolgono nella hall dell ‘albergo che per sicurezza deve tenere una delle due porte di ingresso aperte e quindi noi e gli ospiti eravamo completamente 
Al gelo ma al personale maleducato e come ha già segnalato un ‘altra persona , molto distaccato non importava nulla ... prezzo della colazione di base 24 dollari a testa con ogni altra cosa extra .... il top e ‘ stato raggiunto una mattina dove alle8,30
Mentre ci accingevamo a fare colazione , il personale era intento a fare le pulizie riversando sul pavimento di marmo
Litri e litri di cera liquida ,odore assurdo , abbiamo dovuto litigare , loro se ne sono fregati e hanno continuato ad andare avanti e noi ci siamo dovuti far portare la colazione in camera .... abbiamo fatto ben 2 complain / lamentele a Booking .com con cui avevamo prenotato il risultato è che ci hanno omaggiato di 2 colazioni .... al gelo ... risultato quindi assolutamente pessimo invito tutti a non andarci e / o a disdire la loro prenotazione .... gran peccato perché avevamo delle ottime aspettative e invece è stato un vero schifo il trattamento riservatoci !!! Spero vengano declassati , non si può parlare di albergo a5 stelle .... non si può !!!! 

Lorenzo 

Milano , Italy

title: Not worth the extra money!
text: I booked 2 rooms at this hotel on New Years Eve as a special treat for the last day of our holiday, check in was fine, fast and efficient. check out was the same. 6am in the morning and He was happy and smiling. However the bit in the middle left a lot to be desired. My room had a bed so high I had to climb onto a sofa to get onto it and i'm not short at 5'8.  I couldn't charge my phone next to my bed but on the other side of the room. I had to get out of bed to turn the lights off. The air con clunked all night even when it was turned off, and the lights on the smoke detectors was flashing like JFK runway. We were charged to use the pool. The only positive thing i could say about the experience was the towels were bigger than in most hotels!!!

title: Not a 5 star experience
text:
Stayed over New Years for three nights. Each night had sleep ruined by loud clicking sound coming from heater. Reported to front desk who did send someone to look at it but did nothing to fix the problem. Also did not repair burned out light bulb I reported. Whole heating system sucked - would not go above 68 although the actual temperature in room was in the 50s near the windows due to poor insulation. 
Front desk staff extremely unfriendly - especially older woman with tight bun and slight accent. She checked me in and out and didn’t disclose an $18 per day “facility fee” until checkout. Never had a nice hotel not disclose such a fee clearly up front. Felt duped - especially because of the poor condition of the “facility”. Won’t be back and would not consider this a 5-star hotel. 
On the positive side, bed was comfortable, room large, great kitchenette and nice bathroom. Housekeeping discreet and good.

title: 5 star hotel
text:
Beautiful decor, very welcoming friendly staff. Kindly upgraded on the last night which was a nice treat. Thank you for you're hospitality. Recommended to all my family and friends heading to NYC.

.......

title: Very nice
text: Staff is excellent. Room very nice with kitchen area. Bathroom could be larger but with extra counter space in kitchen area and bedroom area, it was fine. Bathroom could also be brighter. Room was clean. King size bed very comfortable with great pillows. Very cool mirrors throughout the room.

title: AMAZING
text: Hemos pasado unas vacaciones increíbles en este bonito hotel. El personal fantástico, la limpieza excelente y la habitación genial con vistas al edificio Chrysler y al Empire State. La cama y las almohadas comodísimas!!! El detalle de la cafetera es genial. Este hotel y su personal ha hecho que nuestro viaje sea perfecto. Lo recomendamos 100%.

title: Good location, reasonable room, disinterested staff
text: The two bedroom self contained Loft apartment suited our family's needs for our New York family Christmas visit. It was roomy and reasonably well appointed, with a central location. However it was badly let down by the staff who were disinterested in our comfort and on two occasions fabricated a response when asked a question. Only with persistence was our package and then our luggage located. Management were equally unhelpful. With some professionalism at the front desk, this could be a good choice for family visiting NY.

title: Fantastic!
text: Every employee was so nice and so accommodating! It was clean and beautiful, modern and timeless. The bartender was super friendly and made us custom cocktails just for fun. We loved the part of town it was in as well, on a quiet street and conveniently right next to the subway. I would definitely stay there again!

title: Beautiful and convenient location
text: We booked a king room the night before we traveled, the weekend before Christmas. Arrived early and they had a room already ready for us. The room was large compared to other New York City hotel rooms and well appointed. The staff was friendly. We had an issue with the air conditioning, and they sent somebody up to fix it. He told us that he reset the compressor, and if there was any other issues that we need to request to be moved to a different room because it will take him more time to fit it, I would assume. We ended up having more issues with the AC, so I called the front desk to have the issue sorted out. The woman at the front desk upgraded us to a suite, called a king studio. She also included free continental breakfast for us for the three nights we were staying. The suite upgrade was a gorgeous room with walk-in closet and a big bathroom with tub. It also had a balcony. The staff was super friendly and accommodating always. The hotel is located on a block with a stop on the six train, which was literally 500 feet from the door of the hotel room. Very convenient. Even before the upgrade I would recommend this place, but the staff making issues right really pushed it over the top for us. Will be back.

title: Disapointing
text:
Being for business in New York and wanted to try a for us new hotel we read good things about. How disapointing it was. 
Being a party of three, the first one flew in from Switzerland, checked in, had to find the room himself, the third bed wasn’t ready a.s.o. Then we, the last two checked in two hours later. This went well and it seemed we even got an upgrade. But was this so much better? Very spacious beautifull room but no minibar, little amenities, not what we’re used to have in a 5* hotel. We paid almost $900 a night and for what?
Next time we’ll go somewhere else. 
At breakfast nobody seemed to care about us, we had to get our coffee and food ourselves, but still there was a surcharge of 18%, for what??
We really can not recommand this hotel, where we were expecting so much about!
Disapointing !

title: Buono ma lontano da un 5 stelle
text:
Le camere sono ampie e ben pulite.
Bagno bello ma con doccia inadeguata: misero il braccio doccia, poca acqua davvero.
il servizio è cortese ma "distaccato": fanno il minimo richiesto.
lunghe attese davanti all'ascensore.
buono ma c'è di meglio.

title: A nice enough hotel
text: Overall a fine stay.  Highlights were the glamorous yet cozy lobby.  There always seemed to be a pleasant buzz there.  Beautiful, light and airy space.  One of the two fireplaces was working.  And that is  kind of the theme of the hotel.  Infrastructure could use some maintenance. We were upgraded to an ample one-bedroom suite.  However, the thermostat could not be adjusted.  So the bedroom was chilly and the living/kitchen area was on the warmer side.  Overall the feeling was more sparse than luxurious.  However, tons of cupboards for storage.  And really appreciated having two separate rooms for work - both of us working.  But internet lousy in the bedroom, so had to drag laptop into the living area for adequate internet service.  The management sent a nice fruit platter to compensate for difficulties with the room.  The hammam was fun, but lacked service.  There were zero attendants. (The check in clerk and life guard did not move from their stations.) So lockers were not tidied and restocked.  My husband could not find a robe.    (Not even mentioning here the guest stretched out on the hammam marble slab still checking his mobile!!) Elevator foyer could definitely use a coat of paint. Or two. The staff that were there were most solicitous.  Location fantastic.  Beautiful seasonal décor.  Just lacking the commitment to detail that is the hallmark of a truly great hotel.  Soooo close to being really terrific.

title: My new favorite NYC hotel
text:
I love this hotel!  My usual NYC hotel was booked up so I decided to look for another Manhattan hotel.  I was bringing the kids with me, so I really wanted a pool.  I am so excited that I discovered the Marmara.  
- This hotel is very luxurious.  The lobby is gorgeous and very refined.
-The rooms are standard NYC size (which means not very large) but they are beautiful.  Some rooms even have a balcony.
- All the staff are very friendly and tremendously helpful.  A special mention to Stephanie at the front desk who was instrumental in making sure all our needs and multiple rooming arrangements were sorted out.
- the pool is very nice.  Far more elegant than any standard hotel pool.  And since it is a smaller hotel, it means less guests, and thus the pool was never crowded.
- my favorite was the Turkish bath.  I don't even like saunas or steam rooms normally but I loved this one.  It is not too hot and it is very large, and once again not crowded at all.

I will be back!  Both with the family or even on a romantic adult trip.

One observation - the balcony on my room was a shared balcony with another room.  I was surprised there was no divider on the balcony to maintain more privacy for the guests.

title: Beautiful Hotel
text:
This is such a beautiful boutique hotel in the heart of Manhattan. Just off of 32nd and Park Ave, the location is easily accessible to all of the site...there's a subway line 1/2 block from the hotel. All the staff at the hotel were amazing and very attentive. The room was spacious, modern, and nicely decorated. We even had a balcony for our room.

Will definitely be coming back again!!

title: 2 star service at 4 star hotel
text:
I think from a decor and amenities perspective, this hotel is a 4 to 5 star. However, it needed some better maintenance and maybe an upgraded continental breakfast - you can only have feta, olives and hard boiled eggs a couple of days in a row. 

The poor service is the reason I won't return. The bellman was great however the young woman with glasses at the front desk was pretty annoying. First, she ignored me as she proceeded to rifle through some papers. Then finally I gave her my passport and credit card. She checked us in and then she started to talk about their amenities - adding "but you don't have breakfast in your rate" - and I let her do so. Then I proceeded to point out that my confirmation email which I showed her did indeed have daily breakfast, a welcome drink, a room upgrade and late check-out. But of course she only gave me breakfast vouchers for 1 day so I had to confirm with the booking agency that daily breakfast was included in the fee. Then she proceeded to ask me for photo ID for my fiancé, who was driving away to return the rental car, as well as mine. I honestly had to wonder if she was discriminating against us as we have never had to produce photo ID of both parties - the last time I did this I was in Russia 10 years ago. Then for some reason 2 of our Canadian credit cards weren't working even though they were just fine according to the bank. We had to use a US credit card. Maybe they have an outdated IT system. She was not trained by a 5 star hotel or if she was, she failed the grade.

Generally, you can tell when a hotel is doing well and the employees are happy. This did not feel like one of them. We all want to feel like our hotel is a home away from home and being at the Marmara felt like a punishment.

title: Rare combination in NYC
text:
NY’s competitive hotel industry rarely offers a tasteful mid size hotel that provides excellent services, despite the fact one is not a celebrity or high spender.

The Marmara Park offers spacious rooms with kitchens, a modern very clever ambience and superb staff attitude and service.

The location is not the most convenient but, with NY’s vast public transport offering, it’s not an issue.

title: Not a 5 star hotel but good nonetheless
text:
We booked our stay via Expedia who advertised this hotel as a 5 star.  Needless to say when you book a 5 star hotel and pay similar prices to such it's what you expect when you arrive but, as nice as this hotel was, it wasn't a 5 star.  Perhaps it's EXPEDIA's fault in that they're not rating the hotel accurately but when I book a hotel that is 5 star rating I expect a little more attention to detail.

Overall however, the hotel is good let me sum up why:

1.  The hotel rooms are clean as is the hotel in general except for our bar encounter
2.  The staff are friendly and very helpful

However there are areas for improvement which are:

1.  The one (and it then became the only time) we had a drink in the bar I found flies in my drink.  Small annoying flies that weren't flying around me when the drink was served so they must've landed in my drink en route to my table.  For this reason we didn't go back for another drink nor did we ever eat there.  My glass that held my drink wasn't clean either and smudged.

2.  The bar area and general reception area whilst decorated white is "scuffed" with black marks along the bottom of the decor which again, I'm a stickler for attention to detail but it does show the hotel as needing some improvement in some areas

3.  The downstairs toilets whilst they are individual units are unisex.  This is a personal bug bear of mine I prefer to keep my toilet separate from gents especially when I once entered and found the toilet seat up and urine over the basin.  Sorry to any men reading this but this is why women generally prefer their own toilet I know you're not all like this!  My husband doesn't feel the need to wee all over the seat but let's keep the toilets ladies and gents anyway shall we?

4.  The mattress on our bed became "inverted" as my husband and I slept on it so we would essentially roll into each other.  My husband and I are average size but a decent mattress shouldn't allow for that.  The bed itself was also too high off the floor.  I'm 5ft6" and shouldn't have to slide off the bed I was also 14 weeks pregnant so didn't feel particularly comfortable with a bed that high off the floor I had to hop onto it which anyone who's pregnant/been pregnant will tell you isn't a great idea.

In short this hotel has the promise of being great but didn't quite live up to it nor did it live up to what we were told by EXPEDIA (rightly or wrongly) was 5 star quality.  The staff however were great I will give it that.

title: Lusso e Gentilzza
text:
Il miglior hotel dove io e mia moglie abbiamo alloggiato anche se solo per due notti.L 'Hotel è di lusso ha tutto ciò che ti aspetti da un 4/5 stelle dalla pulizia alla gentilezza del personale , ai servizi che ti offre. La posizione è ottima situato vicino all empire ti permette di raggiungere anche altre "attrazioni" a pochi minuti a piedi (per chi ama camminare ).
Le camere sono molto spaziose pulite e ben illumiate;  è presente anche la macchinetta del caffè con la quale si può bere un buon caffè. 
Eccellente! !!

title: Beautiful hotel, don't forget the spa!
text:
The location was great, lobby was so beautiful - I couldn't believe it when I walked in. They were really nice, held my bags and got me checked in early. The room was clean and modern, room service reliable and quick. 

It was like a little oasis in the middle of a busy city. The spa pool and Turkish bath were AMAZING! I don't know why more people weren't there. I spent every morning dumping bowls of water on my head, it was the best.

Only recommendation is to PLEASE make the pool warming. It's way too cold, even for lap swimming. 

Thank you! Will definitely be back.

title: Quick Couples getaway
text: Me and my boyfriend currently live in Queens, but wanted to have a quick little getaway in the city. We stayed for one night and couldn't have been more pleased. The location was excellent, nearby to all the city hotspots for dinner and drinks and we had an amazing time. We had the upmost privacy, you'd never guess other guests were staying at the hotel! A very modern and beautiful hotel. Nearby to public transportation. We booked about 2 months in advance and got an excellent deal through tripadvisor. Definitely worth the money. Will be coming back for future getaways!

title: Good option for a long stay
text:
I think this hotel is a good option for those staying in the city for a while. The rooms are spacious, there’s a subway stop steps away, and the in-room amenities are well-suited for longer-term guests. All you really need is a toothbrush and your clothes because mouthwash, shower gel, lotion, a shower cap, vanity set, shampoo, and conditioner are all provided. The room also has a mini (but larger than usual) refrigerator, tea kettle, coffee maker, toaster, and dishes. If you need an iron, you can request one. 

While I think the hotel is a really good option for longer-term guests, there were some things that I wished were different. When we arrived, a valet staff person wasn’t outside or immediately available. I had to go in and try to find someone to help us, so it wasn’t an ideal first impression. Aside from that, the staff (including the valet staff) were super professional and seemed willing to assist in any way.  (I really thought they were exceptional.) The hotel was clean and had a nice aromatic scent, but I was just a bit underwhelmed. The elevators were a bit dark and the room doors a bit scuffed. The stand-out was the balcony, which we really enjoyed. 

Overall, I give the hotel a rating of very good, especially for longer-term visitors to the city.

title: A bit of luxury
text: I stayed at the Marmara for two nights on a business trip. Check in and check out were flawless, staff all did an excellent job, and my room was great. The room was quite large, had a kitchenette, extremely nice carpeting, great bathroom amenities, huge luxurious towels, bathrobe, slippers, a pod coffee maker, a huge flat screen TV, and complimentary bottled water. The room was quiet and relaxing. My only slight complaint is I would have loved to have another couple of conveniently located power outlets. All in all it was a fantastic stay.

title: Service made the difference
text:
I just spent one night. I was in NYC for a business meeting and this property was close by. If you pay in advance, you can get a pretty good discount. So I took advantage of that.

Everything was in line with what you'd expect for a 4 or 5 star property. What stood out for me were two things: (1) I had forgotten my cufflinks. And one of the staff came up with an innovative idea for using paper clips -don't ask how, but he made it work (2) I was able to get a slightly later check out which helped me with my meeting schedule.

I'd happily stay here again and recommend this property.

title: İlk defa geliyorsanız başka bir yer aramayın
text:
Bence bir otelin kalitesi resepsiyonda başlar bu otelin kalitesi kapının önünde başlıyor kapıyı açtığınızda Harika bir kokuyla karşılaşıyorsunuz lobiye girdiğinizde resepsiyonun karşılama şekli insanların güler yüzlü ve isteklerinize karşı ilgili ve çözüm odaklı olması çok önemlidir daha önceden rezervasyon yaptırmış olmama rağmen yüksek katlardan oda istediğimde ve balkonlu olursa Çok memnun olacağımı söylediğimde hemen değişiklik yaparak isteğimin karşılanması samimiyetle yardımcı olmaları Harika bir tatilin başlangıcı oldu 
Bunun dışında otelin konumu newyork un popüler caddelerine ve mekanlarına olan yakınlığı inanılmaz derecede hayatımı kolaylaştırdı newyork a ilk seyahatinizi yapıyorsanız düşünmeden gelebilirsiniz Harika bir otel sizi bekliyor 😊

title: Loved Nomi beauty and this hotel
text: I come to New York City often but this was my first time at this hotel. I really enjoyed it. The rooms are very nice and the location is good. But the best part of my stay was the hair hair and makeup appointment in room. Which was in room and amazing! Such a nice touch.

title: Tolles Hotel mit tollem Personal
text: Dieses Hotel ist eine richtige Perle in New York,mit sehr sauberen Zimmern ,tollem Ambiente und einem sehr hilfsbereitem Personal, egal ob an der Rezeption, am Eingang oder im Zimmmer alle waren sehr zuvorkommend . Einen besonderen Dank an Christopher an der Rezeption ,ohne seine Hilfe hätten wir unsere NY Rangers Karten nicht so schnell bekommen . Lieben Gruß aus Deutschland

title: Lovely boutique hotel and fantastic service
text:
My wife and I recently stayed at the Marmara Park Avenue Hotel for two nights,  on the last stop of our three week honeymoon. We arrived travel weary and hit and were immediately hit by the efficient air conditioning and the lovely fragrance of the hotel on entering the lobby. The doors were held open for us and we arrived to a warm welcome. Check-in was fast and efficient and we were soon in our room.

Our room was a 'Guest Room', it was nice and big which was a pleasant surprise to us as we hadn't expected to have so much space in a city hotel. The room was immaculately clean and a nice array of toiletries were provided. Other amenities included an in room free wifi, iPad, empty fridge, nespresso machine and hairdryer.  There was also some chilled complimentary bottles of water provided. There was no iron or ironing board in the room but this was provided on request and left with us until the end of our stay which was really helpful. 

The hotel has a swimming pool and fitness centre and a complimentary continental breakfast.

The 6 subway (uptown) is a 1 minute walk away from the hotel and the 6 down town over a further road. Once stop up town and you are at Grand Central Terminal so the whole of NY is accessible.

The staff were helpful and courteous thought our stay and always seems interested in our sightseeing. 

If you are not a people person then the in room iPad has lots of restaurants and things to do pre loaded.

We really enjoyed our stay and would happily return when next in NY.

title: Amazing amenities
text: My boyfriend surprised me with a stay here on his birthday, I know that sounds terrible. At first I just thought it was an overpriced hotel in the city with great location, oh boy I was wrong. Our room had this amazing balcony it made us feel as if we were in our own private rooftop. My favorite part was finding out it has a hammam and a swimming pool. I was ecstatic as I love to swim and I'm currently teaching my boyfriend how to swim. This place is amazing for work or couples. Thank you babe for this amazing gift on your birthday.

title: Poor Valet Services
text: The hotel and amenities were great, The beds in the rooms are super comfortable and the pool/gym/turkish bath really gets my praise. The view of the city was just a view of a huge building directly outside the window. I could literally see what people at work were doing on their computers across the street. The schedules and strict rules the hotel enforces for valet are disappointing. $50 for a day of valet parking, you cannot take your car out until your stay at the hotel is expired or else there will be another $50 fee to put your car back in. I needed something out of my car late at night but said valet service was closed, so I was out of luck until the AM. Upon leaving, I had to wait 45 minutes for valet to get my car 2 blocks from the garage to the hotel. Not to mention, $90 for a complete breakfast by room service. I know this is NYC, I didn't not expect to spend money... but $90? Ridiculous.

title: A Great Hotel In New York City
text: Hotels in NYC are very expensive overall, and higher end hotels are even more expensive.  This is a high end hotel that is not overpriced, and that offers great rooms and a really pleasant reception.  We checked in and were upgraded to a one bedroom suite.  It was one of the nicest rooms we have stayed in in NYC.  Modern, efficient, and including a kitchen, dining room, living room and bathroom.  Incredibly comfortable!  And the pool was great for laps.  The staff were helpful and responsive.

title: Um hotel moderno e Clean na Big Apple
text: Hotel muito bem localizado na middletown (32 St), muito próximo ao Empire States, próximo a Macy's e a Fifth avenue. Muito confortável, com quartos amplos e silenciosos, e o pessoal que trabalha no hotel é muito educado e agradabilíssimo, desde os recepcionistas às camareiras. O hotel ainda oferece salão de ginástica, banho turco, piscina interna e aquecida, ideal para um relax, após um dia de caminhada ou de compras pela Big Apple.

title: One of the loudest hotels I have ever stayed in.
text: I stayed in this hotel over Labor Day weekend and there was constant loud music blaring the entire time. Asked several times about it at the desk and nothing was ever done. It sounded like music from a club coming from within the hotel.

title: Luxury. Stylish. Chic. Cool.
text:
Loved this hotel. It's really stylish, chic, and cool without the pretension. Luxury but with personality. Close to a subway stop. Room was stylish and very nice. I had my own balcony which is rare in NYC. Rooms are quiet.

If you are looking to stay in this part of Manhattan, definitely stay at the Marmara.

title: Luxury cool in Manhattan
text: Loved this place from the stylish lobby, warm welcome, spacious room and great staff. Tea and coffee facilities in the room and complimentary water made us welcome after our flight. The in room iPad was a great way to order room service, get a do not disturb and even arrange transport. We loved it and I would go back. 100 metres to 33rd street subway station, 1stop from grand central station and great restaurants just round the corner. Highly recommend this hotel. Try to find time to use the swimming pool, a luxury in NYC.

title: Superbe !
text:
Un hôtel très bien placé, à quelques pas d'une station de métro et permettant d'accéder à pied rapidement à plusieurs des quartiers si agréables.
Un excellent accueil surtout par les 2 messieurs, dont Randy Acevedo : Respect, disponibilité, aide précieuse, efficacité. Nous avons énormément apprécié le changement de chambre, nous permettant une vue sur la ville, et cela a participé, pour nous, à un meilleur séjour.
Le personnel de chambre est exemplaire : Réactivité, discrétion, parfait ! 
Félicitations.
Un grand confort dans la chambre moderne fonctionnelle, très propre, très appréciable.

title: Greatest hotel in New York
text: I loved this hotel.  My room had a Turkish-esque marble bathroom, the rooms are huge and modern fixtures. My room had all you need kitchen. With mini dining table and great coffee machine, the closet was late and has a safe, the bed was a Murphy bed, but high quality one, and the service was super great. I will stay here every time in New York.

title: Absolute Extraklasse
text:
Das Hotel war wohl relativ neu, als wir dort eincheckten. Das Personal war vorbildlich und freundlich, man wurde immer nett gegrüßt.
Im Fahrstuhl trafen wir auch den Manager und wir führten eine kurze Unterhaltung. Auch sehr nett.
Die Zimmer waren absoluter Wahnsinn. Super eingerichtet, großzügig, sauber.
DIe Lage natürlich auch sehr gut um die Stadt zu erkunden.

Alles in allem sehr zu empfehlen!!!

title: Lovely hotel
text: I stayed for a long weekend with my partner. The hotel was really nice- modern, clean, really helpful and friendly staff and spacious rooms. The gym and pool area were really luxurious and the guy who worked down there on the desk was so friendly and helpful. Great location too, pretty close to everything.

title: Super Location,Super Staff
text: This is a very nice hotel. I found a nice deal on a larger room, which made all the difference in my stay. Friends were in a smaller room which was just ok.I loved the design & architecture. Do put some time aside to visit the pool area, it was heaven ! The location is ideal for exploring. And the staff were incredible.

title: Great location, friendly hotel
text:
Stayed 4 nights on a visit with my teenage son.

Booked early and got a good rate on a larger room.

The location is excellent, right by 32nd street subway.

Reception very friendly and helpful. It's not a huge hotel, but was quite trendy in decor.

Our room was very comfortable with kitchenette, including fridge, nespresso and tea making facilities.

Bathroom was good, though small and not really anywhere convenient to put toiletries.  Could do with a shelf.

We were on 16th floor and lifts were not the quickest!

Would stay there again.

title: Onprettige locatie
text: Laat ik met het positieve beginnen, het personeel is extreem vriendelijk en behulpzaam. Ook had ik een was en droger in de kamer, geweldig. Keuken is ook heel mooi!  Wat ik echter echt heel naar vond is dat het precies naast een opvanghuis voor dak- en thuislozen gelegen is. Ik kreeg daar een heel naar gevoel bij. Staan die mensen, mannen, vrouwen en kinderen, in de rij voor een bordje eten en ga ik lekker mijn hotel in. Onprettig. Ook hangen er daardoor de hele dag dak- en thuislozen voor de deur rond. De slaapkamer vond ik wel wat klein. En een nadeel was dat de AC het niet goed deed, ondanks dat ik er 4x iemand voor heb laten komen. Maakt veel lawaai en koelt niet echt. Voor al het geld wat ik voor dit hotel betaald heb vond ik het echt een afgang.

title: Una cama para tres
text:
Des de hace seis meses reservamos un estudio en este hotel ,para tres personas , para nuestras vacaciones de julio. Cual fue nuestra sorpresa al llegar y ver que la habitación solo tenía una cama! Al quejarnos,la recepcionista nos dijo que había clientes que les añadían una cama supletoria pero que en estos momentos no tenían ninguna disponible. Se nos cayó el mundo encima: jet lag, calor, cansancio...
Tuvimos que insistir mucho ( cuando estás de vacaciones no tienes ganas de discutir, y más habiéndolas preparado con tanta antelación!) y al final apareció el "plegatín" (cama plegable). Es de SENTIDO COMÚN que si la reserva es para 3 personas, se necesitan 3 espacios para poder dormir(cama doble+cama individual).
A partir de aquí , todo muy bien : personal e instalaciones.
Nos recomendaron subir al bar del piso 20 para ver las vistas, pero siempre estaba prohibido entrar a causa de eventos particulares. Lástima!

title: Pampered, minimal Problems & Praise worthy
text: The hotel employees fell over backwards to help anytime of day or night. The location is superb, subway station just a half block down plus multiple restaurants within walking distance.  The room refrigerator is quite large (no freezer) so Trader Jo's is close by we grabbed some soda and snacks to enjoy in the room. The rooms IPAD  was great easy to use (for room service or other request) and the internet newspaper a plus! I read somewhere soda was free NOPE the only thing free was bottled water.  When you read they have a continental breakfast just know it will cost you $20.  The hotel needs to make the breakfast free and save money by having guest swim at their own risk. The teenage bored half asleep Life guards are not needed. We picked the hotel for the pool and to try the Turkish bath. The haaman? bath is broke and will not be in service for quite a while.  The balcony was worth any extra money beyond beautiful with views of both the empire state building and the Chrysler building.  We woke up each morning with new red bug bites but when asked to completely remove ALL bedding and replace with new, the morning welts no longer appeared.  The room was beautiful, the balcony beyond fabulous the employees wonderful and we Loved our stay!

title: A perfect hotel to stay
text: Great hotel, great location, great service. I would not hesitate to stay there again. I've stayed there twice. We were all happy and have suggested many friends and the ones who has stayed are more then happy. It's so clean :) The staff is more then perfect. And has a great location.

title: Wish We Had Discovered The Marmara Sooner!
text: Our daughter lives just around the corner from The Marmara and we have always stayed at brand name hotels when visiting her.  This time we decided that we wanted a different NYC hotel experience and discovered The Marmara.  Well, this lovely hotel is a gift to the city - the staff is an example of what every hotel should strive to be; the rooms are modern and clean (we asked for a back balcony room-loved it); the location is near the Empire State Building and easy walking distance to shows, dining and shopping; valet parking is available (not in and out but who wants to drive around Manhattan?); small dining room and bar (breakfast is available - not included with room - some confusion here as we were charged one day but not another); a truly excellent hotel experience!

title: Southern hospitality in the Big Apple
text: Mother/daughter weekend. Staff was accommodating and thoughtful.  Allowed us to check in early. Room impeccable.  Very clean. Easy walking to great restaurants and shopping. Just blocks away from  the Empire State Building. Will definitely be my new NYC hotel.

title: Wonderful stay!
text: Just back from a week stay in this amazing hotel, the room and facilities first class as where the staff.  Nothing was too much bother, rang for water and more teabags delivered within minutes.  Room had everything you need, fully equipped kitchen area with kettle, toaster and good size fridge a bonus. Our room had wonderful balcony and it was lovely to eat breakfast or enjoy glass wine in evening. Would definitely recommend.

title: Wonderful hotel for a family staycation!
text:
We've just returned from a wonderful staycation at The Marmara. 
The staff was attentive and very friendly. They were also helpful with directions and suggestions.
The room was spacious and, with a full sized kitchen, which came in handy since we traveled with a 5 y/o and almost 1 y/o. 
The only con to our room was that it had no bathtub which made it tricky to give my baby a bath but, we managed. The a/c was also a bit wonky but the maintenance team was on it and was able to resolve the issue during our stay. 
The pool was a great hit with our 5 y/o and it was empty every time we used it. 
Being local to NY and having worked in Manhattan, we knew we wanted to avoid all touristy areas but not be so out of the way to make it troublesome to reach some of the sights. 
The Marmara is centrally located yet in a relatively quiet part of the city. No throngs of tourists passing by (though there were a few people smoking off to the side of the hotel entrance which was not necessarily appealing) or incessant traffic noise. 
We loved staying at The Marmara and wished we could have extended our stay but I think we're started a family tradition and will surely be making our way there again, next year.

title: Nice clean boutique hotel
text: Stayed at this hotel for business. When I checked in a regular room was not available so I was upgraded to a suite. The room was huge for just one person. The bed was comfortable, however, the bathroom was small and there was no place to put my makeup bag so I ended up getting ready in the huge closet that was there. The shower door is a partial door so when you take a shower, the cool air from the bathroom goes into the shower. The pressure however in the shower was great. The biggest downfall for me was the air condition. I did set the air condition to be 66, however, it never seem to get cold in the room. I did advise the front desk manager upon checkout which they advised they would look into it.

title: Mixed feelings
text:
Stayed at Marmara for 4 nights in June with my family. Stay was mixes with some strong positives but also negatives. 

First, the rooms were nice and spacious (for NYC standards) fitted with a small kitchen, giving the room a serviced apartment feel. Great if you have little ones. The bathrooms were a touch small though. The room also had unobstructed views (again for NYC standards) and a great balcony.

Second, the area was relatively quiet, away from the throng of tourists. Also quite close  to decent restaurants/ bars, midtown etc. 

Third, the indoor pool was a great respite from the NYC summer heat.

Unfortunately the bad news. My wife lost her bracelet in the room. We had to chase up security to look into this matter. Security informed me they would contact me after checking the video tapes but we still have not heard back from them after leaving our email addresses. The hotel at least, could write an email acknowledging the issue.

Last, i did not try the food despite staying 4 nights. We just found lots of great places nearby serving brunch (sarabeths, le pain quotidien) and a couple of handy late night delis.

If you are going to stay here, ask for a higher level room with a balcony at the back of the building.

title: Hotel di lusso
text: Eleganza, professionalità, attenzione per il cliente. Ambienti curati minuziosamente, bellissima l'entrata e il profumo delizioso che si percepisce all'entrata nella hall. Le camere spaziose, molto pulite e dotate di tutti i servizi. Posizione comoda a pochi passi dalla metro, nel centro di Manhattan. Mi trovo ad esprimere un parere molto favorevole in quanto non ho trovato difetti se non l'aria condizionata veramente troppo forte ma a New York è così ovunque. Per fortuna si può spegnere. Consiglio vivamente questo hotel.

title: Romantic getaway to NYC
text:
Stayed here for a weekend on my very first trip to New York City and it was absolutely perfect! Interior decor was modern and beautiful. Our room was large with a king bed, kitchenette and stunning bathroom. It's a great location if you plan on touring the city, close the subway and walking distance to many major attractions.

Unfortunately the spa was closed at the time we visited but the pool was clean and well maintained. All the staff went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. Will definitely be back next time I'm in NYC.

title: Excellent and friendly hotel
text: Very impressed. I was in New York for the first time in a few years and stayed downtown for a couple of nights before I got to the Marmara. The first hotel reminded my why I didn't think much of New York - noisy, 'don't care' staff, tired room etc - so the Marmara was a revelation in comparison. The room was bright, clean and fresh. I received a lovely welcome at check in and all the staff were smiling when I spoke to them. Leaving though was an even better experience - I was able to freshen up for my flight in the spa and the staff helped me not just to get a cab but also figure out I had enough time for a quick drink before hand. Could not have been friendlier or more helpful. Will definitely stay here again - the hotel is very well located assuming you will be getting around Manhattan.

title: Pristine, Modern - Highly Recommend
text: High quality, great value.  I stayed in the one bedroom loft and was shocked at how nice it was.  The room was so spacious - think modern one bedroom apartment.  The price is unbeatable and definitely would stay here over the ultra-luxury hotels in the city (Ritz, Palace, etc).  I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who prefers posh room to uber-expensive restaurant and unnecessary lobby.

title: Páctico, muy bien situado y bien comunicado, pero no es un cinco estrellas
text: Inmejorablemte situado en 32 East, junto a Park Avenue en pleno Midtown, está a escasos cinco minutos andando del Empire State, del edificio Chrysler y de Grand Central Terminal y, lo mejor, a escasos 50 metros de una estacion del Subway. El hotel en si es correcto, pero de ninguna manera un cinco estrellas. La zona de recepcion es pequeña y ¿decorada? en un minimalismo tan extremo que parece sin decorar; las zonas comunes simplememte cumplen y las habitaciones son de dimensiones aceptables, pero no grandes. El escaso mobiliario es vulgar y de calidad mediana y el cuarto de baño, que tiene todo lo necesario pero carece, por ejemplo, de bañera,es tan pequeño que no es posible abrir la puerta de la ducha si hay alguien cepillandose los dientes ya que el portazo podría provocar que el imprudente se tragara el cepillo. Como compensacion, el servicio es impecable, amable eficiente y siempre dispuesto a ayudar. Eso si, el precio acorde con la media de Nueva York es mas elevado que en el Palace de Madrid y la cosa no tiene color. En España sería un cuatro estrellas justito.

title: Balcony, view, staff and location - fantastic.
text:
Our room on the 16th floor was great - it had a balcony with a couple of seats, the room had a kitchen so you felt as though you were in your pied-à-terre and the room was spacious and well appointed (big wardrobe, great bathroom, big TV, etc).  The view from the balcony was great - just a lovely view of buildings, people and the sky.  It was great to come back to at the end of the day.

Continental breakfast was included in our rate.  The breakfast was more than enough for a day of sightseeing and was of good quality, there was a good selection of fruit and pastries plus cereals.  If you want an American breakfast experience then there are plenty of diners in the area.

The staff were so helpful, so friendly and completely switched onto what guests need that they are a huge resource compared to your average hotel.

The hotel's location is about midway between the East Village and Central Park and towards the east of Manhattan.  East 33rd St Subway is 30 seconds from the hotel.  The area has a great feel to it - there are restaurants on Lexington Avenue and little India is further down Lexington Avenue (if you want to experience it).

title: Perfection!
text:
I visited this hotel for the first time over a year ago and have returned quite a few times since. My initial reaction to this hotel as being beautiful, spotlessly clean, filled with amenities and, most of all, wonderfully staffed, has never changed.
The wonderful aroma of the lobby, which I hope is never changed, introduces you to a completely different world. The beautifully appointed rooms, excellent food and efficient service completes the scene.
From my first experience with The Marmara Park Avenue until my latest today, Randy and Edwin have been especially outstanding. They are two of the greatest assets of this hotel!

title: This New York City Boutiqe Hotel Gets Everthing Right!
text: From the friendly check-in to the exceptional room and wonderful food at the restaurant, this new hotel was amazing. The room was spacious and included a beautiful kitchen equipped with everything I could possibly need. Incredible shower, extra large towels and a bathrobe. Comfortable bed, quiet room.

title: Chic, Romantic, and Relaxing
