text: I booked a wonderful king size room with a terrace on a sweltering heatwave of a day last summer and I found my little go-to oasis when I need an in-town re-set. I live 30 minutes away but this little gem (located conveniently 1 block away from a subway station) feels worlds away. Turkey to be exact. With the beautiful Turkish hammam and pool, stylish furnishings, and an air of "far away land", this was a delicious stay-cation. I can't wait to return now that I see they have a full menu serving breakfast and dinner. The hotel did not yet have dining services when I stayed - which was my only tif as I was hoping for some room service to top off my stay. Next time for sure!

title: A chic boutique hotel
text: The friendly service is outstanding. I left some things behind and Randy organised them to be shipped to my next hotel. No fuss. The rooms are small but well appointed. Strong shower, in-room iPad and fast wifi. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great hotel and great location
text:
I stayed here for two nights and the overall experience was great.

The room was upgraded upon arrival to an apartment loft from a studio and the space and amenities were great.

It had it all.

The staff is very helpful and when there was some confusion they compensated me immediately.

title: ótimo hotel
text: Quarto bem amplo com mini cozinha super completa, nem precisamos sair pro café da manhã, excelente espaço para as malas e varandinha com poltrona para fumantes. Cama um pouco macia demais (mas acho que todas são assim nos Estados Unidos). Serviço rápido e eficiente. Eles disponibilizam um tablet com wifi pra ver notícias e tudo mais. Excelente!

title: This is situated in a great area of NYC.
text: We could walk to Park Avenue.  Also close to the subway. We enjoyed this hotel, but two criticisms-Lobby scent is extremely strong, they need to back off on the fragrance and the amount they are using.  I could not enjoy their lobby and fireplace, as it affected my breathing (I have asthma).  Also the menu for room service is a little stale, and limited.  Seems like the hours for breakfast/room service etc, were not convenient.  Bar closed early.

title: Fantastic hotel, helpful staff, luxe decor.
text:
I had an unprecedented stay here three days ago due to the BA crisis. I would like to thank Victorio and the night porter ( I am so sorry I didn't ask your name) especially the night porter who went out of his way to get me a glass of wine. I would also like to thank Alexia who also went out of her way  to get me an upgrade. The rooms are extremely clean with a luxe decor and the beds are so comfortable you would not want to leave your room. 
Restaurant meals are Michelin star worthy.
Great location for the Meatpacking District and 5th Ave
My only negatives are on the first night I didn't have a room with a bar and I was given  quite a small room. Secondly I could hear the next door neighbours who were very loud but security quickly came up to ask them tone it down.
I would recommend this hotel to discerning travels like myself who like luxury and enjoy being waited on hand and foot. The hotel is pricey but you get what you pay for...an A++++ stellar service.

title: 5-star service, staff, room and facilities - Thank you for an amazing stay even for our toddler!
text:
I arrived with my toddler and was immediately greeted by wonderful staff and upgraded at no cost to room with a terrace and even kitchen facilities - perfect for a family! To accommodate us the staff also granted us a late checkout and did all to ensure I felt at ease even with my toddler who not feeling well. The room was impeccable, the staff was always available and service minded, the facilities were wonderful especially the beautiful pool and gym! 
Thank you for such a wonderful stay!! We will definitely come back again soon!!

title: Hôtel
text:
Accueil très chaleureux , Hotel Moderne, idéalement placé.
Excellent rapport qualité prix...
Je vous le conseil vivement 
Petit point demande une chambre avec vue sur la rue...
Parfaitement situé à côté du métro et d une grande avenue...
Propre, intime et parquet dans les chambres ce qui est rare à NYC

title: Для 5 звезд я ожидала большего
text: Отель находится недалеко от Эмпайр стейт билдинг. Номера не большие. И не очень чистые. Сервис на 4 балла оценила бы. В отеле есть маленький бар. В принципе до основных туристических достопримечательностей можно добраться пешком. В номерах не ставят воду в бутылочках комплиментарную. Что большая редкость для таких отелей. Персонал приветливый.

title: Loved it
text:
Where do I start such a lovely unique hotel , made to feel straight at home from arrival to departure nothing is to much bother .
Greeted every morning by the friendly receptionists and door men and in the evening such lovely warm friendly inviting people .
Bar staff great too ..rooms cosy and comfy done out nice . 
Hot water all the time good internet and close to everything .
Can't wait to return ... a little gem guys would recommend  highly .
Thanks to all at the marmara 
Rob & Christina

title: Bel hotel, très bien situé
text: Nous y avons séjourné durant 9 jours lors de notre séjour à New York. L' hôtel est très bien situé à mi distance entre Times Square et Broadway, tout proche d'une station de métro. Nous avons eu une chambre au 12° étage, chambre assez grande, très calme, malheureusement pas de vue sur la ville, juste la vue sur l'immeuble d'en face de l'autre côté de la rue. Ceux qui seront dans les derniers étages auront sûrement la chance d'avoir un balcon et donc accès à une vue plus intéressante. La piscine au sous sol est agréable après une journée de marche, même si l'eau mériterait d'être un peu plus chaude.

title: Superbe
text:
Nous y avons séjourné pendant 6 nuits pour nos un an de mariage et l'hôtel est vraiment top! En plein centre des activités, à trente seconde du métro. Le lit très confortable. Le seul bémol impossible de prendre des bains. Et l'eau chaude arrivé quand on tourne le robinet à fond, ce qui fait que nous avons un jet d'eau très fort tout au long.
Personnel très agréable, piscine très belle et propre. Nous pouvons même y faire à manger (nous pour le petit déjeuné ça nous arrangeait). Grande tv. Même une tablette pour mettre de la musique le matin. Apres une longue journée de marche le repos est primordial et il nous fallait un hôtel comme cela.
Super hôtel! 
Nous avions réservé via Voyageprivé.com

title: Very Nice Small Hotel
text: I spent a night at the Marmara on business.  Staff was friendly, room was very clean and nicely appointed although small (like most NY hotels).  Comfortable bed and quiet for NYC.  Bathroom was also small but adequate although the sink is poorly designed with no room for toiletries and so small that water ends up in places you don't want it!  Bar isn't much of a scene if that's what you are looking for.  All in all, very good with a couple of quirks.

title: Raffinato ed elegante
text: Un hotel molto ben posizionato, centrale ma fuori dal caos! Interni molto raffinati ed eleganti, le camere arredate con gusto e con un letto molto comodo! La presenza di una zona comfort con Nespresso e bollitore con filtri di the a disposizione senza ulteriori costi hanno coccolato i nostri momenti. Il personale molto accogliente e pronto a rispondere ad ogni nostra richiesta ci ha fatto sentire a casa.

title: Nice room but room/service needs a little work
text:
The good: the front desk/bellman service was very good. Friendly and helpful. The gym is open 24 hours. We had a two-bedroom suite with large living room and it had plenty of space. The master bath was pretty large. My wife liked the soaking tub.

The not so good: While the master bath was large, it was not laid out well. There was no room on the sink for any toiletries. The shower configuration meant the water was going to get every where. The toilet was not closed off from the rest of the bedroom. 

Needs work: The remote for the main TV did not work unless you stood two feet from the TV. We used the in-room iPad to notify maintenance but never heard anything. Upon arriving in the room, my wife found a razor blade on the master bath sink. Above the island in the kitchen needed to be dusted - cobwebs in the lights. The coffee was not replaced after the first day. 

I would have given 3.5 stars. If the room service and attention to detail gets fixed then it is a solid four stars.

title: Great Stay
text:
This was my first time staying at the Marmara. Very, very friendly staff - front desk, doormen, etc. Rooms are small (rather common for a New York hotel) but nicely appointed, bright, and clean. Bathroom again small, but fantastic shower. Sink area lacks space for necessities, but we worked around that. Huge towels!

Our first night the air conditioning quit working (actually never did work since checking in earlier that day). But the front desk had a maintenance guy at our room in less than 10 minutes and not more than five minutes later, he fixed the problem (battery in the wall control) and the room was cooling. 

The lobby bar is expensive, but very good. The bar staff excellent and very friendly. 

Will definitely stay at this property again.

title: Hidden gem
text:
I travel to NYC regularly. 
This place surpassed expectations. 
Friendly staff, a very comfortable room. 
The decor is classic yet updated. 
The rooms are quiet and the showers excellent. 
I would come back here.

title: Vacanza favolosa
text: Siamo appena stati in questo fantastico Hotel. Appena arrivati ci hanno fatto un Up grade in una camera favolosa,sembrava un mini appartamento. Abbiamo soggiornato per 5 notti. La zona era strategica x muoversi per New York. Lo consigliamo veramente. Servizio eccellente, staff super gentile. Pulizia eccezionale..passavano 2 volte al giorno. Inoltre l'hotel offre anche la possibilità di ordinare la colazione,pranzo,cena direttamente in camera..noi per 2 sere abbiamo preso la cena ed era davvero buona. Questo hotel vale le 5 stelle! La nostra terrazza aveva la vista sull'Empire State Building. Siamo stati super soddisfatti! Se torneremo a New York lo sceglieremo sicuramente ancora! Andateci e non vi pentirete! ;)

title: Beautiful, new, elegant
text: My husband and I had an opportunity to stay here for our 4th wedding anniversary. The hotel was beautiful, the staff was friendly, and the location was ideal for an uber ride right into Time Square. I would highly recommend this facility to anyone looking for an elegant modern and spacious room in the heart of the city.

title: business trip to new york 21-26 march
text:
When planning a trip to New York, I looked for the comments of hotels in New York. I was impressed a person has written on Marmara Park avenue hotel and I decided to stay there.  Overall the stay at Marmara park avenue was marvelous   considering the money I paid to the hotel... The people working at the reception, concierge were all wonderful and kind.  When I asked the location of Starbucks, subway station, department store , they not only explained but walkedout and show the direction.  

The room was so comfortable and after work when I came back to hotel,
I felt it is my home.  Washing machine/dryer were installed in the room(how nice it was for a long trip person like myself), full kitchenette and full size refrigerator and etc.....  Since big supermarket was  4-5 minutes walking distance, I even cooked by myself.....Bathroom amenities were of course perfect.

Subway station is just 1-2 minutes on foot from hotel and can go anyplace easily.this was the first time I took subways in New York.

Since I missed some Oriental food, in walking distance I could fine lots of
Korean restaurants.

The hotel was perfect and I already recommended to my colleagues and family
members.  If I go again to new York, definitely I will stay there....

Very warm experience to me

title: Amazing hidden gem
text: I was blown away by this property. All the beautiful details of the lobby (must get the Turkish puffs they have at the lobby bar!), the pool (hum, YES!) and the absolutely gorgeous views. The hotel is on the perfect location, and the facade is very unassuming which makes it even more special. I'm concerned once people find out about it I won't be able to afford staying there again!

title: Amazing hotel
text: I booked a room at the Marmara Park Avenue and when we checked was upgraded to a beaut suite. The room saw modern, spacious and very pleasing with a full kitchen with top of the line appliances, a nice size bedroom very nice bathroom with one large sink with two  faucets. The only down side was that the shower/bath only had a handheld shower with way to hook up the handheld shower. So it was extremely difficult to actually take a shower and forget washing your hair. On my way out the morning after we checked in,I mentioned this to the front desk. When we returned that night lo and behold, the management had installed a bar to hold the handheld shower. Now that is service!!! Great place. Will definitely stay here again. Thank you management. Great way to treat your guests.

title: Another Great Stay
text:
We stayed last year and I couldn't wait to come back. This time, however, it took us 26 hours to fly from Montreal to NY because of a blizzard. We missed our first night in New York and were totally wiped by the time we got there. The hotel was incredibly sympathetic and Ruchi, without saying anything, put us in an absolutely gorgeous 1-bed apartment. Wow. It really made up for the misery of the whole Air Canada thing. 

 Thanks to the whole staff who are wonderful and especially Ruchi.

title: A good surprie
text: For anyone that stays in NYC either on business or for his own pleasure, this hotel offers a very good service (very agreable staff), spacious rooms with a nice decoration and an excellent location. Murray hill is a good place to stay in the city, plenty of restaurants and a walking distance from Herold square and Midtown.

title: What a beautiful place
text: I spent only one night there... but i wish I could live there. It was amazing. Excellent design, very fast room service and great staff. I cannot fault it. The only problem is, if you are going there to see NY you may decide not to leave your room instead because it's so nice. WELL DONE to you at the Marmara Park Hotel. I am a frequent traveller for work and i do not say this often, but this hotel really deserves praise.

title: Gorgeous place
text: I loved it, absolutely stunning views from the room. Great decor. Very professional staff, concierge top level. This place is definitely going to satisfy even the most demanding customers. Rooms had kitchen area. Bathrooms were huge. Bed very cosy. Huge balcony. Swim pool warm and big. Location perfect for anything you want to do in manhattan and at the same time very tranquil. Loved it.

title: AMAZING HOTEL!!
text:
One more time to the Marmara and always so amazing. I love the atmosphere from the reception really modern and quiet. Rooms are superb , the only bad things will be the bathrooms, really small not enough lights and no one shelve to put our staff.... design have his limit.  
But the key from this hotel is his AMAZING staff !! Wow they always take care about all your demands and also go ahead.  Wow never saw a so good team ! Thank a lot one more time. I will be back soon!

title: Gorgeous hotel!
text: This is a very beautiful hotel and the rooms are amazing! Extremely helpful staff and the bartender, Amanda was extremely helpful to me as well in where to go in NYC! Wished I could have stayed longer.

title: Room 801, People!
text: We booked a three night stay and ended up in room 801. This room is like a NYC apartment! We loved it so much that one night we ordered in from an Italian near-by and the doorman escorted the delivery guy up.  801 has a kitchen, laundry in a closet!!!!, a living room, and bedroom, with all the usual amenities. The only downside to the room is that the bathroom had just one sink; the nemesis of a marriage, lol.  The lobby staff wasn't the friendliest bunch ever - meaning they didn't say hello or good bye each time they saw you, but they were nice if we approached them. Very trendy hotel and the gym was good too.  Location can't be beat as it's quiet enough on the weekend to forget that you're in the city but close enough to the trains too.  We would stay again.

title: Excellent hotel in midtown with chic vibe but quiet atmosphere
text: We had a lovely two night stay in this very upscale, quiet hotel on 32nd between Park and Lex.  The location was great for getting all around especially since the subway is on the corner. Staff was personable, helpful, and informative.  The room was immaculate and very tastefully furnished.  We took the large suite which is basically an oversized studio with a kitchenette and office corner.  The negatives are what I read in other reviews before booking--small things that really didn't matter.  The bathroom was a bit small with only one sink and not a lot of room to put toiletries.  For some reason , we were put in a handicap accessible bathroom and so the shower floor was part of the bathrooom and thus the water got on the floor in the bathroom.  Also, I would have preferred a small couch in the room instead of the two small, short chairs near the windows.  The kitchenette was a nice bonus with a table and two chairs, but we didn't really need it.  Next time, I will book the deluxe guest room and pay less for the space I really need. The bed was comfortable.  Great towels and robes.  The gym was more than adequate.  The lobby is gorgeous and very inviting with many sofas and tables and areas to gather and a really nice oversized gas fireplace.  This hotel is a wonderful option for people who like luxury but don't want to spend a complete fortune Uptown.

title: 4 star service good location
text:
The rooms at this hotel are big and comfortable. We had all the basics. The doormen are exceptional. The staff is lovely, sometimes a little disorganized, but helpful. They have a computer and printer in the lobby for quick convenience when you need a boarding pass or to print a work file. 

The bar seems to be empty most of the time, which is a shame since it's beautiful. 

But the area is central, clean and safe.  It's an easy commute to most of the city with just steps to the subway.

title: Good hotel and nice value (for NYC)
text:
Overall, this is a really nice hotel.  Not a 5 star, but clean, quiet, comfortable, and a great value.  This was my first visits, but it will be one of my top NYC choices (ant that's saying a lot because I've stayed at most of the top Manhattan hotels).  
Here's what I loved:  
1.  QUIET--I was on the street side on the 9th floor, but heard almost no street noise. 
2.  more space than many midtown hotels.
3.  my room actually had a small kitchenette with microwave, tea kettle, coffee pot, pots and pans! (I asked for an upgrade, and was in the King Deluxe room) 
4.    I got a 2 BR, 2 Bath room for my parents and sister who also came on the trip.  My sister is disabled and needs some help, and it was better than going with 2 rooms.  It was like an apartment--bigger than my sister's apartment in Brooklyn--and it allowed for my parents to have some much-needed R&R, while giving my sister her own quarters, with a shared dining/living room.  At $600 it wasn't cheap, but a similar suite would go for FAR more in most hotels, if they even had something like that.  
5. Wonderful, helpful, low-key, service-oriented unstuffy staff.
6.  I'm vegetarian and it was just a couple blocks away from inexpensive but fantastic vegetarian Indian, Israeli, and Korean restaurants.  (Ahh, NYC!)
7.  Beautiful lap pool, and a Turkish Hamman which unfortunately i did not have time to use.  

Things i didn't like:
1.  The AC/heat did not seem to really work.  My room was roasting (for me), about 75 degrees, and under a comforter you could really bake.  I set the thermostat to 67, but it took 24 hours (I kid you not) to get the temperature down to 70, and then another 12 hours to finally get to 69.5 and i could not get it any lower.  
2.  Not all rooms have tubs, so ask if you want one.  
3.  Some rooms of the same type are smaller so if you don't like your room, ask for another.

title: Lovely & Luxurious with a definite "cool" factor
text: I only stayed for one night and can't wait to return. Regarding location -- it's great. It is less than one block to the 6 subway -- easy to get anywhere. The staff is friendly and helpful -- the spacious lobby is airy, comfortable and cool -- with fireplaces and plenty of tables, chairs and seating. It feels like an upscale restaurant. My room was lovely -- hard wood floors, huge TV, modern amenities, luxury products in the bathroom and a big walk-in shower. They offer turn-down service and feature robes and slippers in the room. Would definitely stay here again. My room also had a convenient kitchenette -- with glasses, forks, knives, coffee, etc. They also have a gym, but I did not get the chance to see it.

title: Affordable Boutique Hotel in Convenient Midtown Location
text:
The Marmara is a nice, affordable, smallish, boutique hotel near mid town.  It is conveniently located near public transportation, there's a Citibike across the street and there's plenty of good local food.  

It is in a quiet location. If you are a light sleeper you will be disturbed by other guests room doors slamming near your room.  There's simply no way to quietly shut your room door. 

The are a wide variety of rooms: with and without balconies; wood floors only and carpeted floors; with stove tops and without; with and without bathtubs. It's a bit tricky to find the combination that works for you. Every room has a small fridge, microwave and coffee maker.   

The room I was in had a blackish stained wood floor. It was funky not elegant and a bit "cold" feeling.  The bathroom was small, no tub and no vanity to put down any toiletries.  The shower had a weird old fashioned shower head with no way to adjust the water flow or pattern so I was forced to get pummeled by water.  

The furnishings are functional but not elegant or comfortable.   There is no side chair in the room to relax in.  The bed is fine.  if you are used to staying in Courtyards or Hampton Inn this is an upgrade.  If you are used to Four Seasons, Peninsula or St Regis this is a significant downgrade.   A functional place to stay but certainly not a WOW.   

One last thing. I'm a vegetarian and there was nothing I could eat for breakfast not even oatmeal or cereal.  If you are vegan your toast.  Fortunately there are places nearby to grab breakfast which I did at 6:45 AM in the ice cold weather.

title: Weekend family trip
text:
Just visited this fabulous property and was very impressed with the overall attitudes of the employees who were pleasant and eager to accommodate our family!  This extended stay hotel offers all the accommodations of home and space for our family of four! 
The only negative was that the itinerary booking stated that our two bedroom suite indicated the suite had 2 king beds and 1 queen which turns out only had 2 king beds so they provided a rollaway free of charge.  My daughter was upset that she didn't have an actual bed 
 The location was perfect.....steps from the subway and within short walking distance to wonderful shopping and great restaurants!  We had a very great trip thanks to Marmara!

title: great stay
text: Myself and my friend stayed at the end of Nov, the décor of the hotel is amazing we were kindly upgraded to a room with a view of the empire state building which was amazing! We used the pool and the Turkish hammam twice both times we had it to ourselves. The staff are super friendly and helpful we chatted quite abit with the concierge staff which was nice. The location could be abit nearer to times square but it wasn't a major walk. We didn't eat in the hotel so cant comment on the food. Would recommend this hotel and would stay here again :)

title: Great Experience with The Marmara
text:
A bit of a hidden gem. Super friendly and helpful staff. Had a "suite" which was plenty of room to spread out and get work done. Has a small gym and pool and I learned on checkout that there is a Turkish bath downstairs. Planning to check that out on my next visit!

The location is relatively convenient to get to meetings in Times Square area without having to stay right in the thick of it. Some good little spots to eat close by too.

title: Great small personal hotel.... in the big city....
text: Usually stay in the LES area .. but changed it up and glad I did .... This is a smallish boutique style hotel... Friendly, clean and larger  than avg rooms ..... after 25 years in and out of NYC I have to say this is a little gem. I had a larger room with loads of space. The view was the only downside but the location room size and room amenities all made up for no view. Booked thru a third party booking site and get a really good rate in Nov 2016.... I would return to this property on other trip if the rate and larger rooms were available ...... The bar in the lobby was nice .... and the location is more business than nightlife but hey its NYC , just a subway taxi Uber and your set for whatever you want...... Check in was easy and friendly ..... only downside for me was the lack of a view only the side of another building and the newish location for me , as said earlier LES is where I usually go and am use to the avalanche of nightlife there ... little more quiet after 8pm at the Marmara..... but its NYC .

title: muy buen hotel
text:
El hotel esta muy bien, muy moderno y limpio.  La recepción y sus empleados amabilísimos aunque un poco inexperimentados.
La habitación super completa y muy cómoda, salvo que no tiene placard amplio.
El tamaño del baño increíblemente chico, no se entiende porque lo hicieron así.
Habia un problema con el tema de los amenities, no reponían ni el jabón, había que reclamar todos los días.

title: Just OK - not great
text:
Sadly this hotel was only OK not great - disappointing given the huge investment. I agree with the other post below it's a 4 star hotel at 5 star prices. These guys have a long way to go before they achieve the true 5 star New York City.

When we walked into our room we were very disappointed. Where was the view & terrace as advertised & requested? Gone to someone else obviously, despite the fact we'd booked our room way ahead of anyone else.

Then from non attentive door/bell men to cold robotic check in and reception staff (where we even stood lost and had to ask where the lifts were to get to our room) through to the hassle of having to actually request times daily for housekeeping (which didn't happen on requested time anyway) and needing to ask daily for what should have been automatic replacement of complimentary items (such as water and coffee), to awful leaking showers (no bath) in both bathrooms that flooded the bathroom floor no matter what you did - this was so not a seamless luxury five star hotel experience at all.

Sadly as I see so many other reviews raving about the staff our experience was so very different - we stayed 7 nights and no staff member made an effort to speak to us in a warm friendly conversational way even once, not even at check in.

We won't stay here again and I wouldn't recommend it. If you can pay five star prices then go uptown where you'll get the proper five star service. That's where we'll go next time.

title: Excellent all the way around.
text: Everything about this hotel is excellent. From the front desk to the room service. The rooms are beautiful I didn't feel like I was in the city. You could hear the fire trucks but not that loud you had to be listening to hear them other wise rooms are quiet. Beds super comfy too. We will definitely be back. A++++++

title: Excellent séjour
text: Hotel superbe. Très bon rapport qualité/prix car très bien situé dans Manhattan avec métro et location bicyclette juste en bas de l'hotel. Très belles chambres mais qui peuvent être mal insonorisées selon l'orientation, nous l'avons fait remarquer et tout de suite un chambre très calme en surclassement nous a été proposée : le rêve. Les softs drink du réfrigérateur sont offertes. Personnel très aimable et à l'écoute. Bref que du bonheur.

title: Very nice hotel!
text: It was very clean with a friendly staff and a beautiful lobby . It is close enough to walk to Times Square- about a 20 minute walk away. The hotel is in a safe area so you can walk back even late at night. Very enjoyable!

title: Birthday Surprise and Proposal
text:
I decided to take my girlfriend to New York as a surprise for her birthday, and I booked for us to stay at the Marmara Park Avenue. From the moment I booked it, right up until the point we left to come back home, the staff were absolutely incredible and the level of service was second to none! I had several dealings via email with the concierge team prior to our visit and they could not have been more helpful, offering advice and recommendations for things to do and places to eat during our stay.

When we arrived we were greeted by the friendly doorman, who helped us with our bags. The check in process was a breeze, and we were then shown to our room up on the 17th floor. The room was amazing with everything you could possibly need for a relaxing and enjoyable stay, and we also had our own private terrace which enjoyed views of both the Chrysler Building, and Empire State. Along with the facilities in the room we also took advantage of the pool and hammam which were an extremely welcome indulgence after a busy day of sightseeing. 

As well as taking my girlfriend out for a nice meal on her birthday, I also decided that I was going to propose to her, and I let the hotel staff in on my plans. We had a fantastic evening out in Manhattan, and upon our return to the hotel they had been in and decorated our room with rose petals, and left us a very nice complementary bottle of champagne! Nothing was too much trouble for the staff at the Marmara Park Avenue, and they went above and beyond to make our stay as special and memorable as possible.

I have been lucky enough to have stayed in some fantastic hotels around the world, but the Marmara Park Avenue has set the bar to whole new level. My fiancée and I will definitely be returning to New York at some point, and there is only one place that we will be staying. I could not recommend this hotel enough!!!!....

I'd just like to finish this review by saying a massive thank you to all of the staff at the Marmara Park Avenue who helped to make our stay so amazing! Thank you!

title: Excellent hotel
text: Too good place to stay, good room size in Manhattan New York , centrally located , Very near to Indian restaurants so good for all Indians, near to station n all near by walking distance , near by Sarabeth cafe good for American breakfast , not far from Times Square , Madison square etc over all worth hotel has a bar in lobby , gd Hammam spa n indoor pool

title: Muy lindo hotel
text:
Hermoso hotel. Cómoda la habitación y la limpieza ok también 
Muy buena ubicación. 
El personal muy cordial y hacían de todo para ayudarnos
Reservaciones, taxi, recomendaciones, etc, etc, etc
Volvería! Nos gustó mucho

title: Exceeded Expectations
text:
Our check in experience was wonderful, I wish I got the gentlemen's name because he was fantastic. We arrived early and there was a room ready and as soon as we stepped into the room we knew that we picked the right hotel for our stay. The amenities were perfect from the Nespresso machine to the mini bar and the inhouse iPad that welcomes you with your name. The bed was so comfortable and the room was huge! 

The only issue was that the bellman the first day wasn't present (12/17). However, on the day of our departure the bellman was there and was fantastic. I felt awful that I didn't have money to tip but I wasn't expecting there to be a bellman present.

title: Nice Hotel but not 5 stars
text: Stayed 3 nights recently. Was a little nervous after reading reviews but every location seems to get them so forged ahead. Good points; 1) Room and bathroom were both clean, well appointed and larger than most NYC hotel rooms. 2) Location was good, very close to subway line, restaurants, mid-town. 3) Staff friendly and 2 minor issues were fixed promptly   Not so good points; 1) Only given 2 bath towels. Not a catastrophe but expect better. 2) Doorman was not always present, unusual for high end hotel.   All in all would rate this as solid 4 star hotel and i would return.

title: Amazing stay
text:
This is one of those cases I was unsure of posting a review because I wanted to keep it from getting too popular.  These guys have done such a good job it deserves to be!

First staff, Randy and the entire crew we met there were top notch. Rooms were huge by New York City standards, very modern, and very well-kept.  Little things  like having sparkling water and soda in the fridge complimentary was a great touch!  

View from balcony in our room was amazing and oh yeah our daughter loved the pool downstairs.

title: Lovely Rooms: Wonderful Staff
text:
The Marmara Park Avenue is a warm, sleek, and thoughtfully designed property owned by a Turkish group with high end hotels in Turkey.  Our room was well-equipped and nicely laid-out.  What a relief to stay in a NYC hotel in which the door to the bathroom is not right next to one's pillow.
As we came and went, we were greeted by the friendly and knowledgeable staff.  Randy, who checked us in efficiently and with a smile, has the perfect personality for the hospitality industry—some smart hotelier ought to clone him!! 
When we go back, I'll definitely pack a bathing suit and some work-out clothes!

title: Stunning Sophisticated Luxury Escape in NYC
text: Phenomenal luxury hotel with outstanding service. First class design, tasteful, sophisticated. Massive, 1 bedroom loft with Washing Machine and Dryer discreetly hidden in the large luxury bathroom or separate closet. Supremely comfortable bed topped with lots of pillows, walk-in closet, lounge suite, private fully-equipped kitchen with a dishwasher, stainless steel appliances, free fast internet, and an iPad to control everything in the room. I actually stayed a second night because I didn't want to leave - that's how much I highly recommend!

title: Excellent stay
text: Currently sat waiting in the lobby to head back to airport but I don't want to leave! Had a lovely stay here. All staff were extremely friendly especially Spencer - he helped a lot with recommendations on where to go in the big city! Couldn't have asked for a better location; we walked everywhere! Highly recommend.

title: Chic Perfection in NYC
text: Perfect place to stay in NYC. The hotel is very chic and stylish yet still retains a warm friendly atmosphere! I was visiting with my family and we had two studio rooms booked. Both rooms were really clean and spacious by NYC standards. Rooms were cleaned daily, bed was so comfortable and the shower was great. The hotel staff were wonderful, very helpful at giving good recommendations, especially the concierge Victor, he advised us on some amazing restaurants during our stay. The location is very central so everywhere is walkable! Lots of places to eat nearby. The gym and pool are great, loved this place and so did my family. Would definitely stay here again!

title: Amazing experience
text:
Marmara is located conveniently three short blocks from 5th. Beautiful hotel - small and feels very personal. We were there three nights and found it to be comfortable and accommodating. The staff in entirety couldn't have been more eager to help. Small cafe with breakfast, beautiful bar, nice lobby for wine and lounging. The staff is perhaps what made this trip  Most notably Victor Hernandez assisted us with any whim or need. He offered great insight on shopping, dining, and local attractions. He is by far the best hotel employee we have ever encountered. 
Would stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Visited NY for 4 nights in Dec 16
text:
Enjoyed a fabulous 4 night break at this hotel with my wife & another couple.
We were all most impressed with the quality of the hotel, we had a superb room on floor 15, very clean and spacious.  Throughout, the hotel was very tidy and had a most attentive staff.
Great location, only 10mins from Empire State Building .
Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in NY for a visit !

title: European feel in mid-town
text: Stayed here midweek in early December for a business overnight with my wife tagging along for company at a related social event. Pricey, but what mid-town hotel isn't in December? Very nice and attentive staff.  Overall, the hotel had a very euro feel to it...reminded me of places I've stayed in Switzerland, etc. Our room was actually a small suite with bedroom separate from a large kitchen/dining/seating area. Furniture was on the stark versus comfy side of the scale, but perfectly suited to the overall feel. Bed was comfy and room was quiet. Would definitely go back.

title: Classy hotel with top-notch service
text:
We stayed 4 nights for a pre-Christmas sightseeing trip and this hotel ticks all the boxes! Great location central for shopping and just a short walk from Empire State Building, Times Square and Broadway Theatre Land. There is a subway station just a few yards from the front door which will get you quickly to all other areas of Manhattan.

The hotel itself is beautiful and the staff cannot do enough for you. Sorry I didn't catch all your names but special mention for John on the front desk who was so helpful, but every member of staff we encountered was superb! We were two couples and stayed in rooms 1404 and 1506, both huge with excellent facilities.

This was our first trip not just to NYC but to the USA and the Marmara and it's staff gave us a great first impression of the Big Apple. Book this hotel, you will not be disappointed!

title: Great hotel
text:
Great hotel - highly recommend
Friendly staff, always happy to assist.
Ideal location,this was a great base for us.
Quiet area 
Rooms good size
Only drawback is the shower - the shower curtain is very frustrating.

title: Attentive Staff
text:
I chose to stay in this hip hotel thinking that my daughter who studies in the USA might have missed her country and we could have found some local food that she would have missed. Unfortunately, we couldn't find anything special to Turkey ( local cheese, Turkish coffee, etc ) except for the bath.
On the other hand, the hotel with very modern decoration allured us both. The rooms were decorated with the same flair as the lobby.The rooms were very clean and big enough, especially in our second visit to the hotel, the room they gave us was wonderful with Empire States view and a kitchenette, but the very first room didn't even have a refrigirator and even requesting  bottled water  was hard since there was no room service after a certain hour.BUT, the staff was extremely friendly, helpful and attentive and they always found a solution if a problem occurs and this is a very rare thing you can get in a standart, big hotel.

title: 低调的精品酒店
text: 酒店非常低调，大堂很宽敞，纯白色的装修，房间的装修很现代，喜欢有瓷砖的浴室，洗浴用品选择也很精致，在纽约很少有酒店提供牙具。床很舒服。Marmara是土耳其的名字，负一楼的Gym边上有土耳其浴室，健身之后可以去冲澡休息一下。泳池也很棒。

title: Amazing hotel!
text: Absolutely gorgeous hotel. We had asked for a room with a good view and actually got upgraded to a room with a balcony over looking the Empire State Building! We also got room service and the food was amazing. We were made to feel welcome at all times, and the little quirks of this hotel made it so special.

title: Hip, Comfortable, Stylish
text: This is a very cool and stylish hotel in Murray Hill.  Staff are professional and attentive, lobby hip and low key, rooms good sized and very well appointed.  Most have a kitchenette.  My south facing room also had a balcony with a great view toward Union Square.  Bathroom small but nicely appointed, bed very comfortable.  They also have a nice long and narrow pool (heated, but cool enough to do light laps), non-descript workout room, but a treat: big turkish bath.  This is the type of hotel you could use for a romantic getaway or a very comfortable business stay.  Halfway between Grand Central and Madison Square -- not too much nightlife in the immediate vicinity, but easy to get to. Would definitely repeat.

title: Marmara Hotel - NYC - 40th Birthday trip for my wife
text: My wife and I stayed at the Marmara Hotel (32nd Street) for five nights in September 2016.  As our taxi arrived, we were greeted at the door and shown through to the concierge desk where Randy processed our check in.  He was extremely efficient and answered all of my questions with a great depth of knowledge. We went up to our room which was on one of the highest floors. The room was fantastic, very spacious and the bed was really comfortable.  I noticed we had a balcony so went outside to check it out.  The view of the Empire State Building was quite simply amazing.  I shouted for my wife to come out...   when she saw it she simply said "WOW".   I cannot stress on here how good this hotel is.  Book a room, see for yourself!  10/10.  Outstanding!

title: Fabulous stay
text: We have just returned from a 4 night stay in a deluxe suite with balcony and view of the Empire State Building.  We were there to celebrate by husbands 40th birthday, and loved everything about this hotel.  The room was beautiful, the bed very comfortable and the location was perfect for us; close enough to walk everywhere and with the added bonus of being just a few steps from a subway stop when our feet had had enough.  But best of all were the staff.  Everyone we encountered was extremely pleasant, courteous and professional.  We took our time trying to choose the right hotel and are so glad we ultimately chose this place because we felt that we received personal service rather than the anonymity of say a larger chain hotel.  The reception is as beautiful as it looks in the photographs and it smells divine.  We spent a very relaxing few hours in the Turkish bath and spa area which was a fabulous place to take a break from our sightseeing.  In fact we had the area to ourselves the entire time.  Be warned though, as other people have mentioned, the lighting is very low in the hotel and it is difficult for us ladies (or men!) to apply makeup with any degree of accuracy.  I even spent a frustrating 10 minutes one morning rummaging around half blind in the wardrobe trying to find my socks.  However this did not detract from our stay at all and the mood lighting certainly created a very relaxed and romantic environment.  This will definitely be our first choice of hotel should we be lucky enough to return to New York soon, and I would like to thank everyone at the Marmara for their contribution to making our stay so special.  Oh, and if anyone is visiting soon, make sure you stop at Penelopes for a bite to eat.  It is located just round the corner from the hotel and we had a very reasonably priced lunch there and the food was amazing.

title: Beautiful, comfortable, spacious
text: My husband and I stayed here for two nights and had a wonderful experience.  Staff was extremely pleasant.  Facility immaculate.  Bed very comfortable and linens luxurious.  No iron in room and bathroom is small but definitely worth these small sacrifices and we will stay here again.

title: Fabuleux
text:
Idéalement situé en plein milieu de Manhattan, l'hôtel se compose de jolies chambres ou si vous avez de la chance de deux pièces avec cuisine intégrée. Le service est au top, le personnel d'une gentillesse incroyable.
La piscine et le bain turc après une longue journée de marche est un plus indéniable. Nous y retournerons sans hésitation...

title: Magique !
text:
Nous avons passé 6 nuits de rêve dans cet hotel. L'emplacement est parfait. Sur Park avenue au niveau de la 32 eme rue on peut facilement rayonner dans Manhattan. En bas de l'hôtel se trouve une station de métro avec la ligne 6 : ultra pratique. Le personnel etait trés, tres sympathique , aux petits soins et souriants. Le hall de l hotel est magnifique , cosy et les cocktails que nous avons dégusté au bar étaient delicieux. Enfin,la chambre etait parfaite : spacieuse, lumineuse  , literie tres confortable , grand balcon en enfilade avec une vue sur les toits de Manhattan. 
Je recommande vivement cet hotel. Nous y reviendrons !!!

title: An excellent find
text:
Our hotel requirements have changed in recent times given the addition of two little members to our family. Nowadays we look for space and room facilities along with the other amenities a hotel provides and a good location. Obviously this can prove to be a difficult combination to find. However this hotel has it all from our point of view. 

We stayed in a one bedroom loft. It was bright, spacious and impeccably clean. The main bedroom boasted a very large, comfortable bed with good quality linen. There was also a fold out bed in the living room which was almost as comfortable and big, very unexpected! From a facility point of view the room offered a hob, oven, microwave, large fridge freezer, washing machine and drier. The quality of the bathroom products were of a very high standard and the towels were fresh and fluffy. 
Slight negatives were that the bathroom was on the small side and lacked appropriate storage. Also room service is only available up to 9.30pm. However these were only minor given the other positives. The room also had ample storage space for clothes and luggage and from a location point of view the hotel was within walking distance from a lot of shops and restaurants including Herald and Time square, the Empire State Building and 5th Avenue. It also has a spa, pool and wellness center, which unfortunately we didn't get to use but maybe next time!

title: Great weekend getaway
text:
Was in the city for taking family to see Blue Man Group and just for a short get away.
The hotel is very well appointed and beautiful. One of the few hotels in Manhattan with an indoor pool which came in handy the second day since it was raining, it gave the kids something to do for a while. Also there is a Turkish bath and spa on premise.
The staff were extremely nice and professional. The location was perfect with a parking garage right next door which they will valet for you, and with a subway station right on the corner, perfect for getting around town.

title: First time to New York
text: The Marmara Park Ave is in a great location to all sites. Walking distance to the Empire State Building and Grand Central Terminal. Our room was large and clean and very well furnished. The ASSET to the hotel is the doorman Victor Fernandez. Always greeted with a smile and showed genuine attention to how our day went or what we had planned for the day. We were very well informed in seeing New York rather than the commercial New York. If you haven't met Victor make it a must to introduce yourself.

title: Wow
text: Superbe hôtel. Accueil et personnel parfait. Des prestations au top. Le seul defaut serais là taille des chambres un peut petites... mais bon pour un emplacement comme celui ci a manhattan et relativement prêt de tout ...

title: No regrets staying at Mamara Park Ave
text:
We decided to check out this hotel in person before making the booking, since it's relatively new and we were unsure if it would be to our liking. Upon first impressions, the hotel lobby is modern, well-decorated and smells nice. We eventually settled for a Studio Suite, and it was the best stay we ever had in NYC!

The service and attention to details were immaculate. Our request for a view of the Empire State Building was granted and it was just so nice waking up to such an awesome view daily. Everywhere else -- the subway; MoMa; Broadway is close to Mamara. 

What won us over was also the staff's warm hospitality, especially Linda (Grant), John (Situ), Victor and so many others. This would be THE place to stay when I visit NYC again.

title: Perfect location with great staff
text: Everyone here has been so helpful to myself, wife and our baby.  The location is great.  The hotel is clean. The pool and gym facility are well kept and work great. All and all we are very pleased with our stay.

title: Nice, clean hotel, good location close to everything but also quite for NYc
text:
I would say that this hotel is great. Location is really nice, away from all the noice but still walking distance to alot of places if your not afraid of a 10-20 min walk. Metro just around the corner. Also fairly alot of places to eat, both breakfast and restaurants for dinner.

Nice gym. The pool might be narrow but still pretty good for doing laps, almost always had it to ourselves. This was really nice after a long day walking around the city.

However, I'm not sure if I would call this a typical 5-star hotel. I must admit that it's my first stay in a 5-star hotel in NYC, so I can only compare to other cities and countries. 

The first room we were given was way smaller then the one we booked and was lacking basic things, like a minibar/fridge. That for me is really strange if you want to call yourselves a 5-star hotel. The size of the room overall was super small. I've been to 3-4 stars hotels in HK with larger rooms. And Hong Kong does not have abundant of space. We went down to the reception right away where we got a new room which fit our booking. But first we had to show our booking and really emphasize the first given room didn't fit neither the size, nor having coffee machine or minibar. It was a good thing they had an avalible room for our 10 day stay. For the amount we paid the first room was serious worthless. Bathrooms were tiny in both rooms, only bad thing about the second room.

Overall a really nice hotel. Just make sure you don't get their smallest rooms which don't even have a fridge.

title: very good standard hotel
text:
I have stayed 3 days in this hotel and i had overall a nice stay. The rooms are high standard while the natural light is missing a bit
This is very centrally located and the hotel fittings are very good
The service is stunning with professional conciergerie and agents

title: Awesome boutique hotel
text: Marmara Park Avenue was a delight. It was a respite from the busy streets of New York. Not a 5 star hotel, but a solid 4. From the tranquil lobby, to the amazing views from our coveted balcony. Delicious and unique cocktails at the lobby bar from Christopher the bar tender who was very attentive. Victor the bellman was especially welcoming and informative. I definitely recommend this hotel to the discerning traveler.

title: Sleek Luxury Boutique Hotel
text:
From the moment you arrive, the pulse of this hotel is classy, jazzy, sleek. The lobby strikes you as unique. The check-in stands are two and without one angle; all curves. Everyone greets you with a comment and smile. John, admitting us, was superb, efficient, friendly, helpful. He even worked through a technical glitch with ease, apologizing for something beyond his control, working the room assignment issue perfectly. 

Our room, upgraded as a kind gesture for our milestone anniversary, was a 17th floor one room suite. The room was stunning. Beautiful 2 chair balcony overlooking 32nd street, many near-foor to ceiling windows, lots of light. A small, but well thought out kitchenette with small fridge (stocked with on the house soft drinks and hard), microwave,
pod coffee machine, and silverware, china, etc. Comfy bathrobes. A small, but efficient bathroom, stall rain shower head, and high count Egyptian linens on a comfortable king bed. The sitting area and the bedroom both had Samsung 55" tv's. 

It is a boutique hotel. Not a lot more. Cool bar and lounge area. The bottom floor is a lap pool, hamam (warm tile room, nicely decorated, with high humidity), and locker rooms and spa. Equipped well with bathrobes and towels. 

The hotel exudes comfort, quality, and friendliness. A rare mix. 

Highly recommended.

title: Great place to stay!!!!
text: We were travelling to New York for our 20th wedding anniversary, and wanted to stay somewhere special - and this was the place. From the initial booking direct, and then subsequent calls before our visit we found the staff to be friendly and efficient. They kindly arranged for flowers, champagne and chocolates to be in the room on arrival, and although could not guarantee in advance our request for a room with a balcony - they were able to accommodate this as well. We had a deluxe room with a balcony, which included a small kitchenette area. The bathroom was very nice, but as mentioned by others this was the only place with mirrors and the hairdryer socket, which caused problems if we both wanted to use the bathroom. The separation of the bedroom area within the room was nice, and the living area was well set out. Both had massive flat screen TVs. The balcony was 'heaven' a treat to have outside space in the city to enjoy breakfast or a complementary soda. The duel views of the Empire State Building and the Chrysler Building was special. The location of the hotel was good for those who want to be away from the hustle and bustle of Times Square, but close enough to all the major midtown attractions. Also a subway station is on the corner of the street, which will take you downtown. The staff at The Marmara were so friendly and helpful, and attended to any issue immediately - including arranging a car to the airport. A special thanks to Randy for all his assistance, and thanks again to the rest of the team - we will definitely be back on our next visit to New York. We would highly recommend this hotel, as coming back at the end each day we felt so welcomed from the smell of their signature scent as you approached the hotel to the friendly smiling faces of the reception team.

title: Simply the best - an excellent find
text:
With everything done with such excellence, my stay was memorable and I would highly recommend The Marmara Park Avenue. The room was a very good size (though the bathroom was quite small), very clean and very well stocked. I had a fully stocked fridge which was replenished daily - very unexpected and delightful.

Every single staff member I met was extremely helpful and a delight.

Having tried other hotels in New York City, this was by far the best in terms of the room, experience and location. I will hopefully be back soon!

title: Das Böse kommt zum Schluss!
text:
Bis auf zwei Punkte, war alles Super!
Der Check-In, ein Reinfall! Weder ein "You 're welcome, ein paar Worte über das Hotel, noch hat uns die Dame gesagt in welchem Stockwerk sich unser Zimmer befindet!" Darüber waren wir sehr enttäuscht.
Zimmer sauber, Empfangshalle und Rezeption sehr beeindruckend, Hotelpagen und sämtliches Personal sehr höflich und zuvorkommend, großes Kompliment!
Zimmer an sich groß und geräumig, Badezimmer sind sehr klein. Einen Spiegel im Zimmer haben wir vermisst, genug Platz war jedenfalls vorhanden. 
Der Schrecken kam zum Schluss!!! Die Hotelrechnung!
Wir hatten dem Hotel jetzt eine Woche Zeit zum Antworten gegeben! 
Wir haben beim Check-Out für 2 Cappuccino (Hotelbar) und 2 Packungen Nüsse (Minibar) bezahlt und unterschrieben (knapp 55$). Jetzt wurde meine Kreditkarte mit 112 $ belastet, auf die Frage ob ich eine detaillierte Rechnung haben könnte, habe ich bislang keine Antwort erhalten!

title: Hotel easily 5 stars, staff 6*
text: As a guide I would give most of the staff at this hotel 6 full stars if I could. Challenges with housekeeping were swiftly resolved in almost every case, mitigated by some pleasant surprises in the room like fresh lemon slices to accompany the complimentary bottled water and free soft drinks, and a regular turn-down service. This is a new hotel situated in the Gramercy area of Midtown, close enough to get to most places of tourist and business interest within minutes, the 6 subway is outside the door, the Empire State Building nearby and a host of eateries like our favourite called 'Bread and Butter', with a super-duper breakfast and buffet. You also get up to 8 complimentary soft drinks and water per day would satisfy kids and adults alike. I'm a solo parent and businesswoman on vacation with an active 11-year old & we both had access to a clean and quiet pool with a lifeguard till 10pm and a marble hammam steamroom, great after a day pounding the hot Manhattan sidewalk. From night manager Lucien entertaining us with his best adaptation of an Englishman, and others: Spencer, who is a dab hand on the subway network like Edwin, Jamal, Ruchi, Randy, Angie in the spa, the day and night staff too many to mention:-) thank you! Would recommend teapots in the small breakfast room, chocolate truffles with the regular turn-down service in the evenings and a daily or weekly manager's cocktail reception, why not? It is after all New York, one of the most energising cities in the world. From Miss T in Room 808.

title: First time NY Visit.
text: I booked the Marmara Park Ave direct as i wanted to secure a room with a balcony which seemed hard to find in NY, this was achieved by the early direct booking and was well worth the for the view alone of the empire stste building which was a nice surprise, the hotel is very close to the subway 200m which made all of our travel around NY very simple. the location is fantastic away from the hustle & bustle of Times square and we felt very sfae at all times of the day walking around. the inroom i-pad is handy if you require anything in regards to the hotel by requesting through this method, we never had any issues with the staff and were always greeted coming and going from the premisis, thr room was very clean and always tidied & refreshed daily upon our return. we only had an issue with one door blind but in the scheme of things it didn't in anyway detract from our stay. I wouldnt hesitate to stop here again it is pretty central in Manhattan, greta area and close to the transport as already stated. Thanks for the staff see you next time.

title: Look no further…..
text:
We were looking for a weekend get away before the kids went back to school and wanted to try a new location and boy, are we happy we found this hotel! It is in a great location,very clean, sleek and inviting. 
In terms of customer service, everyone was extremely help. Joel, in particular, was outstanding and we give him huge kudos for providing service that made an awesome impression. The entire staff was pleasant and helpful and the room was simply stunning. The beds were extremely comfortable and the noise level very low. The turkish bath was a great experience after a long day of walking and the fitness center and pool were equally as great!
This will be, without a doubt, our go to place in NYC from now on.

title: Stylish and conveniently situated
text:
I was a bit wary of booking this hotel given the somewhat mixed reviews.  However, I did not experience any of the issues some other guests have highlighted.  Other than the layout of the bathroom (none of which seem to have been well designed.  I was lucky enough to have a sort of stand thing which allowed me somewhere for toiletries but it wasn't ideal.

Everything else was great.  The room was spacious and the bed very comfortable.  Lucien the night manager was extremely helpful upon my arrival and departure and special thanks to Edwin on the concierge team who gave us some great restaurant and bar recommendations.  All of the staff I encountered were very friendly and helpful.

I was a bit irritated that the housekeeping staff would leave all the lights on in my room even though I switched them off - not a big deal but not necessary.  I mentioned it to one of the team and the lights were then left off for a couple of days.

I used the reasonably well equipped gym and pool.  The Hamman looked great but wasn't particularly hot when we used it.

This is a nice hotel and well located - maybe just needs to up its game a little to be really top class.

title: The worst service in New York
text: FAKE friendly service. The staff was friendly until there was a problem. When I checked in, I was not informed that I could choose a room with a murphy bed or with a regular bed. I was assigned a murphy bed which was incredibly hard and uncomfortable--it and gave me a horrible backache. I mentioned this situation when I checked out and was told that, next time, I should ask for a queen bed! Then, as I left in a cab for the airport, I closed the door before giving the two hotel workers their tip for retrieving my luggage and loading it into the cab (I was harried as I was running late). I then remembered their tip and called them back to give them $20. The cab driver reported that the two had started to curse me when they thought I wasn't going to tip them. Totally unacceptable and unprofessional behavior.

title: Great!
text: The staff is friendly and attentive. The bar was fun. We stayed in a suite which was very nice and spacious. The room had a patio as well which was great for drinking coffee/tea in the mornings. I would highly recommend this area. It was also pretty quiet at night, which is hard to find in NYC.

title: The best service in New York
text: GENUINELY friendly service. What a refreshing change for New York. Beautiful decor, fantastic location, well equipped fitness centre, and a fairly good breakfast spread. My only recommendation would be to remove any and all shower curtains in the hotel. I will definitely stay here again, and I'm looking forward to it.

title: 4.5 Stars
text: This was my second visit.  This hotel is only about a year old and has rooms that are very large by Manhattan standards - particularly at this price point.  The bed, linens, and furnishings are stylish and comfortable and the rooms have a coffee maker and fridge.  Great shower in a smallish bathroom. As others have also mentioned, they do need to add a shelf in the bathrooms since there is absolutely no where to put your things.  I put my toiletries bag in the sink and moved it to the toilet seat when I needed to use the sink. Overall, it is a good find and I would definitely stay there again.

title: Hard to give up the secret
text:
This place is a gem! I was reluctant to post because I don't want to have a hard time booking here, but I don't visit New York often enough to keep this place a float by myself.

I first visited with my family for A quick stop in New York. He loved it so much, that we booked another night at the tail end of our trip.

We were a group of four: mom, dad, toddler, & grandma. We hoped to find a reasonable place with at least one closing door. Instead, we got a TWO BEDROOM suite for a fraction of the cost at any other hotel. It was a fully functional apartment with fine hotel amenities. 

The rooms are very generous, by New York standards. Some even have balconies! Be sure to check out the pool and the Hamam downstairs. Just be careful of slippery floors.

title: Be careful how you book this hotel. Terrible experience
text:
I had a terrible experience during one of my stays and I wanted to submit a review. 

I stayed at the Marmara Hotel in NYC in June of this year.

It is a luxury hotel and I wanted to try it, so when I saw it on hotel tonight I jumped at the chance.

Hotel tonight customers should know that when you book through the app for the discounted rate, the Marmara does not put in you a standard room. They put you in the smallest room they have, therefore you do not get the "real"
experience of the hotel.

The first room they provided me was one of the smallest I have ever stayed in. Granted, I was not paying the full rate but still paying about $300.
The room did not even have a permanent bed, it was a Murphy bed that came down from the wall with a thin mattress on a metal frame, terrible.

I complained and they moved me to a slightly larger room that had a real bed. However, I don't know who designed this room, however there was no phone by the bed, no clock, nor any outlets. I had to unplug a light to charge my phone. Then I went out to dinner and when I came back the AC could not cool the room below 73 degrees. Again, I called the front desk, they sent up someone to look at it, and they could not fix it...they again offered to move me to another room, however it was 11pm I was unpacked and in no mood to move again.

On a positive note, when I checked out Randy was sincere with his apology and made a note, should I ever return again (which I will not, even at a discounted rate)which is a shame, as I really wanted to experience the hotel. Also, in addition to Randy, kudos to the door man John.

I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Thank you.

Kind regards,
Glenn Colarossi

title: Did not feel welcome
text: its a really nice hotel, beautiful rooms and great standard. The two doormen where also really nice, and always made you feel welcome. The problem was the people working the front desk. They seemed more interested in talking to each other, than in helping us. They also charged us for a beer from the minibar, even though we where 100 % certain that we did not take any beer. We also told the girl at the front desk this, but she didn't believe us. I think this is highly unprofessional from such a nice hotel, and it made us walk away with a really bad feeling.

title: Hotel was amazing
text: What a gem we found when we booked this hotel.  Call them directly to book the best rate.  From the 1st phone call months before the trip to when we checked out, staff was super helpful and courteous.   Our teenagers loved the balcony, the free sodas and water, the pool.  Location was great.  Beautiful rooms.  One small complaint(and it's a silly one). There weren't enough mirrors.  Only one in the restroom and if someone was showering it was hard to do hair and makeup, ha!  But overall an excellent hotel!  Thanks for the stay!

title: A sanctuary in midtown with fabulous views
text:
Travelled on business and this hotel was sublime. All the staff went well out of their way special mention to Edwin one of the porters just amazing service so friendly and genuinely cared  - great big smile and lovely attitude.
Every single little detail was excellent and I would stay there everytime I visit NYC on business. Perfect ! Beautiful, low key, attention to detail astounding, great for solo traveller. Was given room with view of Chrysler and Empire!

title: Most comfortable stay!
text:
We stayed in 3 different hotels in New York & Marmara Park Avenue was our favourite by far. NYC is a busy high energy city so after a full day of sightseeing all you want is to relax & Marmara Park made sure of that.

We were shocked by how spacious the room was especially after staying at the Ludlow. There was a walk in wardrobe, large balcony & a separate kitchen top/dining area. They provided a microwave, toaster, full set of cutlery, plates, bowls & cups. All the other hotels we stayed in did not provide water but here they provided complimentary still & sparkling water plus other flavoured tonics & Coke too!

The bed was super comfy & for once we didn't have to call reception to request foam pillows! The bathroom not only looked stylish but was actually practical. They were also super generous with toiletries, providing & replenishing everything daily. The other NYC hotels we stayed in didn't provide toothbrush or slippers but Marmara Park did!

Now onto their best selling point - the Turkish Bath! Free access for all guests open 6-10pm. This was like a private spa. We would go to the gym, then a swim in their pool & finish off at the Hammam in the morning before enjoying breakfast in the comforts of our own room. After a long day out we would go for another relaxation session at the Hammam before bed. 

Its location may not be as desirable as other hotels but the train station was literally a hop, skip & jump away. We had no trouble taking just a few stops to all the places we wanted to go. It was also very convenient for us upon check out to walk to Penn Station to catch our train to Boston.

Thank you Marmara Park for an unforgettable stay! We'll be staying with you again!

title: A very good hotel in Midtown
text: I had booked online and didnt really know what to expect beyond the reviews on this site and the few photos. The best part: we got an upgrade to a suite. I had booked a deluxe room but when we arrived after a 14 hour flight the hotel graciously upgraded us. I can safely say that the upgrade really enhanced the quality of our stay at the hotel. The bed was super comfortable and the bathroom was large and lovely. we had an amazing stay. The staff was extremely helpful and polite.would stay here again.

title: Excellent Service, Great Hotel
text:
We took my daughter and her friend to NYC for her Sweet 16 birthday celebration, we stayed in the one bedroom loft w/murphy bed 765 sq.ft. The room was spacious and very clean. The room had a full kitchen, washer/dryer, 2 flat screen TV's, comfortable living and dining area. The amenities were fabulous. The pool was beautiful, perfect temperature. The 24 hour gym great. Be sure to unwind in the Turkish Hamam -very relaxing. Experience Shower - near the Hamam you can create your own shower experience.

The staff is amazing. We were welcomed in by Victor, who was very knowledgeable of the city, he offered us many ideas and was a absolute pleasure to deal with. The concierge, Ms. Ruchi Sura was very thoughtful she had sent a personalized note to my daughter wishing her a Happy Birthday along with cheese/cracker platter. We were upgraded to a larger loft room to accommodate our group. The staff was very easy to deal with.

I hope the management sees this review and acknowledges their team. Our stay was made extra special because of them.  The location is great too, on a side street. Great shopping and restaurants. Would highly recommend.

title: Flawed Jewel of a Hotel
text: I've stayed at the Marmara twice on business, both times with an associate in a two-bedroom suite. The staff are warm, welcoming, professional. The decor is stylish, all the finishes are high end. They're maybe a little too fond of black—the lobby restrooms are almost invisible because everything's black and the lighting is minimal. But it's really the odd configurations of the rooms and bathrooms that flaw this otherwise wonderful jewel in Manhattan. Example: the larger bedroom/bath in a suite is great, lots of room and closets. But the smaller one had no lamps, closets in the hallway by the front door, and a ridiculous bathroom. It had a bath/shower combo with a deep soaking tub and a rainshower head. It was a hazard to step in and out of—but the flaw was that the shower head and the tub faucet both stuck out the same length from the wall! So you had to straddle the faucet to get under the shower stream. It also had a small, narrow trough-style sink with another long faucet that guaranteed that you'd splash water all over the floor when washing your hands. It also had an amber art glass lamp over the sink that threw low amber light down, so you couldn't see to put on makeup in the mirror. The large bathroom also had lots of recessed lighting in the ceiling, none of which illuminated the sinks/vanity/mirror area so you could apply makeup or shave. The kicker was the shower's hot water system. In both showers, you had a range of Scalding Hot to Boil You Alive—my associate, in the smaller bathroom, had to turn on the bath faucets to regulate the temperature and get a little cold water into the mix. My tub was separate, so that wasn't a workable option for me, I ended up not being able to take a shower. They also have almost zero towel racks and one tiny stubby hook for hanging a robe or nightgown on while bathing. There were slightly different but still un-ergonomic issues with the first suite's bathrooms that I stayed in. It made you wonder if the designer ever tried using the facilities! The kitchen in the suite was all high-end stainless steel appliances and great flatware, glasses, etc.—but really, who is going to use a rotisserie in a hotel room? Also a full size washer/dryer. This would be great if this was a residence type hotel, but I found it odd to have those kinds of accommodations (the kitchen was almost bigger than my home kitchen!) and yet squeeze out a tiny bathroom and bedroom that are sub-par in amenities. I'd rather they had a hotel kitchen and room service and maybe a modest kitchenette in the suite. Breakfast, FYI, is not included in the price, and is continental in the lobby area. So, I don't know what to think about the Marmara Park Avenue. The beds were comfy (although I hate the hotel trend of giving you just a heavy duvet (no sheet) to sleep under so you can't regulate the weight of the covers you use), the view is great, the location's very good. Service is super. But I don't think I can ask my biz partner to stay in the smaller room of a suite there ever again. And someone needs to deal with those showers!

title: Good Hotel...But Not 5 Star
text: The Marmara Park Ave is a good hotel, not great. The decor is stunning, it's clean, and the rooms are generous in size for NY. That being said, it is not a 5 star hotel. It has all the elements of a 5 star hotel: concierge, spa, bar/lounge, luxury decor, etc. But something is a little off with every amenity. For example, while the concierge contacted us before check in to make restaurant reservations, they were unable to locate and confirm the reservations upon our arrival. Additionally, friends sent us a bottle of champagne to the room and rather than include the note our friends provided, the concierge simply told us it was compliments of the front desk. Our friends credit card receipt proved otherwise. Given all the choices in New York, I would not stay here again.

title: Hidden Gem in Manhattan
text:
This hotel is perfectly located on 32nd Street, near the intersection of Park Ave.  There is a subway station right outside the hotel on the corner of 32nd and Park and it will take you uptown to almost anywhere you need to go.  The hotel room we booked was a two bedroom suite and it could not have been nicer or cleaner.  The rooms are some of the best I have seen anywhere in NYC for this price and you will spend a lot more to get anywhere close to the accommodations and amenities this hotel offers. 

Checking in was a breeze, no wait. I was literally in my room with in just a couple minutes.   Waiting in my room on the wet bar was hand written welcoming note from the management and a complimentary bottle of wine.  The views out on the terrace are just incredible.  The hotel has a pool downstairs in the cellar, which is rare for midtown Manhattan.  We did not get a chance to use the pool or the turkish bath but both were very clean and very nice.  

Staff was very helpful in getting any tours or sightseeing options that were available.  I would definitely recommend staying here to anybody that is looking for a quiet hotel that is slightly off the beaten path, but still very close to all the action.  You cannot beat the staff or the price for what you get.  I will definitely stay here again.

title: Best hotel I've stayed at in NYC
text: Beyond 5-Star service and staff. Rooms are spacious, intelligently designed and comfortable. Turkish sauna and pool in the so-called "Cellar" - incredible. Love the location, within a mile of just about everything. Will definitely be back.

title: Can it be more amazing?
text:
This is an absolutely amazing hotel. The staff seems genuinely interested in assisting and informing us of whatever comes to mind. The rooms are nice and spacy and I love the free sodas and water in the minibar. We had a balcony room and enjoyed the wonderful view of the Empire State Building. We sneaked up on the roof to enjoy the view of the Chrysler Building.
I love the downstairs spa and pool but had too little time there. Next time I promise I will stay longer. Time just flies by when staying at the Marmara Park Avenue.

The only part not great is the area surrounding the hotel. It's not bad, but it just seems.... random. Park Avenue sounds great but it's just a regular street.

title: Excellent rapport qualité prix pour NY
text: Un personnel très pro et très arrangeant notamment pour un choix de chambre en étage haut pour + de calme et avec balcon pour les fumeurs. Une Chambre 1208 avec un beau volume et un grand balcon donnant sur l'arrière sans vis a vis et avec un peu d'horizon, si rare à Manhattan. Un lit queen size confortable, mais attention à la clim dont on ne peut régler l'intensité de la fonction ventilo et un réel problème également pour le réglage de l'intensité de la douche, car s'il on veut de l'eau chaude, l'on aura obligatoirement un très fort débit qui inonde très vite la douche à l'italienne, transformant la salle de bain (trop petite pour la taille de la chambre) en piscine. Outre ces petits soucis, le Marmara Park Avenue reste un excellent rapport qualité/prix pour Manhattan (ayant profité d'une promo sur venere.com à 300 € TTC la nuit au lieu de 450 €) au vu de son standing et de son emplacement à 50 m de la station 33 rd Street; sans oublier sa belle piscine intérieure en sous sol, chauffée, de 20 m de long, fort agréable après d'exténuantes journées de visites dans Big Apple.

title: First trip to NYC
text: Great hotel the staff is very friendly. Complimentary umbrellas when it rains. Bed very comfy. The only problem we had was the shower was weird only half a shower door. Constantly getting the floor wet and not a good city view from the window. Other than that the over all atmosphere of the hotel was great!

title: Great room
text: Really nice modern and clean room with a balcony and a kitchenette. Good service and a nice peaceful place to escape the chaos of nyc. Didn't use the pool or gym but looked fine. Unfortunately no room service but plenty of eating options nearby.

title: Great for exploring NYC
text:
Good location in midtown, with subway just around the corner. Breakfast was excellent with few items but very high quality. Yummy bagels. There are other breakfast options close as well. Staff was friendly and polite. The new hamam in the basement was a nice additional treat after walking the streets of midtown. We used it every day! There is also a swimming pool.
The rooms/suites we saw were all nice, some with shower and some with tub. If you need an extra bed, be sure to pick the right room.  They have no " room service" but staff offered to pick up take away food from the neighborhood, for a small fee. 
Would  recommend to family and friends!

title: A Wonderful Surprise
text: My wife and decided to make a last minute trip to New York and stumbled across the Marmara Park Avenue hotel on line.  What a great find.  Perfect midtown location on a quiet street, a very attentive staff, a great breakfast buffet and bright clean rooms.  Even more it was an easy 15 minute walk from Penn Station.  But the best part was the Turkish bath in the basement.  Talk about a blessing at the end of the day walking around the city.  As New York City hotels go, the Marmara couldn't have been better.

title: Decent place to stay..
text: I did not get the value that I paid for. The hotel is still new and not well established. The rooms are fitted ok for a level of quality that the hotel targeted for. The personnel is helpful, yet not well established.. Reception area is pretty poor for the quality service that is targeted. Location of the hotel is a bit awkward.
