Although the hotel is located in the middle of Manhattan, it is far away from the parts of Manhattan.. None of the popular places and or business districts of Manhattan is in a walking distance. I did not get the value for what I paid for and the location of the hotel did not fit to my purpose of the trip.

title: Excellent Minus Two
text:
Upon arrival to the Hotel Marmara, we were smoothly checked in. Our Guest Room was very nice, roomy for NYC standards, and quite clean!
Our only concerns:
1) Housekeeping~Several items in our room were apparently thrown away(huge bag of Garrett's Popcorn, another to go box of food, and my makeup base)! None of these items were near the trash!
2) At checkin, the nice gentleman told me we do have breakfast in the AM. I asked him where, he told me just around the corner! We ate their continental breakfast~then we see we were charged $22 PP plus tax!
AND, we cash tipped the young lady not knowing we were automatically charged 18% gratuity. 
We did alert the front desk of the issue. They told us that 18% gratuity would be refunded~has not happened!
Beautiful hotel, staff very nice.....
Would we return~probably not!

title: Peaceful Sanctuary
text: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights. We had a great time the hotel is a quiet sanctuary from the noise and pace of the city. It is mid town and well positioned to explore the sights. The staff were very helpful and friendly. Our room was spacious , clean and included a kitchenette and balcony. There is also a pool, gym and Turkish bath. Highly recommended.

title: Excelente Hotel
text:
Servicio espectacular, cuartos excelentes en espacio, comodidad y amenidades. Excelente para el descanso y una buena ubicación. 
Un hotel con mucha tranquilidad! De repente se olvida que estás en la locura de una Cd como NYC!!
Es mi primera visita al Marmara y me quedo con ganas de regresar!

title: Where to start on how great this hotel is
text: I stayed with friends for four nights in May. We had two, two bedroomed loft suites which were huge and stunning. The kitchens were equipped with enough crockery and glassware to hold a dinner party and we were left complimentary wine, sparkling and still mineral water, sodas, Nespresso pods and tea bags. I had booked the accommodation for our party and I was thrilled with the quality of our suites. As for the rest of the hotel - beautiful pool, great bar, small but lovely breakfast and an AMAZING team working there. We couldn't have asked for better service from anyone, front desk to housekeeping - they were all so helpful and friendly. Big thanks to Tina on the front desk who simply couldn't do enough to help us and Lucien the night manager who was so lovely to chat to. Thanks to all at the Marmara - a fabulous trip in a great hotel

title: Great hotel great location great staff
text:
I stayed here for a week and I did not want to leave. I did have to switch rooms due to a faulty air conditioner but they were such pros about the whole thing I did not mind. Both rooms were simply fantastic. As a bit of a clean freak these rooms absolutely appeal to me. No carpeting!! No big drapes! Every surface can be swept or mopped or sanitized! The floors are beautiful dark hardwood and the kitchenette surface is caesarstone. Really attractive design. Excellent lighting throughout. The bathroom is small but perfect. As previously mentioned in other reviews there isn't space to spread out a bunch of junk. I did some reorganizing and used the bottom shelf. Not a big deal for me- and I travel with a fair amount of makeup and face lotions etc. Linens on the bed were divine as were the bath sheet size Turkish towels. 
There is no restaurant in the hotel but there are so many yummy places nearby and there is a very functional fully stocked  kitchenette. One of the upsides of no restaurant in the hotel is that there are no dirty room service dishes in the hallways. All the staff that I encountered was great- helpful and polite and friendly. Location is really great - fun shopping, restaurants and sights so close by. Highly recommend this place.

title: Beautiful hotel but beware of shady business practices
text:
My husband and I recently stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. It was our first time in NYC and we loved the hotel. It was clean and beautiful. We had a large corner room and enjoyed the Nespresso machine and Bigelow bath products. The heated floor in the wet bathroom and hard wood floors throughout the room were a plus. The metro station was just around the corner and easy to navigate. We didn't even notice the homeless shelter next door. But, and this is a big BUT, we had a terrible customer service experience which will prevent me from recommending this hotel to anyone. With so many hotels in NYC to choose from, people don't need to go to one that uses deceptive practices to make money off of its customers. 

When we first arrived, I was wondering if the hotel offered breakfast, but we didn't see a restaurant or food area - just a bar - so we weren't sure if anything was offered or not, other than room service. Nothing was mentioned when we checked in. Our second morning, however, there was a sign outside of the elevators indicating "Breakfast" with an arrow pointing to the direction we needed to go. We found a small dining table in a conference room where there were a few people eating. On the counter were some light pastries, coffee, fruit, and yogurt. There was an attendant replacing food items and we just assumed this was a typical complimentary continental breakfast that is offered at almost every hotel we have ever been to. There were no signs indicating otherwise except for a price list for hot breakfast items like omelettes, eggs Benedict, bacon, etc. We sat down to enjoy some food with several other people who came and went. Some folks grabbed some pastries and left, others took some food up to their rooms, one guy sat down, ate and then left quickly. My husband and I were mapping our day's events so we lingered for awhile. The attendant came and went during this time and only spoke to us when we stood up to leave. She asked us for our room number. She didn't ask anybody else for their room number, but she also wasn't in the room the entire time. When I asked her why, she said that breakfast wasn't free. I asked her why she didn't tell us that when we first walked in? She just let us eat and didn't say anything. There was no sign or anything to indicate that such a simple and sparse spread would actually end up costing us $55! I was furious. I asked to speak to the manager but I was told he was in a meeting. I asked to speak to a manager later that evening, but he was gone for the day. The next day was Saturday and the manager wasn't on duty and we had to leave to catch our flight. I left my business card with the receptionist and she promised she would speak about the situation with the assistant manager, who was supposed to show up that afternoon, and that I would get an email. I never received any email. 

I found their behavior concerning breakfast to be very deceptive and the lack of manager presence indicates to me that they're not very concerned about their customers or their satisfaction. If breakfast isn't complimentary then customers need to know upfront. Put up a sign or have the attendant tell you BEFORE you start eating. Having to pay $55 for a couple of pastries, coffee, and bites of fruit was absolutely ridiculous and the reason why NYC gets such a bad reputation. Now I know why people were coming, grabbing food, and leaving so quickly. We were probably the only schmucks they caught that day to pay for the food. 

As I said, this is a beautiful and lovely hotel, but if you decide to go and stay - make sure you're clear on their breakfast policies!

title: Didn't want to leave!
text: I learned about this beautiful hotel from an article naming the 10 best new hotels in NYC - and I absolutely agree. There are a lot of photos online of the beautiful lobby and it is just as gorgeous in person. Walking into that cool environment (both in temperature and vibe), the hot loud streets and stress of my travels melted away as the competent, zen-like, welcoming staff checked me in. The room, 1006, was stunning. The entry way was wallpapered with an artful, dark silk fabric and opened into a living space sunned from double doors that led to a small balcony. There was a full kitchen fully stocked with stemware, dishes, silverware, a Nespresso machine, top-of-the-line appliances and a lovely selection of beverages. There was tasteful contemporary framed art and sleek vignettes throughout the space. The bathroom had a soaking tub and very nice toiletries. The bed was big and comfy and the room's iPad had a pre-set music selection of ambient/loungey music to relax to. I loved my stay at this chic, artful, restful hotel and would recommend it to all. PS: Even if you don't have time to enjoy it, at least tour the downstairs spa and the exotic hammam!

title: Still a fine hotel, but needs to fix annoying issues
text:
This is my second visit to the hotel - still a great location, but the hotel needs to address some lingering problems to turn this into a five star stay.

First, as I reported last time, the design of the bathroom is problematic. There is simply no place in the bathroom to put down your toiletries, eye glasses, shaver, etc. With a bit of thought, I feel certain that the hotel could come up with a fix to this very vexing problem.

On my prior visit to the hotel, the soft drinks and bottled water were free. When the pleasant and helpful bellhop bought me to my room, he seemed confused about the current status of which, if any, drinks were free. He said "I think the waters are still free". But, after he left, the "minibar" information card on the table indicated that the waters would indeed be charged. Management should educate their staff better so that guests are clearly informed. Also, the "minibar" is really just an assortment of snacks, liquor, and wine, spread out on the small dining table, obstructing the table from other use. This is rather annoying, and again, I think management could find a better place to display these items,  perhaps on the spacious dry bar.

Other than these annoyances, this is still a good, comfortable hotel, in a great location, and with nice staff. With a little effort, management could turn this from a good hotel to a great hotel.

Oh, and the free wifi and free premium streaming movie and tv channels are still fantastic.

title: Staycation with Turkish Delights
text: This is in my neighborhood and as I have a lot of visitors coming into the city I wanted to try this new boutique hotel. What a delight!!! The rooms are so well appointed with toaster, nespresso and waterboiler in each room - this is a great find and has the perfect location to everything!! Make it your address while in NYC, you won't be disappointed!!!

title: Turkish Delight
text:
Was traveling on business.  Very friendly welcoming staff.  My room was clean with a fresh feeling.  There are no amenities falling short here.  There is a bar but no restaurant.  
Lavender-mint scented toiletries....Just Lovely!

title: Marmara high quality hotel, low quality service
text:
4 nights, 5 days last week. Great location, great rooms and space, enjoyable atmosphere. 

Simple stuff needs improvement: 
Noticed several black strings on the floor of bedroom - really no big deal, but they were there the whole 5 days so I'm assuming the carpet was never vacuumed. 

Asked for ice two different nights, after the third ask in an hour we had to leave to our events. It wouldn't be as upsetting but each time we were told it would be expedited. 

Checked in to our room, but it wasn't the room we requested. Had to move and they reset up the bar. The bar was only a half a bar service - we never used any but they loaded it to a full bar the next day and charged us for what was missing. We called the front desk they said they'd credit, credit not there when we checked out so they said they'd e-mail manager. Still no credit. 

Sent request to the concierge for car service on our check out day. Never heard back. 

Sent a request for soap, never heard from housekeeping. 

Coffee was not automatically replaced each day, same experience as above - request it, wait - request again, etc. 

All of that was exhausting and disappointing when we just wanted to have fun - not be annoyed.

title: Sleek Ultra Modern Turkish Design
text:
Stayed for one night at this new hotel for a business trip.  Enter the hotel entrance to a very cool white themed lobby wood-parquet ceiling.  Very smooth and soft but still inviting spaces in the lobby.  Very friendly staff.  Stayed in a spacious room with a small and well-equipped kitchen, undercounter fridge, drawer style dishwasher, plates and utensils.  The bathroom had a closet with an upright clothes washer and dryer.  The room was appointed with an iPad interface to hotel amenities.  Large flat-screen TV.  Valet laundry service.  Printer service by the concierge.  i emailed the document and the concierge delivered it to me at the gym where I said I would be, delivered in a very private and discrete envelope.  Toiletries are a lovely lavender-mint scent, complete with shave and toothbrush kit if you need it.
The gym is relatively small but well-equipped for cardio 3 treadmils and 2 elliptical, free weights.  There is a beautiful lap pool in the gym as well.  There is a turkish style bath I understand but I did not see it myself.  
I was able to visit the penthouse apartment, a beautiful apartment with balconies facing two directions.
This is a seriously beautiful and comfortable mid-town apartment, with no amenities lacking that I could see, other than the lack of an obvious restaurant, but I understand it is still in the works.  The bar apparently features turkish wines, which were also good.

title: An Oasis
text:
We arrived at the Marmara Park Avenue to a generous welcome and lovely bottle of Turkish sparkling wine in our room. 

The hotel is very elegantly designed with a luxury Eastern influence. The room in which we stayed was a very spacious and Mid-town location is excellent. Staff are super friendly and helpful.

Taking a dip in the pool or relaxing in the hammam is a perfect way to end a day exploring NYC. Also sets things up nicely for a cocktail at the excellent bar.

title: All We Hoped for and More!
text: We chose The Marmara Park Avenue for a 4-night stay to celebrate hubby's birthday - a significant one - and booked ahead based on a recommendation from a friend and reviews of the hotel.  Almost as soon as I had completed the reservation, I received a wonderfully warm email from Tina Beqiri, Concierge, and any requests I had were dealt with so professionally.  This warmth and professionalism was echoed throughout our entire visit and the team at Marmara Park Avenue were absolutely wonderful.  Complimentary champagne awaited us in our beautifully appointed room which boasted wonderful cityscape views of Manhattan from our 14th floor room and terrace.  We appreciated the in-room iPad, the Nespresso machine and the supremely comfy bed.  The decor of the hotel is light, bright, and contemporary, having opened last year following a reconversion.  The bathroom is compact, as one might expect in NYC and the under sink storage is minimalist rather than utilitarian but we managed.  The fitness centre is well equipped and the pool and wellness centre is calm and serene.  This is very much a boutique hotel where guests are really well catered for and I would not hesitate in recommending it.  Location is great with nearest subway a few metres from the front door and cabs a-plenty!  Check it out!

title: Perle in New York
text:
Nach langem Suchen bin ich auf dieses Hotel mitten in Manhattan aufmerksam geworden.
Auf dieser Halbinsel ein gutes Hotel in guter Lage zu einem vernünftigen Preis zu finden ist nicht ganz einfach ... aber das "Marmara" erfüllt dies.
Wir haben ein sehr schönes und für Manhattan sogar recht großes Zimmer in der 15. Etage erhalten. Die Lage des Hotels ist sehr gut in unmittelbarer Nähe des Empire State Buildings. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich, aufmerksam und hilfsbereit. Explizit der Barkeeper, der bereits am 2. Abend "mein" Getränk kannte und mich mit Namen ansprach, wie auch der Concierge, der jederzeit hilfsbereit zu Seite steht.
Alles in allem ist das Hotel sehr zu empfehlen!

title: A little luxury in the heart of the Big Apple
text:
Fantastic boutique hotel in a perfect location with easy access to the subway - 33rd Street. We were impressed by the size of our room, comfy bed, Nespresso machine and great view of the Empire State Building from our private balcony.

Service was excellent and included hailing cabs and reserving tables at local restaurants. They even gave us a late check out on our last day and arranged our transfer to the airport. 

Our top tip is to book room only - there are so many places to eat nearby, you can get up and out early in the morning for a full day of sightseeing! 

Hope you enjoy the experience as much as we did and have a fun time in the city that never sleeps.

title: Stellar accommodations and guest relations.
text: This is an amazing hotel, very comfortable, amazing bed and great guest services.  My room was larger than your average boutique hotel which for me was very important so you have space for your bags and can still move around freely.  Front desk was very accommodating with recommendations where to go for shopping and restaurants.  They are professional and yet very personable down to the door host.  Only thing that would make this place perfect is a full restaurant which they don't have but breakfast is available and lots of choices.  I will definitely be staying at this hotel again!

title: Elegant and Accommodating!
text:
From the moment I contacted them at the beginning of February till the time I stepped into the lobby the first week in May, Lisa Darbasie and the staff at The Marmara Park Avenue were a delight to work with.  
I had to make arrangements for myself and 8 colleagues to stay in NYC for a week.  
We all marveled at the elegant chic lobby but were blown away when we stepped into our guest rooms.  All amenities were nicely appointed.  The ipads in the room were a nice touch.  Bathrooms were roomy and modern.  The bed was comfortable.  
Two items of note: 
1. I would have liked to have seen pot lights in the ceiling for a better lighting scheme in the rooms 
2. Breakfast should be included with all rooms.  It's a small continental breakfast and should be part of the experience.  

Overall our stay in NY as a group was great.  We had drinks in the lobby, walked mere steps to the subway, lounged in our rooms and would return again and again if our travels take us to NY again as a group or individually.

title: Wow!!!!
text: My husband and I stayed at the marmara for  our trip to nyc for  my 40th birthday. We were beyond impressed with the  warm welcome, hospitality,  services ,  decor,  apartment,  furnishings, amenities, views from our balcony absolutely  everything was perfect . we will be recommending this place to anyone  who is planning a trip to NYC. Thank-you so much for making my birthday trip to your wonderful city so memorable. We Hope to return one day.

title: Zeer goed
text: Prachtig hotel , gelegen dicht bij een Subway een hotel waar de gast een gast is , elke receptionist kent je bij naam en niks is teveel , geen restaurant ( maar die zijn er voldoende in de omgeving )perfect ontbijt , wij komen terug zeker de receptie was erg professioneel maar toch gastvrij

title: Spring trip to NYC to visit family
text: Can't say enough positive things about this wonderful Hotel just off Park Avenue in Midtown Manhattan.  The staff were wonderful especially Rick and Brian in the lobby bar and Tina at the front desk.  The property is newly renovated including the installation of a true Turkish Bath in the basement.  Our room was lovely and included what my wife called one of the best beds she had ever slept in.  One of us had an injury while in the city and the helpfulness and compassion shown by all was a blessing and a gift.  Way above and beyond all we could hope for.   Their efforts were invaluable in helping us navigate that evening and our departure the next morning.  If you are headed to NYC give The Marmara Park Avenue a try.  You won't be disappointed.

title: A fine, less-well-known hotel in a convenient midtown spot
text:
I stayed at the Marmara Park Avenue this April for the first time. I was pleasantly surprised on many levels, and I will happily stay here again. 

The Marmara does many little details that combine to make this a lovely place to stay. A pet peeve of mine is that stupid, rapacious credit card hold that hotels put on visitors. Marmara does it, too, but at a reasonable, easy-to-swallow $100 rather than the cost of the room for the entire length of your stay. A second small--but-appreciated detail is that the minibar is stocked and no additional charge. Thank you! Not having to pay $4 for a soda makes me want to pay for other services at the hotel and to leave a nice tip for housekeeping to boot. 

But those are just little details. The important things are that the rooms are big, the staff is helpful and competent, and the location is super easy for any midtown or East side activity. A 6 train stop is literally right at the hotel door, Grand Central is a few blocks North (or one subway stop), and Park Ave. cabs are plentiful. This is an easy hotel from which to maneuver in NYC. 

As other reviewers have noted, there's no restaurant. I don't count that as a negative. There's a gazillion services within a block or two of the hotel. Anything you want can be walked to or delivered. Plus, in addition to the stocked minibar, the minibar has room for other items you buy and there's kind of a kitchenette with plates, glasses, and silverware. In my room anyway I felt that I could've had anything from a business meeting to a romantic weekend in my well-appointed room. 

The hammam and lap pool are also pluses to be taken advantage of. Bring your swim suit. The spa/pool area is clean and safe and are next to a nicely laid out gym. 

The Marmara is great value for money. I liked many of their value added features. So, a comfy room, helpful staff, decent free wifi, and an easy location all add up to a winning combo in the crowded, over-priced NYC market. If there's any complaint it's that my bathroom was super small. yes, that's normal for NYC so I don't really hold it against them. Plus, staff told me I can upgrade to rooms with bigger bathrooms so I know it's not a feature of every room. I'll stay here again. Recommended.

title: Great hotel, great location, just missing a restaurant
text: We spent two nights in a two bedroom suite.  The room was outstanding and huge for New York.  The beds were great, the linens great, the bathrobe amazing.  Really liked the room - full kitchen which was well stocked with cutlery etc. Dining table.  Really it was huge.  There was a swimming pool that we used - children really enjoyed it.  A continental breakfast was included which was fine.  There is a bar which we didn't use but looked nice.  In the end the only negative is they don't have a restaurant so no room service. Staff were very helpful.

title: Super convenient, beautiful property
text:
My mom and I were in NYC for 6 days, and wanted to try out some new hotels so we stayed here for 3 nights, and then Hotel Indigo LES (very different vibe and lower price point) for another 3. The property itself is beautiful, very conveniently located and the staff helpful and friendly. Here is why it's 4/5 stars:

Room: The room was very clean and pretty big for NYC standards. It had a small seating area in front of the bed, a kitchenette with a kettle, nespresso machine and a toaster and a free minibar. The bed was super comfy, although we only noticed the next day it was a sofa bed?! I'm not sure if it was only our room config that had a sofa bed, but for that price, I was a bit surprised. But main point is it was soooo comfy! And the pillows! I would buy a few if I could. 

Bathroom: Very clean, well lit and beautiful! You couldn't open or close the door if you were going to the bathroom though because it was a bit small. Great amenities. But the water pressure in the shower was negligible. We asked the front desk to have it checked out and fixed because it was literally just trickling, so it was so cold and took forever to shower. We got back to the room that night and it was the same. The next morning we went to the pool and hamam and just took a shower in the changing room instead. The pressure was better there.

Breakfast: We were lazy and had breakfast for $18++ p/p but  would recommend going out and finding a bagel shop or breakfast place nearby. There are lots of options. But the breakfast area is a bar in the evening, and it was very cozy. I just love the lobby!

Location: Fantastic location. Right next to a subway station (1 minute walk). Very convenient, walkable (perhaps not in winter) to main attractions uptown (Times Square, Grand Central station etc.) 

Staff: Very friendly, helpful and professional. Carlos was great and very helpful! 

Overall, it was a great stay! The hotel is beautiful and chic, very convenient, the staff made it very welcoming, and most of all the neat freak in me was very happy it was very, very clean!

title: Topnotch place to stay in NYC!
text: I've stayed at many hotels over the years and this property stands out. I'd say it's one of the hidden jewels in Midtown. Brand new hotel, beautiful lobby, super clean and spacious rooms, first class service from a very pleasant and great staff. Some extra features worth noting is the pool and Turkish bath. Other added amenities that makes the stay unique is the complimentary mini bar in each room which includes sodas, water and a nespresso coffee maker. It's a MUST stay!

title: Midtown Manhattan's best kept secret
text: Had an excellent experience staying in this hotel. Very convenient location (near plenty of nice restaurants and easy to catch a cab). The staff is superb. The room I was in came with a mini-bar prestocked with flavored waters that was completely free. The room was spacious and well-decorated. I have never stayed at a hotel in New York that had a larger bathroom. The soaps, shampoos etc from CD Bigelow were also fantastic. The only thing I would warn visitors to be careful about is to make sure you check into the RIGHT Marmara. Our travel agent mistakenly booked us into the Marmara Manhattan which is much further uptown. If you want to stay in midtown make sure they book you in the Marmara PARK AVENUE. I will definitely stay there again whenever I travel to NYC.

title: Gran hotel
text:
Todo fabuloso, en la misma puerta ya el trato es espectacular, Víctor y Fernando son encantadores , en recepción te ayudan en todo lo que necesites , las habitaciones preciosas con grandes y cómodas camas , la piscina y él hamman una maravilla.
La situación a dos manzanas de la quinta y del empire ideal para recorrer todo el midtown andando

title: Amazing hotel!
text: First, the staff there is great! Very attentive and professional. The room we had (a deluxe) was perfect! Very spacious with a view of the empire state building. The mini-fridge was filled with complimentary water and soft drinks which is a nice touch. it is true that there is not much space to put your things in the bathroom, but given the rest of the room, it did not bother us at all. Make sure you try the turkish hammam downstairs, very relaxing! I higly recommend this place!

title: Perfect Choice
text:
I spent almost 5 nights in NYC. I've been very happy to have chosen the Marmara Park Avenue.
The room was big and comfortable, the service was very good and helpful.
The position is absolutely perfect and I surely suggest to use this structure for Position - Price and Complimentary Service.

title: Spa in the City
text:
We thought this hotel was simply fantastic. They kindly upgraded us to a king bed and a room with a bit of a view. The oversized windows actually open up from the top and as someone who likes fresh air I really appreciated that. It made sleeping under their cosy duvet and on their giant pillows even better. (One firm, one soft for each guest). 

Kudos to the designers for creating a truly relaxing experience in such a busy city. After seven or eight hours of walking New York you need a way to rest deeply and quickly so that you can keep going into the night. The Turkish bath is probably the most luxurious and effective way I've ever experienced of doing that. Not to worry, if like me you don't know what the heck to do as there is a very kind and informative attendant who explains how to get the full experience.  An entire floor of the hotel is dedicated to exercise and relaxation and it's done with the same elegance and eye for detail as the lobby. The Turkish bath is reason enough to want to return to this hotel on our next visit.

title: Intimate Hotel for Relaxing Stay
text:
ARRIVAL  first Impression 
It’s not a Hotel it’s a home abroad,!
I’ve been so many time in NYC but this is the only one that I feel so well
The moment you reach it you find smiling doorman welcome you, and when you get inside you feel a wonderful fragrance (they put the scent in air conditioners system )
The reception is  total white with working fireplace and sofa for relaxing or waiting for check in - out
At the check-in every Receptions are very professional and familiar like your personal secretary
ROOM
I choose Suite 1605  with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms even I was in couple o be more 'practical being a business trip
1 masteroom King bed with closet and bathroom inside with shower 
1 bedroom a little bit smaller  but with King bed the closet is just outside the door nearest to the 2nd bathroom with shower much more bigger that the one in the masteroom it can be used for people with disabilities 
Professional Hairdryer are in both bathrooms , Beauty products and amenities are of a famous american company of natural products
I believe I would add a few shelves or an additional point of support  I have 3 beauty  and I had placed them on the floor 
The dining area is equipped with microwave, nespresso machine, kettle, cups, glasses, dishes a complimentary minibar with soft drinks
There aren’t :
-	IronBoard and Iron   
Housekeeping service : During my stay  there wasn’t a turn down service 
I never found a chocolate on pillow  or bed , turn my bed down 
I suggest to improve this service and may be…light a small perfumed-candle to make the room pleasant when people return back to sleep 
BREAKFAST
Served in a small intimate section of the hotel on left side of the reception
Breakfast is european style ,continental, like in a brasserie in France  coffee, confectionery, coffe, different type of milk, yogurt , juice etc 
You could ask  for a tray and take your personal breakfast in your room ! Amazing if you are in a room like mine
SPA
It’s complimentary, having Turkish Hamman and a swim in the pool after working and… walking all day long was so fantastic but they should add loungers-bed (like sunbed) to relax
In Women-Men changing Room You could find lockers, wc, showersbeauty products (shampoo shower gel conditionair, bathrobes, towels but not Hairdryer
but there aren’t hairdryer in Ladies-Men locker rooms

The Hotel has no restaurant itself
The Hotel has no laundry itself but an outside company days off sat-sun

If I will return to NYC I will choose again this hotel even for the excellent location and restaurants, supermarket, nearest it you could pick your staff at having catering in your suite/loft and live like at Home

title: Didn't feel 5 star
text:
The room I was in was quite small and lacked any real 5 star amenities. No mini bar, fridge or room service menu. There was a problem with the window and it wouldn't close. I reported it during the daytime but it wasn't fixed and when I came back at night there was nobody around in maintenance to fix it.

The staff were very friendly and professional and the location is excellent. Maybe I was just given a poor room.

title: First Class Hotel in a Great Location
text: This hotel was in the perfect location for me, close to Penn Station, but yet walking (or close subway station) distance from Central Park, Flatiron (Eataly), and a lot of great local restaurants.  From the smiling and friendly receptionist at the front desk, quiet and romantic atmosphere, and clean, modern room with great flat screen TV, I enjoyed every moment at this hotel.  Even having a cocktail at the brand new bar before heading up to sleep was pleasant.  Rick, the bartender gave us some ideas for eating and shopping the next day.  We were treated very well all weekend and would not hesitate to come back.

title: Great new Hotel in Midtown, NYC
text:
This is a brand new hotel located on 32nd and Lexington.  The hotel is clean, nicely decorated in a modern style.  The staff is very friendly and helpful.  The run was big, nicely laid out, had a great balcony with a view of the Empire State Building.  Additionally, and I think this is a fantastic practice, they stock the fridge with beverages that are provided at no additional charge.  

I highly suggest this hotel, one of the best I have stayed at in NYC.

title: Amazing Hotel
text: The service and amenities are impeccable. The lobby and rooms are just beautiful; modern, clean, and comfortable. French doors open to a terrace and There's even a pool! Great location...I will return

title: Romantic birthday weekend- what a treat!
text:
I just arrived home from a long weekend in NYC, where my husband and I were fortunate enough to stay at the brand new Marmara Park Avenue.  What a wonderful birthday weekend I had! Thanks to the wonderful staff for all they did for us. The staff is the cream of the crop---top notch!  I cannot say enough good things about this lovely place.  

This new gem feels more like a residential luxury condominium than a "hotel".  The hotel is definitely high end luxury, but unlike other NYC high end properties, missing was the sense of stuffiness and attitude.  The hotel is pleasant, relaxing, luxurious...and feels like a spa. 

There is a wonderful fireplace in the lobby, and some sort of aromatherapy in the air, also.  It's just heavenly.

The hotel actually has its own indoor pool, as well as a Turkish haman, which is basically heated tiled benches and "beds", where you may use the water feature to cleanse yourself, have a massage on the tiled bed, or just rest and recenter yourself after a busy day in the city. Its not overly hot like American sauna, but the tile is heated and this creates a relaxing ambiance unlike anything I've ever experienced.

Our room had a huge balcony (You MUST stay in one of those rooms if you can). Also, visit the bar area....the creative drink menu is fantastic. Front desk staff were very efficient and kind.  The service was world class, cordial, proactive---without being obtrusive or overbearing. 

Also, the hotel is steps away from a subway station!

I can't wait to visit Marmara Park Avenue once again. They made my birthday weekend something truly special!

title: Manhattan's Best New Hotel
text:
Many hotels claim to be boutique and trendy but fall short when it comes to the details.  The Marmara Park Avenue is an exception to this rule, masterfully executing a refreshing take on comfortable sophistication.  Its lobby is awash with crisp whites juxtaposed with the warmth of two fireplaces and smart use of metals.  Opposite the full bar is an installation of a flock of white birds which playfully complement the towering birdcage entryway; across the room is a table with water cascading down its sides.  Such a stunning first impression sets a high standard for the rest of the stay, but my experience was nothing short of extraordinary.

It became clear that the Marmara was no ordinary hotel when the bellman, Fernando, gave me and my friend a tour of our gorgeous room after he carried our bags upstairs.  He explained all of the room’s amenities, pointed out the view from our gigantic balcony, and encouraged us to enjoy the complimentary water and soft drinks inside the mini bar’s refrigerator.

We were quite impressed by the size, design, and cleanliness of our room.  Its furnishings were beautiful and contemporary yet comfortable and functional.  The clean white walls near the bed popped against the dark and dramatic wallpaper in the entryway, and its wall of windows let in both ample natural light and views of the Empire State and Chrysler buildings.  But the real showstopper was the spotless marble bathroom, complete with a spacious glass shower and floor-to-ceiling mirror.  When I made the reservation with the concierge, Franck, he said he would put us in his favorite room, and I believe he actually did.

The OneOneFour Bar is reason enough to visit The Marmara.  I had the pleasure of being served by Rick, the bar manager, with whom I had a great conversation about whiskeys - my drink of choice for the night - and his passion for mixology.  It was refreshing to speak with someone so knowledgable about his craft; sitting at his bar was like visiting a friend.  I have since been back to OneOneFour to sample Rick’s new signature cocktail menu which he has expertly formulated to compete with the best bars in Manhattan.

The staff at The Marmara went out of their way to make our stay as effortless and enjoyable as possible.  Prior to our arrival, Franck personally reached out to us offering his assistance with planning our weekend activities.  He was able to work with Rick to confirm a reservation at an exclusive nearby lounge, something I was not able to secure on my own.  The front desk also graciously accommodated a late checkout the following day, even storing our luggage for the afternoon while we went sightseeing.  Both were free of charge and much appreciated gestures.

I cannot wait until my next stay at The Marmara.  It has earned itself this discerning guest’s approval, not only for its exquisite design and amenities, but also for its staff’s genuine desire to provide unparalleled service.  It’s an A+ in my book.

title: New, beautifully designed cozy boutique hotel
text: Every detail of this special little hotel is well thought out and executed. I was enchanted with the design from the moment we walked through the beautiful doors. We had a roomy King suite (for NYC standards) that had a great living room/dining area, good closet space and even a view. We felt like we had a NYC apartment for the weekend. The staff was always friendly, smiling and helpful. We did use the gym which though small had everything we needed and was all brand new. We also used the Hamman- a Turkish "warm room" like a sauna which was gorgeous and very relaxing. We enjoyed cocktails in the lounge with some family that lives in the area and the bartender was very friendly and professional. It seemed that everyone there was very proud of their new hotel. Fortunately, our son lives nearby so we will definitely return!

title: Fantastic bar and lounge
text:
Hidden gem in the Murray Hill/NoMad neighborhood.  Beautifully sleek lounge area with a great vibe. Bartender/Mixologist Rick is fantastic!  He has sublime concoctions he's thought up and is also happy to create a personalized drink for you based on your preferences. Likely the best cocktails to be found in the area.
Highly recommend, great find!

title: Trendy and Fabulous!
text:
I will definitely be back to this lovely and trendy hotel! First, Franck, the Office Manager, emailed me to ask if there was anything I needed before my arrival. I told him it was my first time to NYC and he made sure my trip was nothing short of spectacular. I had a view of the city, a beautiful balcony/terrace, and every room comes with a complementary iPad.  

Tina was so helpful and welcoming when I checked in. She also sent up an iron and ironing board asap, as I had an interview to prepare for the next day. 

Overall, the star of the hotel is definitely Victor. He was so friendly, and helped me get acquainted to my room and the amenities. My balcony was absolutely gorgeous! Also, while I waited for my ride, Victor was kind enough to bring me wine in the lobby. He was so sweet! 

I think everyone appreciates the complimentary continental breakfast and happy hour. The white wine was my fave! I really appreciate my whole experience and I will definitely be back and will tell friends about this lovely hotel.

title: New and modern, with convenience and housekeeping issues
text:
I really wanted to give this beautiful new hotel 5 stars, but couldn't. Read on to find out why.

Positives: This is a very new hotel, according to the attentive and friendly doorman who greeted us on arrival the hotel opened in September 2015.  Unlike other hotels in NYC that seem to be re-purposed older office or apartment buildings, this building seems to be purpose-built as a hotel, and it shows. The lobby is beautiful and dramatically decorated, the staff seems eager and enthusiastic, and the rooms are very nice.  

The attention to service started as our taxi pulled up in front of the hotel. We hadn't even stepped out of the taxi, and the doorman had already popped the trunk of the cab and had our bags out and ready to go into the hotel. As we stepped out of the taxi, he asked for our name, welcomed us, and spoke our name into his sleeve. Seconds later we were inside, and the front-desk was ready with our paperwork for a quick check-in. Very professional!

The room was modern, but simple, and bright and nicely decorated. A large TV mounted on the wall provided ample (actual digital) content (why are other hotels still showing analog lo-definition content on modern LCD TV's?) as well as a lot of free on-demand content. This is as good of a TV offering as we've ever seen in a hotel.

Our "deluxe guest room" had  a larger minibar-sized refrigerator, and it was stocked with free soft-drinks and waters! Plenty of room in the fridge if you wanted to bring some takeout back to the room - which was also equipped with glasses, plates, coffee maker and pods, and a toaster. 

The furnishings are all very new and they show it, and the king size bed was very comfortable. As readers of my reviews may notice, I am a stickler when it comes to the sleeping conditions in a room (isn't that why you come to a hotel in the city?) - I insist on a comfortable, and quiet, environment to sleep. Great bed? Check. Super-quiet and effective heating/AC? Yes, and Bravo! I've been to too-many hotels in NYC where the heat/AC is super-noisy, and not terribly effective - leaving me shivering and putting in ear plugs to try to sleep through the racket. But not the Marmara - it has a beautifully engineered heating system. 

Oh yeah, and they have fast and free WiFi! I clocked it at about 30mbps.

Negatives: Overall, I am very enthusiastic about this new hotel, but I do have some concerns that are keeping me from giving this hotel 5 stars.

The bathroom - it is nicely decorated, with ample toiletries, but.... the bathroom had only one (partially used) roll of toilet paper, and was not stocked with a backup roll anywhere. Likewise, a near empty box of tissues, with no backup elsewhere in the room. So, we quickly exhausted the tissues, but luckily we didn't quite get to the end of the roll! Such a simple issue to fix - there should always be backup of these essentials somewhere in the room. 

More about the bathroom - I guarantee that the decorator of this bathroom didn't wear glasses. How do I know? Because there is nowhere, I mean nowhere, to put your glasses down when washing or showering. The sink has a sloped edge that is perhaps half an inch wide, and the back of the sink area is tiny. But there's no vanity. Other than the high towel rack with very widely spaced bars, there is literally nowhere in the bathroom to put your glasses, hairbrush, cosmetics, etc.... This is a major design flaw, and a significant inconvenience in the bathroom. (If you look on the Marmara's website for photos of the Deluxe Guest Room you'll see a small table to the right of the bathroom sink. Our bathroom didn't have such a table, and indeed there would have been no room for it)

One last issue - the shower head is mounted too low - and doesn't look like the one shown on the Maramara's website. Luckily, we are medium height, and only had to duck a little to wash our hair - but a taller person would have had problems. 

In summary - is this a great new addition to the midtown NYC hotel scene? Absolutely yes! Would I come back despite the flaws? Yes, but I hope they will  try to refine what is almost a 5-star act.

title: Outstanding service, wonderful rooms and location
text:
Our family of five stayed for 14 nights in December 2015 (husband, wife and three children 12, 18 and 22).
The location is fantastic. The rooms beautiful and spacious. We had a 2 bedroom apartment and a one bedroom apartment on the same floor. The one bedroom apartment had a huge balcony with a striking view of the Empire State building.
The service was the equal of any I have experienced.
In particular, Rick who ran the bar was a highlight of our holiday. He was warm, friendly, and generous with his advice and local knowledge. And a hell of a barman. His advice on restaurants and NYC attractions were outstanding.
We have nothing but fond memories of our stay at the Marmara Park Ave, and will be back.

title: On point, in every way
text:
Just back from a three-night long weekend stay with the family. Can't say enough good things about this new hotel. Really good rate for a bonafide two bedroom suite, which allowed us to really enjoy the room as a family, giving the kids their own bathroom and privacy, and with a real sense of security - more than adjacent rooms, each with access to the hall. Fit and finish is exceptional - hardwood floors, marble, tasteful art. Kitchenette was stacked with Nespresso and soft drinks, gratis. A small balcony gave us a place to enjoy fresh air and private phonecalls. Internet was free and fast.  Furnishings are upscale and comfortable. Bathroom and its amenities were very high end.  With the kids in tow, we didn't have a chance to visit the lobby bar, except for breakfast, but it looks nice. The property is quiet and upscale - more of a residential apartment feel. I would stay there again without hesitation ... and will ... 

If I had to make one suggestion - beef up the breakfast a bit. Selections of cereal, muffins and coffee were a bit paltry. But free is free, right?

title: fabulous find
text: Fabulous hotel! Service was above and beyond. Staff went out of their way to ensure we had everything we needed. Fabulous scent is infused through lobby area. Tried to find out the scent and wanted to purchase- was not able to purchase nor would staff part with their secret scent; absolutley divine! My only issue with our entire stay was the lighting in the room - terrible lighting; especially for anyone in need of applying make up. Great amenities! I give this property 4 stars, 4 diamonds and a def 2 thumbs up.

title: Luksus po środku Manhattanu
text:
Położony w prestiżowej lokalizacji The Marmara Park Avenue dopiero co otworzył swoje drzwi dla gości. W budynku z 1927 roku powstał hotel oferujący 128 pokoi i apartamentów, w tym apartamenty rezydencyjne na dłuższe pobyty oraz penthouse’y z panoramicznym widokiem na Manhattan. Marka Marmara to sieć luksusowych hoteli posiadająca głównie obiekty w Turcji. To ich pierwszy hotel w USA. Obiekt jest bardzo nowocześnie urządzony i dekorowany dziełami sztuki nowojorskich artystów.
Dzięki uprzejmości Recepcji otrzymałem upgrade do apartamentu na 15. piętrze. W pokoju czekały na mnie przysmaki oraz lodówka pełna bezpłatnych napojów. A na powitanie otrzymałem Prosecco i kartkę z życzeniami urodzinowymi. Bardzo miły gest.
Łazienka jest elegancka, wyłożona marmurem i wyposażona w kosmetyki marki C.O. Bigelow. Niestety dość mała. Brakowało mi deszczowego prysznica i miejsca na moje przybory toaletowe.
Każdy pokój wyposażony jest w tablet służący do zamawiania budzenia i sprzątania pokoju, ustawiania prywatności (zakaz łączenia rozmów telefonicznych i wchodzenia do pokoju), informowania recepcji o swoich prośbach i usterkach w pokoju. Tablet służy także jako odtwarzacz różnego rodzaju muzyki oraz odczytywania elektronicznej wersji gazet NY Times  i Wall Street Journal.
Z balkonu mojego apartamentu miałem widok na wieżowiec Chrysler Building i częściowo na Empire State Building.
Dodatkowo hotel oferuje strefę wellness z basenem, siłownią, łaźnią turecką oczywiście i gabinetami masażu, które mogą być wykonane także w pokoju.
Największym atutem The Marmara Park Avenue jest na pewno obsługa. Od uczynnych i uśmiechniętych recepcjonistów, przez profesjonalnych portierów, do pomocnej pani pokojowej, która kiedy zgubiłem się na korytarzu odprowadziła mnie osobiście do pokoju. Niby drobiazg, ale bardzo istotny. Jak mówi twórca marki Four Seasons Isadore Sharp – „Prawdziwy luksus nie jest zdefiniowany przez architekturę lub wystrój wnętrz, ale przez obsługę.”

title: Choice Location and great new hotel
text: Located on the fashionable East Side within walking distance of the Empire State Building, Madison Square Garden and Eataly, the Marmara Park Avenue is cool, chic, low key, accommodating and a great place to stay.  All rooms have kitchenettes with complimentary waters and sodas, toasters, coffee makers and intelligent iPads in each room.  Our room was a deluxe King which was very roomy for a NY hotel.  We had a tour of their larger rooms - studios, one, two and three bedroom suites which could easily hold corporate functions.  Views are amazing on the upper floors that have wrap around outdoor balconies.  Architecture and design are top of the line with marble, original art, clean lines and great lighting.  Staff are all very welcoming and professional.  They now have  a lifeguard so the pool is operational.

title: wonderful place to stay
text:
We loved our 2 week stay at the Marmara Park Ave. It is still in its opening stages but they seemed to have everything running very smoothly. 
We had 2 rooms, one a single bedroom suite and another 2 bedroom suite. The single room had a balcony with a view of the empire state building which was lovely (room1701) the other was spacious and lovely (1704) Both rooms had a small kitchen (microwave, fridge sink - no hot plate) Both also had a large lounge area and table and chairs.

No washing machine which was a pain for a 2 week stay, so if you're staying longer ask for one of the other rooms that have machines (the staff were so incredibly nice to us and let us use one of the unused rooms that had a machine as it was Christmas day and all laundry would not be able to be done for days - LOVELY STAFF AT THIS HOTEL) Laundry done by the hotel is not expensive though, we used it twice and it was fine (about $20 a bag of washing)
The beds are INCREDIBLE, so comfortable I could have stayed in it all day. Bathrooms are tiny, but who cares??!!! You are only in them for such a short time of the day! Give me a big bedroom and lounge room any day!  They provide a proper hair dryer which is lovely and a nice change from those ones on the wall!! (I have long thick hair, these things are important to me!)
We had weekly service to the room, this could have been better if it was every 4 days - 7 is too long for towels etc and rubbish piled up - they don't have a rubbish shoot on the floor to take it out yourself.
Breakfast was included each day - basic but nice. Could be improved only with providing bread and a toaster (they serve bagels and sweet buns and bread rolls and cream cheese and  jams) there is also apples and oranges and juice, yoghurt and coffee. So for a free breakfast I could not complain. The lovely staff were learning to use the new coffee machine and I am sure they will get better with time and practice. Most days they were pretty good! 
The highlight of our trip was meeting Rick at the bar, he befriended our whole family of 5 and not only gave us great drinks, but helped us with restaurant selections, places to go, how to get around etc. He is seriously a great bartender and we are so grateful to have met him. He is a big reason we had such a lovely time there. Each day we would head to the bar after being out all day and before heading out at night and he was always keen to hear about our adventures and guide us on to activities at night. He helped us choose one of our favourite restaurants in NYC and told us about an improv comedy night we would not have known about and one we loved. We also met Darius there and he is also lovely and helped us a lot.
All of the staff were just so incredibly helpful, kind and warm. From the doormen, to the girls and guys on the front desk, to the cleaners and handymen. Every single person we met wanted to help us and were genuinely nice people.
The location is fantastic. A very quick walk to the subway up or down town, 10 min walk to times square, 5 min walk to empire state building or madison square garden. Great spot
Highly recommend staying in this hotel for a stay in NYC, long or short. We will come back for sure. Thank you to the Marmara Park Ave for making our stay so wonderful. 
I know they are opening a food service/restaurant soon so that would make it even more wonderful.

title: Coolest Hotel in NYC
text:
Honestly the coolest hotel I've come across and had the pleasure of staying at in NYC. I missed out on experiencing the amazing swimming pool during my stay because it wasn't finished at the time so I'd check to see if it's completed. 

5 stars for it's design alone and with excellent staff and facilities it's a must. Special thanks to John and Julita for making my stay perfect.

title: Recently spend a glorious evening in a one bedroom suite
text: Our room 1703 was amazing. Had a view of the Chrysler building. Everyone was more than accommodating and pleasant. I am an extremely demanding client who have traveled the globe and have stayed all over Manhattan. Cannot wait to return in a couple of weeks. 5 star all the way. The spa is incredibly beautiful and luxurious. This is my new home in New York.

title: "I absolutely love this Hotel and all the Staff"
text: I  recently stayed at this hotel with my 2 children and by far it is one of my favourites. The hotel has been refurbished only in the last few months and has exceptional comfort & qualities.  It oozes luxury throughout, very modern & chic. When we arrived the manager could not have given us more help and went out of his way to give us a larger room to suit our needs. (not because the original room was small, because they are all big, but we needed an extra bed).  Victor was fantastic, even down to helping us out of our taxi with an umbrella in torrential rain!! It's location is excellent with 5th Avenue, Times Square, Rockefella & Empire State only being a 5-10 minute walk away. A massive thank you to the manager and all the staff  who made our stay so welcoming.

title: 5-Star - Hosted Corporate Event and Room Block
text:
My company used the Marmara meeting facilities for a sales conference in November/December, including booking a block of rooms for out of town colleagues. The quality of the meeting facility, rooms, and food was unparalleled.

I would not hesitate to recommend the Marmara to companies looking to host a corporate event or retreat.

title: Lovely hotel and staff!
text: I recently stayed at the hotel for a work conference. My entire experience was 5 star. My room was surprisingly spacious. The bed was extremely comfortable and I had a private terrace that viewed the Empire State building. The hotel is stylish and the amenities are top notch. The staff was incredibly welcoming and went the extra mile to make my stay a great experience. The only negative was that we experienced several technical difficulties with the conf. room equipment but the staff worked hard to try and remedy. I highly recommend this hotel.

title: Love Love Love This Hotel
text: The Marmara Park Avenue Hotel is so beautiful and chic! My absolute favorite hotel ever. The modern and chic design is just perfect with plenty of sitings in the lobby- bar area. The two fireplaces created such elegance and warmth! The room we stayed in was beautiful with plenty of space and we had a big terrace overlooking both the chrysler building and empire state building, couldn't have had a better location..The staff and service was superior. Julita who is front desk manager greeted us at our arrival. She provided us with excellent and the most professional welcome and service. Delicious turkish wine was on the house. Victor and Tiffany also excellent service as well as the rest of the staff. This was an amazing weekend and we will be back to this hotel many times in the future and this is my new home away from home.

title: 5 star experience from start to finish
text: The hotel experience was 5 star from start to finish. Everyone went over and beyond to make our stay as enjoyable and comfortable as possible. Angelina and Tina in reception were amazing and Fernando on the door was top quality. A free wine bar was saved daily as was breakfast. The satff were always happy to talk to us and tell us of good places to go. Nothing was too much for them. i would highly recommend. Excellent location - 3 min walk from the Empire State Building!

title: Beautiful hotel, great staff
text: We wanted to try Marmara as it is a new hotel and the pics looked nice. We were not disappointed! The lobby is beautiful and has a very welcoming feel about it. There is this beautiful fragrance in the lobby. We booked a Deluxe Room. It was very nice and spacious. The bathroom is small and there is no counter space at all. Due to some issues with the room, we got a complimentary upgrade to a one-bedroom suite. The rooms are very nice and well appointed. The breakfast in the lobby is a bit disappointing. They should really look at better breakfast options and have proper seating. But the best thing about the hotel is the wonderful staff. They are so friendly, helpful and warm. We had a lovely experience and think the minor concerns with the hotel are just teething problems. Give them some time and I am sure they will up their facilities. I will definitely go back to this hotel.

title: Not  a four star hotel
text:
This hotel opened within the last two months.The staff is very nice. Everything is new. My room was a good size and clean. However, the bathroom was very small without a place to put toiletries. 
I was on a business trip and got to the hotel about 8 PM. All I wanted was to order room service, have some wine and relax. Sadly that wasn't possible. There is no room service and the bar closed at 8 PM...so no wine.Yes, there are restaurants within a few blocks but I really didn't want to deal with finding them. I was told that these services would be there in the future....one would hope so.
The breakfast buffet was very lean...a few cups of yogurt, a few bagels/pastries, juice and coffee....but only two tables to eat at.
This is rated as a four start hotel and my bill with taxes was over $400. For a bit more (or at the same price) I could pick another 4/5 star hotel that provides these services.

title: Very pleasant stay and attentive staff
text: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised. This hotel is very well located with trendy decoration. The room was spacious, clean and comfortable. What surprised me the most was the very friendly and helpful staff.  It will not be my last visit.. I thoroughly recommend this hotel.

title: Accueillant
text: Cet hôtel est très bien situé au coin de Park Avenue et de la 32e rue. Chambre spacieuse et bien pensée. Notre séjour a été fort agréable. Si vous êtes à la recherche d'un oasis de calme et de quiétude au cœur de Manhattan, c'est l'hôtel par excellence. Tout le personnel durant mon séjour (3 jours) a été très attentionné à mes besoins et a su répondre à mes questions. Seul petit bémol, l'espace pour le petit déjeuner est un peu à l'étroit. J'y retournerai assurément!

title: A wonderful experience
text: We visited New York to celebrate my daughter's 21st birthday and the staff at the Marmara helped make it a very special occasion, they were courteous, helpful and always gave us a warm welcome when we returned from our days out. The apartment we stayed in was spotless and beautifully appointed, it's been recently refurbished to a very high standard. One of our TV's wasn't working properly when we arrived, it was sorted out immediately. The continental breakfast is served at one large dining table which we liked a lot, it meant that there was much more interaction with the other guests during breakfast. Obviously, being on 32nd street you're a stones throw away from some the best tourist attractions and only a $15 taxi ride to anywhere else. My only criticism would be that the corridors are a little too dark, I understand it's part of the overall feel but it was on the limit for me. Anyone considering staying here my advice would be do it, we had a wonderful experience.

title: Watch this space; the staff could make this new hotel fly
text:
As I have said before, we consider service throughout New York City to be the best in the world.  The staff at Marmara Park are outstanding even amongst this elite group.  Nothing was too much trouble, nothing caused a frown or an eye brow raise.  Although not a small hotel, it felt very much like a boutique small hotel due to the attentive and friendly nature of the staff.
Our room was so quiet that we slept solidly every night.  Our room was MASSIVE, thanks to a very generous upgrade, and as a surprise a healthy breakfast was included each morning.  Free WiFi, an iPad available in the room, full kitchen and laundry, bath tub, huge comfortable bed and beautiful Co Bigelow toiletries, with the 6 line on its doorstep, this hotel is going to quickly climb the Tripadvisor ladder.
Hopefully when we return the bar will be open as will the Wellness Centre so we can really make the most of everything the Marmara Park has to offer.

title: This one has it all.
text: I have spent many nights in The City. Some hotels have big rooms, a hospitable staff, pristine cleanliness, spectacular amenities, excellent location and appropriate pricing. I have never stayed at a hotel that had it all until I stayed at the Marmara.

title: Perfect in Park Avenue
text: We stayed in the Marmara Park Avenue recently. It was the perfect stay for us. The hotel is recently refurnished so everything is new. The rooms were big with large double beds and a bathroom with 'wet room' style shower. We had three external windows on the 13th floor so lovely roof top view. It was quiet too. The breakfast was continental style with excellent pastries and as much coffee as you can consume. The staff were superb. All very helpful and happy to chat. We got some great restaurant tips and then tables booked for us. The subway is just on the corner of the road and Empire State just a 5 minute walk away. What is not to like. Highly recommend.

title: Just opened boutique hotel
text:
This is a brand new design hotel.  The room was large by Manhattan standards and very comfortable but the bathroom needs another shelf to keep toiletries on.  Also, for the price, I would have liked a separate shower.  

The bed was very comfortable and the bedding was high end. Plenty of closet and drawer space and upscale design.  I would have liked a rug in the room, but the wood floors were attractive.  The hall was very dark, but that is my pet peeve.  I needed to use my phone flashlight to open the door. 

The staff, particularly at the front desk, were top notch and very welcoming and the complimentary breakfast- fruit, pastries, yoghurt - was really good. I also really appreciate free wifi in a high end hotel. 

This is a very good option for the neighborhood.

title: A hotel which ticks all the boxes
text:
Marmara ticks all the boxes:
Great location - 10 mins from Grand Central station, Marmara is located right in the heart of Manhattan 
Amazing service - welcoming people
Beautiful and comforting ambience - elegant and stylish interiors
Brilliant facilities - state of the art modern facilities 
I would highly recommend it
